analyzed: byis pa smra bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni byis pa slu bar byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase the demon's country means that the body is the country of the demon.üîΩ The phrase the demon

original: rtsa'i rgyud can ni rtsa'i dra ba yin la de gnyis kyi rgyud rus pa'i 'khrul 'khor gsal yod pa de la rus pa'i 'khrul 'khor rtsa'i dra ba can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtsa'i rgyud can ni rtsa'i dra ba yin la de gnyis kyi rgyud rus pa'i 'khrul 'khor gsal yod pa de la rus pa'i 'khrul 'khor rtsa'i dra ba can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The ‚Äúchannel-holder‚Äù is the network of channels. The ‚Äúwheel of bones‚Äù is the wheel of bones that is present in the continuum of those two.

original: sbubs dang dra bas dkris pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu @54b lhod par g-yogs pa la dkris pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sbubs dang dra bas dkris pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu @54b lhod par g-yogs pa la dkris pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚Äú Wrapped in sheaths and nets‚Äù means ‚Äúwrapped in a very loose manner.‚Äù

original: sbubs kyi dra ba dang rtsa'i bas dkris par gyur pa'i gnas te /
analyzed: sbubs kyi dra ba dang rtsa'i bas dkris par gyur pa'i gnas te /
translated: The ‚Äúsheath-net‚Äù is the wrapping of the channels.

original: sha la sogs pas bkab par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sha la sogs pas bkab par gyur pa'o //
translated: It is covered by flesh and so on.

original: rab tu gdungs pa'i bu snod de /
analyzed: rab tu gdungs pa'i bu snod de /
translated: ‚Äú The womb that is very hot‚Äù

original: mngal mi gtsang bas bsdus shing bsags pa'i gnas de la'o //
analyzed: mngal mi gtsang bas bsdus shing bsags pa'i gnas de la'o //
translated: refers to the place that is filled with and accumulated from the impurities of the womb.

original: skra dang so dang ba spu langs pa ste /
analyzed: skra dang so dang ba spu langs pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú Hair, nails, and body hair stand up‚Äù

original: 'byung bar gyur pa des rnam par goms shing rnam par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'byung bar gyur pa des rnam par goms shing rnam par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: means that the arising of those [impurities] becomes very familiar and changes.

original: gsal por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gsal por gyur pa'o //
translated: They become clear.

original: ngar 'dzin pa gsal po la sogs pa ni nyon mongs pas rang dbang med pa'o //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa gsal po la sogs pa ni nyon mongs pas rang dbang med pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú The clear self-grasping‚Äù and so on means that the afflictions are not independent.

original: rang dang mchil snabs la sogs pa ni dri na ba rung bar 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rang dang mchil snabs la sogs pa ni dri na ba rung bar 'gyur pa'o //
translated: and one‚Äôs own body, as well as phlegm, etc., are suitable to be smelled.

original: zhag la sogs pa ni mi gtsang bas gang bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhag la sogs pa ni mi gtsang bas gang bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The flesh is filled with impurities.

original: chu ser ni chu sman par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: chu ser ni chu sman par gyur pa ste /
translated: The lymph is the liquid of the body.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i gnas de la mngal gnas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i gnas de la mngal gnas par gyur pa'o //
translated: The embryo is situated in such a place.

original: phyogs gang du gnas par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs gang du gnas par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: In what part of the womb does it lie?

original: ma zhu ba'i ngas kyi ni 'og ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: ma zhu ba'i ngas kyi ni 'og ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: The text states: ‚ÄúBelow the stomach, above the intestines, to the right of the colon, to the left of the spleen.

original: gsos shing zhes bya ba ni rgyas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gsos shing zhes bya ba ni rgyas par gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚Äù ‚Äú Nourished‚Äù means it grows.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: zla ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zla ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The text states: ‚ÄúBy the menstrual blood, and by the semen.

original: zla ba nas zla bar dang / zla ba phyed nas zla ba phyed dan /
analyzed: zla ba nas zla bar dang / zla ba phyed nas zla ba phyed dan /
translated: ‚Äù ‚Äú Month by month‚Äù means every month, and ‚Äúhalf month by half month‚Äù means every half month.

original: dus dang dus gsum mngal gyi ri mi 'byung ba des so //
analyzed: dus dang dus gsum mngal gyi ri mi 'byung ba des so //
translated: ‚Äú At times‚Äù means at the time of the three periods of the month.

original: kun nas gsos pa zhes bya ba ni 'phel bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas gsos pa zhes bya ba ni 'phel bar gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Fully nourished‚Äù means it grows.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what?üîΩThe text states: ‚ÄúBy the taste of food.

original: kha zas kyi ros zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
analyzed: kha zas kyi ros zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdue to the taste of food‚Äù is stated.üîΩüîΩ

original: kha zas kyi ro khyad par ji lta bus she na /
analyzed: kha zas kyi ro khyad par ji lta bus she na /
translated: What is the special taste of food?

original: steng 'og gi so'i rim pas bcad nas lkog ma'i ming par mid pa dang / 'og gi kha chu mngon par 'dzag pa dang / steng klad pa'i klad rgyas kyis spags shing khyab pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: steng 'og gi so'i rim pas bcad nas lkog ma'i ming par mid pa dang / 'og gi kha chu mngon par 'dzag pa dang / steng klad pa'i klad rgyas kyis spags shing khyab pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: It is food that is cut up by the upper and lower teeth, swallowed in the throat, and then covered and filled with the brain in the head.

original: skyug bro ba dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba zas skyugs pa dang 'dra bas so //
analyzed: skyug bro ba dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba zas skyugs pa dang 'dra bas so //
translated: It is like vomit, because it is like vomit.

original: zas de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: zas de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that food?

original: mi'i zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: mi'i zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: It is human food, as stated.

original: gang mngal rgyal par byed pa'i zas de rab tu 'jug pa'i lam gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang mngal rgyal par byed pa'i zas de rab tu 'jug pa'i lam gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the path of entry for the food that nourishes the embryo?

original: lte ba'i bu gur zhugs nas zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
analyzed: lte ba'i bu gur zhugs nas zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
translated: It is stated: ‚Äúhaving entered the navel,‚Äù

original: nur nur po la sogs pa'i dngos por yongs su 'gyur ba nas sdug bsngal chen po'i tshor ba myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: nur nur po la sogs pa'i dngos por yongs su 'gyur ba nas sdug bsngal chen po'i tshor ba myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: and it should be applied that ‚Äúfrom the state of kalala, etc., up to the experience of the feeling of great suffering.‚Äù

original: mngal de khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mngal de khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the special feature of that womb?

original: smras pa / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / 'gram pa mngal du skye ba'i sha mas bcings par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: smras pa / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / 'gram pa mngal du skye ba'i sha mas bcings par gyur pa ste /
translated: He said: ‚ÄúThe hands, feet, lips, and so on, are bound by the flesh of the womb.

original: mngal kho na sha @55a * //
analyzed: mngal kho na sha @55a * //
translated: The womb is the flesh,

original: ma yin zhing pags pa'i snod des bcings par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin zhing pags pa'i snod des bcings par gyur pa'o //
translated: and the body is bound by that fleshy vessel, the skin.

original: steng 'og tu rgyu ba zhes bya ba ni gong 'og tu 'gro bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: steng 'og tu rgyu ba zhes bya ba ni gong 'og tu 'gro bar byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMoving up and down‚Äù means going up and down.

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: bshang khang 'dra bar zhes bya ba dri shin tu mi zhim pa /
analyzed: bshang khang 'dra bar zhes bya ba dri shin tu mi zhim pa /
translated: ‚ÄúIn a womb that is like a latrine,‚Äù which is very foul-smelling,

original: mun pa gnag pa /
analyzed: mun pa gnag pa /
translated: dark,

original: 'gred pa'i mngal du'o //üîΩzas kyi ro me'i dum bu bzhin du gdung ba ni rnam par mngon par brlan par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'gred pa'i mngal du'o // zas kyi ro me'i dum bu bzhin du gdung ba ni rnam par mngon par brlan par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and filthy.üîΩ‚ÄúThe food tastes like a piece of hot coal‚Äù means that it is very hot.

original: me ma mur ni me'i 'o bas so //
analyzed: me ma mur ni me'i 'o bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe fire-pits‚Äù are the digestive organs.

original: phyi rol gyi rkyen med par mngal nye bar gdung bar gyur pa yin pa de ni mngal ma brjed pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rkyen med par mngal nye bar gdung bar gyur pa yin pa de ni mngal ma brjed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe womb is heated without any external conditions‚Äù means that the womb is heated without any external conditions.

original: gdung bas g-yengs par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni btung ba shin tu bsten pa'i phyir btung bas zil gyis gnon par gyur pa 'am /
analyzed: gdung bas g-yengs par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni btung ba shin tu bsten pa'i phyir btung bas zil gyis gnon par gyur pa 'am /
translated: ‚ÄúDistressed by the heat‚Äù means that the heat is overwhelming because of excessive drinking.

original: spangs par gyur pa'o //üîΩ'dod pa 'am zhes bya ba ni bdag po 'am /
analyzed: spangs par gyur pa'o // 'dod pa 'am zhes bya ba ni bdag po 'am /
translated: It is abandoned.

original: gzhan shin tu 'dod par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan shin tu 'dod par gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú In the case of desire‚Äù means in the case of the master or the one who is very much desired.

original: rus pa'i 'khrul 'khor gnyis kyi sgo nas te /
analyzed: rus pa'i 'khrul 'khor gnyis kyi sgo nas te /
translated: ‚Äú In the case of the two machines of the bones‚Äù means in the case of the two machines of the bones of the anus and the penis.

original: gci ba'i lam gyi ming can las gzir bar gyur pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gci ba'i lam gyi ming can las gzir bar gyur pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚Äú In the case of the path of excrement‚Äù means in the case of the path of excrement, which is called the path of excrement.

original: gnod pa'i rnam pa chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gnod pa'i rnam pa chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One experiences the lesser, middling, and greater forms of harm.

original: gnod pa dogs pa zhes bya ba ni gnod pa gzhan las shin tu gnod par gyur pas na gnod par dogs pa des so //
analyzed: gnod pa dogs pa zhes bya ba ni gnod pa gzhan las shin tu gnod par gyur pas na gnod par dogs pa des so //
translated: ‚Äú In the case of fear of harm‚Äù means in the case of fear of harm from other harms.

original: bcad pa la 'gyur byed kyis reg pa ltar zhes bya ba sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa de la reg pa mtshungs pas so //
analyzed: bcad pa la 'gyur byed kyis reg pa ltar zhes bya ba sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa de la reg pa mtshungs pas so //
translated: ‚Äú Like a cut that is touched by an irritant‚Äù means that it is similar to a cut that is touched by an irritant that produces suffering.

original: ci zhig ces bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo la rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ci zhig ces bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo la rtog pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú What?‚Äù means a question about its nature.

original: ji ltar di'i zhes bya ba ni khyad par la rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar di'i zhes bya ba ni khyad par la rtog pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú How?‚Äù means a question about its distinction.

original: kho ma ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni kho ma pa phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: kho ma ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni kho ma pa phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú In the case of one who is endowed with a goiter‚Äù means in the case of one who is endowed with an excellent goiter.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba la sogs pa yon tan gyis rnam par brgyan pa'i skye ba yongs su len par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba la sogs pa yon tan gyis rnam par brgyan pa'i skye ba yongs su len par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase they take up births that are adorned with good qualities means that they take up births that are adorned with the good qualities of a buddha's appearance in the world, and so on.

original: g-yo zhes bya ba ni sems kyi gya gyu'o //
analyzed: g-yo zhes bya ba ni sems kyi gya gyu'o //
translated: The phrase they are not deceitful means that their minds are not crooked.

original: g-yo sgyu can zhes bya ba ni gzhan slu bar byed pa'i ngang tshul can no //üîΩdon spyod pa ni rang bzhin gyi don byed pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo sgyu can zhes bya ba ni gzhan slu bar byed pa'i ngang tshul can no // don spyod pa ni rang bzhin gyi don byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase they are not fraudulent means that they are not disposed to deceive others.üîΩThe phrase they are helpful means that they are naturally helpful.

original: bsod nams spyod pa'i sbyin pa'i rang bzhin gyis bsod nams so //
analyzed: bsod nams spyod pa'i sbyin pa'i rang bzhin gyis bsod nams so //
translated: The phrase they are meritorious means that they are meritorious by nature in their generosity.

original: dge ba'i spyod pa ni tshul khrims kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i spyod pa ni tshul khrims kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The phrase they are virtuous means that they are virtuous by nature in their morality.

original: legs par spyod pa ni lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: legs par spyod pa ni lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
translated: The phrase they are well behaved means that their physical and verbal conduct is irreproachable.

original: sbrang bu ni rma la sog pa za ba'i sbrang bu'o //
analyzed: sbrang bu ni rma la sog pa za ba'i sbrang bu'o //
translated: The phrase they are not like gadflies means that they are not like flies that bite and suck.üîΩThe phrase they are not like bees means that they are not like bees that sting and bite.

original: sems ngan par sems pa dang / tshig ngan par smra ba dang las su bya ba nyes @55b par byed pa can ni byis pa'o //
analyzed: sems ngan par sems pa dang / tshig ngan par smra ba dang las su bya ba nyes @55b par byed pa can ni byis pa'o //
translated: The phrase they are not like children means that they do not have evil thoughts, do not speak evil words, and do not commit evil actions.

original: thos pa med pa ni lung gi thos pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: thos pa med pa ni lung gi thos pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The phrase they are not unlearned means that they are not devoid of the learning that comes from scripture.

original: so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúordinary person‚Äù means one who is devoid of realization.

original: dka' ba nyes bya ba ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: dka' ba nyes bya ba ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Difficulty‚Äù means suffering.

original: 'khrug pa zhes bya ba ni rna ba bcad pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas lus kyi gdung ba'o //
analyzed: 'khrug pa zhes bya ba ni rna ba bcad pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas lus kyi gdung ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Agitation‚Äù means the torment of the body through the cutting off of limbs, etc.

original: dge ba'i chos bsgrub pa'i bya ba dang bral bas na le lo'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos bsgrub pa'i bya ba dang bral bas na le lo'o //
translated: ‚Äú Laziness‚Äù means the absence of the activity of accomplishing virtuous qualities.

original: gnas pa ni khyab par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni khyab par gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Abiding‚Äù means pervading.

original: sdig pa ni smad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdig pa ni smad par bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Evil‚Äù means that which is to be despised.

original: mi dge ba ni 'od pa ma yin pa'i 'bras bu 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni 'od pa ma yin pa'i 'bras bu 'byin pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Non-virtuous‚Äù means that which produces an unpleasant result.

original: 'dres pa ni lta ba dang ta ba ma yin pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bskyed par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'dres pa ni lta ba dang ta ba ma yin pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bskyed par gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Mixed‚Äù means that which generates the defilements of view and action.

original: yang srid pa'i zhes bya ba ni yang srid dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: yang srid pa'i zhes bya ba ni yang srid dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Existence‚Äù means that which is conducive to renewed existence.

original: nad dang bcas zhes bya ba ni kun nas gdung bar byed pa nyid yi phyir ro //
analyzed: nad dang bcas zhes bya ba ni kun nas gdung bar byed pa nyid yi phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú With disease‚Äù means that which is characterized by torment.

original: sdug bsngal kyi rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba la sog pa'i rgyud kyi sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kyi rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba la sog pa'i rgyud kyi sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The maturation of suffering is the result of suffering in the life-stream of a hell-being, etc.

original: 'jig rten pha rol du zhes bya ba ma 'ongs pa'i 'jig rten du'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol du zhes bya ba ma 'ongs pa'i 'jig rten du'o //
translated: The other world is the future world.

original: skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thob par byed pa nyid du rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thob par byed pa nyid du rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Birth, etc. are favorable because they are conducive to the attainment of the result.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa zhes bya ba ni gang shin tu brtson 'grus dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa zhes bya ba ni gang shin tu brtson 'grus dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
translated: One who has begun striving is one who has become endowed with striving.

original: mthun ston pa dang bzod pa ste /
analyzed: mthun ston pa dang bzod pa ste /
translated: Patience is the tolerance of harm from others.

original: grang ba dang tsha ba dang khro ba la sogs pas kyang gnas skabs nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grang ba dang tsha ba dang khro ba la sogs pas kyang gnas skabs nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One who is patient is not overcome by circumstances, because he is not overcome by cold, heat, anger, etc.

original: brtson 'grus dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rtag tu dge ba'i bya ba la brtson pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rtag tu dge ba'i bya ba la brtson pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: One who is endowed with striving is one who is always endowed with striving for virtue.

original: gong nas gong du mthar 'byung ba'i brtson pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir spro ba'o //
analyzed: gong nas gong du mthar 'byung ba'i brtson pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir spro ba'o //
translated: Exertion is the striving for the highest, because it is the striving for the highest, i.e., for the most excellent enlightenment.

original: thams cad bsnyen bkur bya ba la rab tu sbyor ba'i phyir mthu brtan pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad bsnyen bkur bya ba la rab tu sbyor ba'i phyir mthu brtan pa'o //
translated: He is of firm strength, because he is always engaged in serving all beings.

original: rtag tu sbyor ba'i phyir gces pa mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: rtag tu sbyor ba'i phyir gces pa mi gtong ba'o //
translated: He is not one who abandons his dear life, because he is always engaged in it.

original: 'dod pa zhes bya ba khas blangs pa ste /üîΩlus nges par gyur kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes bya ba khas blangs pa ste / lus nges par gyur kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúDesire‚Äù means ‚Äúvow.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúEven if his body is destroyed‚Äù means ‚Äúeven if his body is destroyed.‚Äù

original: pags pa zhes bya ba ni pags pa de tsam la thogs pa ste /
analyzed: pags pa zhes bya ba ni pags pa de tsam la thogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSkin‚Äù means ‚Äúskin.‚Äù

original: lhag mar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lhag mar gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe rest‚Äù means ‚Äúthe rest.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir gzhi med par ni ma yin no zhe na //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhi med par ni ma yin no zhe na //
translated: ‚ÄúNot without a basis‚Äù means ‚Äúnot without a basis.‚Äù

original: rgyus pa dang / rus pa zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyus pa dang / rus pa zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúTendon‚Äù and ‚Äúbone‚Äù are mentioned.

original: yongs su skams nas zhes bya ba ni yongs su skams par gyur pas te //
analyzed: yongs su skams nas zhes bya ba ni yongs su skams par gyur pas te //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving dried up‚Äù means ‚Äúhaving dried up.‚Äù

original: gang gi lus kyi sha dang khrag la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang gi lus kyi sha dang khrag la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúThe flesh and blood of his body‚Äù means ‚Äúthe flesh and blood of his body.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang ste gang yang zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang ste gang yang zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNevertheless‚Äù means ‚Äúeven though.‚Äù

original: skyes bus brtson 'grus @56a * //
analyzed: skyes bus brtson 'grus @56a * //
translated: ‚ÄúA person who exerts himself‚Äù means ‚Äúa person who exerts himself.‚Äù

original: brtsams pa'i sgo nas thob par bya ba gang yin pa de ni thob pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: brtsams pa'i sgo nas thob par bya ba gang yin pa de ni thob pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa ste /
translated: That which is to be attained by means of practice is what is manifestly desired to be attained.

original: thar pa dang de'i lam gyi bdag nyid can de ma thob par zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: thar pa dang de'i lam gyi bdag nyid can de ma thob par zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: Not attaining that which is the nature of liberation and its path, and so on, up to

original: bar ma dor brtson 'grus nyams par mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: bar ma dor brtson 'grus nyams par mi bya ba ste /
translated: do not let your effort decline in the middle.

original: yongs su gtang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su gtang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Do not give up.

original: dga' bo nga ni 'jig rten pa dang lhan cig tu mi rtsod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dga' bo nga ni 'jig rten pa dang lhan cig tu mi rtsod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Nanda, I do not dispute with the world.

original: brjod pa sna tshogs ni rtsod pa yin pa de'i phyir chos smra ba kho bo ni rtsod pa don dang ldan pa ma yin pa de'i phyir mi rtsod kyi 'jig rten pa nyid ni chos ma yin pa smra ba nyid kyi phyir nga dang lhan cig rtsod par
analyzed: brjod pa sna tshogs ni rtsod pa yin pa de'i phyir chos smra ba kho bo ni rtsod pa don dang ldan pa ma yin pa de'i phyir mi rtsod kyi 'jig rten pa nyid ni chos ma yin pa smra ba nyid kyi phyir nga dang lhan cig rtsod par
translated: And so on. Various expressions are disputes. Therefore, I, the Dharma teacher, do not dispute because it is meaningless. The world itself disputes with me because it speaks non-Dharma.

original: byed do // nga ni de lta bu zhes mi rtsod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: byed do // nga ni de lta bu zhes mi rtsod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: I do not dispute like that. And so on.

original: rtsod pa de la de lta bu zhes bya ba'i sgra yang dang yang du 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni de lta bu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rtsod pa de la de lta bu zhes bya ba'i sgra yang dang yang du 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni de lta bu zhes bya ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúthus‚Äù is used repeatedly in this dispute.

original: dper na kho bo'i gzhung ni 'di ltar mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: dper na kho bo'i gzhung ni 'di ltar mdzes pa'o //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúMy treatise is beautiful in this way,üîΩbut yours is not beautiful in this way,‚Äù and ‚ÄúOthers also say this and that.‚Äù

original: khyod kyi ni 'di ltar mi mdzes pa'o zhes bya ba dang / gzhan dag kyang de la de ltar rjod par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smra ba dang phyis smra ba brjod pa de 'dis nga mi 'dod pa de'i phyir de lta bu zhes rtsod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: khyod kyi ni 'di ltar mi mdzes pa'o zhes bya ba dang / gzhan dag kyang de la de ltar rjod par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smra ba dang phyis smra ba brjod pa de 'dis nga mi 'dod pa de'i phyir de lta bu zhes rtsod par mi bya'o //
translated: This is the expression of later speech. ‚ÄúThus‚Äù is used in dispute because of the expression of what is not desired by me.

original: yang na de lta bu zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'jig rten pa rab tu smra ba dang / de ltar nam mkha'i gos can dang / de ltar grangs can dang / de ltar bye brag pa dang / de ltar rig byed smra ba dang zhes bya ba de dag ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba yin te des so //
analyzed: yang na de lta bu zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'jig rten pa rab tu smra ba dang / de ltar nam mkha'i gos can dang / de ltar grangs can dang / de ltar bye brag pa dang / de ltar rig byed smra ba dang zhes bya ba de dag ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba yin te des so //
translated: Or, ‚Äúthus‚Äù means ‚Äúin this way,‚Äù as the worldly people say, ‚Äúin this way the sky-clad ones,‚Äù ‚Äúin this way the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas,‚Äù ‚Äúin this way the Vai≈õe·π£ikas,‚Äù ‚Äúin this way the VedƒÅntins.‚Äù This is ‚Äúin this way,‚Äù by that.

original: lta ba ste lta bar gyur pa de la rtog pa ni dpyod par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba ste lta bar gyur pa de la rtog pa ni dpyod par gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúView‚Äù means the view that has arisen; ‚Äúreflection‚Äù means the reflection that has arisen;

original: dpyod pa de la bzod par byed pa ni bzod par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: dpyod pa de la bzod par byed pa ni bzod par gyur pa ste /
translated: ‚Äúacceptance‚Äù means the acceptance that has arisen.

original: 'di ltar kho bo'i lta bar gyur pa ni mdzes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis kyang nga mi rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo'i lta bar gyur pa ni mdzes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis kyang nga mi rtsod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúI do not dispute‚Äù means that I do not dispute in this way: ‚ÄúMy view is beautiful.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThe nature of possibility‚Äù means the nature of the possible.

original: skal ba'i rang bzhin med pa nyid ces bya ba ni shin tu bdag nyid kyi phyogs su gyur pa ni skal ba ste /üîΩrung ba yin pa'i phyir skal ba'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: skal ba'i rang bzhin med pa nyid ces bya ba ni shin tu bdag nyid kyi phyogs su gyur pa ni skal ba ste / rung ba yin pa'i phyir skal ba'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: The possible is that which is suitable.

original: de'i dngos po ni skal pa'i rang bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni skal pa'i rang bzhin nyid de /
translated: The nature of the possible is the nature of that.

original: des kyang mi rtsod kyi ji tsam ngas mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa de kho na smra bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: des kyang mi rtsod kyi ji tsam ngas mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa de kho na smra bar bya ba yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúI do not dispute‚Äù means that I do not dispute in this way: ‚ÄúI do not dispute that much which I see, etc.‚Äù

original: mthong ba ni mig gis so //
analyzed: mthong ba ni mig gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúSeeing‚Äù is seeing with the eye.

original: shes pa ni rna bas so //
analyzed: shes pa ni rna bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúKnowing‚Äù is knowing with the ear.

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgyab ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas so //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgyab ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúFully awakening‚Äù is fully awakening with the mental consciousness.

original: mngon du byas pa ni ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: mngon du byas pa ni ye shes kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúRealizing‚Äù is realizing with wisdom.

original: rnam par smin pa ni gnyis te zhes bya ba ni bden pa'i don dang bden pa'i @56b don ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni gnyis te zhes bya ba ni bden pa'i don dang bden pa'i @56b don ma yin pa'o //
translated: The two kinds of results are the results of the truth and the results of the non-truth.

original: gnas med pa ni mi srid pa dang srid par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gnas med pa ni mi srid pa dang srid par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The non-abiding is the impossible and the non-occurrence.

original: ci'i phyir mi srid pa zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi srid pa zhe na /
translated: Why is it impossible?

original: skabs med do zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
analyzed: skabs med do zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
translated: It is said that there is no opportunity.

original: rnam par smin pa gnyis po'i dpe'i tshig srid pa 'di la skabs nyid med pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa gnyis po'i dpe'i tshig srid pa 'di la skabs nyid med pa yin te /
translated: In this existence, there is no opportunity for the two kinds of results,

original: bcom ldan 'das ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the Blessed One has abandoned the afflictions along with their traces.

original: yang dag pa gsung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang dag pa gsung ba zhes bya ba ni yod pa'i dngos po gnas pa bzhin gsung ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa gsung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang dag pa gsung ba zhes bya ba ni yod pa'i dngos po gnas pa bzhin gsung ba'o //
translated: The one who speaks the truth, etc. means that the one who speaks the truth speaks in accordance with the nature of things.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa thog par ston par mdzad pa nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das ni bden pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa thog par ston par mdzad pa nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das ni bden pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One is the one who speaks the truth because he teaches the truth of suffering, etc. first.

original: don dam pa'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa ston par mdzad pa'i phyir chogs gsung ba'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa ston par mdzad pa'i phyir chogs gsung ba'o //
translated: He is the one who teaches the Dharma because he teaches the ultimate Dharma, which is nirvana.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa la kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid dang / don dam pa'i bden pa la don dam pa'i bden pa nyid du 'doms par mdzad pa'i phyir de kho na nyid gsung ba'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa la kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid dang / don dam pa'i bden pa la don dam pa'i bden pa nyid du 'doms par mdzad pa'i phyir de kho na nyid gsung ba'o //
translated: He is the one who teaches reality because he teaches the conventional truth as the conventional truth and the ultimate truth as the ultimate truth.

original: ji skad du lung bstan pa de bzhin du 'gyur ba'i phyir phyin ci ma log par gsung ba'o //
analyzed: ji skad du lung bstan pa de bzhin du 'gyur ba'i phyir phyin ci ma log par gsung ba'o //
translated: He is the one who teaches without error because he teaches just as he has been prophesied.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i don sgrub par mdzad pa nyid kyi phyir don bzhad pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i don sgrub par mdzad pa nyid kyi phyir don bzhad pa'o //
translated: He is the one who teaches the meaning because he accomplishes the desired goal.

original: sdug bsngal las grol bar mdzad pa nyid kyi phyir phan par bzhed pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal las grol bar mdzad pa nyid kyi phyir phan par bzhed pa'o //
translated: He is the one who wishes to benefit because he liberates from suffering.

original: thar pa'i bde ba rtsol bar mdzad pa nyid kyi phyir bde bar bzhed pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa'i bde ba rtsol bar mdzad pa nyid kyi phyir bde bar bzhed pa'o //
translated: He is the one who wishes happiness because he strives for the happiness of liberation.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir reg par bzhen pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir reg par bzhen pa'o //
translated: He is the one who wishes to touch because he is the cause of the happiness of samadhi.

original: yon tan rnyed pa ni grub pa yin la /
analyzed: yon tan rnyed pa ni grub pa yin la /
translated: The attainment of good qualities is success.

original: rnyed pa skyong par byed pa ni bde ba yin te de bzhed pa nyid kyi phyir grub pa dang bde bar bzhed pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa skyong par byed pa ni bde ba yin te de bzhed pa nyid kyi phyir grub pa dang bde bar bzhed pa'o //
translated: He is the one who wishes for their attainment and happiness, because he is the one who wishes for their attainment and happiness.

original: lam mkhyen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: lam mkhyen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: He is the one who knows the path, etc.

original: gzhan la mkho ba'i lam yongs su mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyir lam mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la mkho ba'i lam yongs su mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyir lam mkhyen pa'o //
translated: He is the one who knows the path because he fully knows the path that is necessary for others.

original: rang rig pa nyid kyi rgyud la mnga' ba'i lam yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir lam rig pa'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid kyi rgyud la mnga' ba'i lam yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir lam rig pa'o //
translated: He is the one who is aware of the path because he fully knows the path that is present in his own mind continuum through self-awareness.

original: thams cad kyi thog mar lam ston pa nyid kyi phyir lam ston par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi thog mar lam ston pa nyid kyi phyir lam ston par mdzad pa'o //
translated: He is the one who teaches the path because he teaches the path at the very outset of all.

original: rgyud gzhan lam la rab tu 'dzud pa mdzad pa nyid kyi phyir lam 'chad pa'o //üîΩyongs su 'dren par byed cing rab tu 'dren par byed pa'i phyir yongs su 'dren pa yin la /
analyzed: rgyud gzhan lam la rab tu 'dzud pa mdzad pa nyid kyi phyir lam 'chad pa'o // yongs su 'dren par byed cing rab tu 'dren par byed pa'i phyir yongs su 'dren pa yin la /
translated: He is the one who explains the path because he causes others to enter the path.üîΩHe is the one who leads the path because he leads and guides.

original: lam gyi yongs su 'dren pa gang la mnga' ba de ni lam kun du 'dren pa ste /üîΩlam bshad pa'i 'dren pa'i sgo nas gdul @57a * //
analyzed: lam gyi yongs su 'dren pa gang la mnga' ba de ni lam kun du 'dren pa ste /üîΩlam bshad pa'i 'dren pa'i sgo nas gdul @57a * //
translated: He is the one who is endowed with the leading of the path because he is endowed with the leading of the path.üîΩHe is the one who guides through the explanation of the path because he guides through the explanation of the path.

original: bya'i skye bo mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du phyin par mdzad pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ni lam gyi 'dren pa'o //
analyzed: bya'i skye bo mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du phyin par mdzad pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ni lam gyi 'dren pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One is the guide on the path because he causes all living beings to go to the city of nirvana.

original: 'jig rten pa ni ma dad pa zhes bya ba ni dad pa'i nor med pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa ni ma dad pa zhes bya ba ni dad pa'i nor med pa'o //
translated: The world is without faith means without the wealth of faith.

original: dbang po rnams kyi bran zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnams kyi dbang du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi bran zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnams kyi dbang du 'gro ba ste /
translated: The world is a slave to the sense faculties means that it is under the control of the sense faculties.

original: dbang po'i dbang gis yul rnams la rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i dbang gis yul rnams la rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it engages with objects under the power of the sense faculties.

original: mngon sum gyi dus su gyur pa'i dngos po ni de'i tshe nyid yin la /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi dus su gyur pa'i dngos po ni de'i tshe nyid yin la /
translated: The thing that is present at the time of direct perception is just that at that time.

original: de'i tshe nyid du tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa'i phyir ma rig pa ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe nyid du tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa'i phyir ma rig pa ste /
translated: Because it makes conventions just at that time, it is ignorance.

original: 'jig rten pha rol gyi 'bras bu la ltos par mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol gyi 'bras bu la ltos par mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that it does not take into account the result in a future world.

original: lag tu chud pa ni lag par 'ongs pa yin la lag par 'ongs pa la lta ba'i ngang tshul gyi rang bzhin gang la yod pa de ni lag par 'ongs pa la lta ba can te /
analyzed: lag tu chud pa ni lag par 'ongs pa yin la lag par 'ongs pa la lta ba'i ngang tshul gyi rang bzhin gang la yod pa de ni lag par 'ongs pa la lta ba can te /
translated: The world is given to looking at what is in the hand means that it is of the nature of looking at what is in the hand.

original: lag tu 'ongs pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de brtan por 'dzin par byed kyi /
analyzed: lag tu 'ongs pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de brtan por 'dzin par byed kyi /
translated: Whatever object comes into the hand, he firmly grasps it.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i ngan song la ltos par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i ngan song la ltos par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: He does not consider the future bad destinies.

original: zad pa mang zhing zhes bya ba ni don du mi 'gyur pa mang ba'o //
analyzed: zad pa mang zhing zhes bya ba ni don du mi 'gyur pa mang ba'o //
translated: Many are the losses, means many are the useless things.

original: bsags pa chung ba zhes bya ba ni don chung ba ste //
analyzed: bsags pa chung ba zhes bya ba ni don chung ba ste //
translated: Small is the accumulation, means small is the benefit.

original: gang gi phyir srog gcod la sogs pa byas na dmyal ba la sogs par 'gro bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir srog gcod la sogs pa byas na dmyal ba la sogs par 'gro bar byed pa ste /
translated: Because by committing killing, etc., one goes to the hells, etc.,

original: sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa mang po nyams su myong bar 'gyur la sha la sogs pa yongs su longs spyod pa'i bde ba ni chung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa mang po nyams su myong bar 'gyur la sha la sogs pa yongs su longs spyod pa'i bde ba ni chung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and experiences many kinds of suffering. The pleasure of enjoying meat, etc., is small.

original: sla ba ni bde bas bsgrub par bya ba ste /
analyzed: sla ba ni bde bas bsgrub par bya ba ste /
translated: Easy is what is accomplished with pleasure.

original: lus la sogs pa'i legs par spyod pa yin la /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i legs par spyod pa yin la /
translated: It is good conduct of body, etc.

original: de mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de mi byed pa'o //
translated: Not doing that is not doing it.üîΩDifficult is what is accomplished with pain. It is bad conduct of body, etc.

original: dka' ba ste lus la sogs pa nyes par spyod pas bdag spyod par zhes bya ba ni gnod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dka' ba ste lus la sogs pa nyes par spyod pas bdag spyod par zhes bya ba ni gnod par byed pa'o //
translated: I will conduct myself, means I will harm myself.

original: dga' bo 'ong bas ni chog go zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dga' bo 'ong bas ni chog go zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: It is enough, Nanda, to come.

original: 'ga' zhig tu dga' bo la 'di lta bu'i sems skye bar 'gyur ta /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu dga' bo la 'di lta bu'i sems skye bar 'gyur ta /
translated: In some cases, Nanda, such a thought arises:

original: 'di ltar lung gi gzhung gi tshad mang ba de'i phyir de la shes rab kyis nyan pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed par mi nus so snyam pa de lta bu'i blo skye ba'i phyir chog go zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar lung gi gzhung gi tshad mang ba de'i phyir de la shes rab kyis nyan pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed par mi nus so snyam pa de lta bu'i blo skye ba'i phyir chog go zhes pa yin te /
translated: Because the extent of the scriptural text is great, it is not possible to engage in the activities of listening, reflecting, etc. with wisdom. Thus, the thought of enough arises.

original: lung gis lus la mngon par sbyor bar bya'o //
analyzed: lung gis lus la mngon par sbyor bar bya'o //
translated: One should apply oneself to the body with scripture.

original: shes rab kyis chog go zhes bya ba ni thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyis chog go zhes bya ba ni thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'o //
translated: It is enough with wisdom means that which arises from listening and reflection.

original: dngos po gang kho na sha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa de kho na tsam la brtag par bya'i /
analyzed: dngos po gang kho na sha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa de kho na tsam la brtag par bya'i /
translated: One should investigate just that thing which is seen by the fleshly eye.

original: de la phyin ci log gi blos bde ba dang gtsang ba @57b la sogs par 'gyur ba ni yongs su brtag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la phyin ci log gi blos bde ba dang gtsang ba @57b la sogs par 'gyur ba ni yongs su brtag par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not investigate that which is distorted by the mind, such as pleasure, purity, etc.

original: de las kyang phan yon du 'gyur ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de las kyang phan yon du 'gyur ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the benefit of that?

original: de'i phyir ji ltar mthong ba brtags pa kho na las thar par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar mthong ba brtags pa kho na las thar par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúOne is liberated only through the investigation of what is seen.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar gal te dngos po de mthong ba'i rnam pa de kho na nyid kyis dpyod pa nyid du nus par 'gyur ba de'i tshe de kho na yid la byed pa skyed pa'i phyir 'khor ba las thar par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te dngos po de mthong ba'i rnam pa de kho na nyid kyis dpyod pa nyid du nus par 'gyur ba de'i tshe de kho na yid la byed pa skyed pa'i phyir 'khor ba las thar par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if one is able to analyze reality just by seeing that thing, then one is liberated from cyclic existence because one generates attention on reality.

original: dga' bo khyod nga la dad pa'i phyir ma 'gro shig zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dga' bo khyod nga la dad pa'i phyir ma 'gro shig zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚Äú Nanda, do not go out of faith in me‚Äù and so on.

original: bdag la des brjod pa gang yin pa de bdag gis dad pas gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba 'di ni dad pa skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag la des brjod pa gang yin pa de bdag gis dad pas gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba 'di ni dad pa skyes pa yin te /
translated: ‚Äú Whatever he says to me, I will accept it with faith‚Äù is the arising of faith.

original: dad pa'i phyir 'gro bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa'i phyir 'gro bar byed pa'o //
translated: One goes out of faith.

original: bka' 'di la kho bo shin tu 'dod do zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis tha snyad du byed pa ni mos pa'i phyir 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: bka' 'di la kho bo shin tu 'dod do zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis tha snyad du byed pa ni mos pa'i phyir 'gro ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú I very much desire this statement‚Äù is the aspect of conventional activity. One goes out of aspiration.

original: 'di lung gis chen por gyur pa de'i phyir 'di'i lung gzhung bzhin du 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba de lta bu'i tha snyad du byed pa ni thos pa'i phyir 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'di lung gis chen por gyur pa de'i phyir 'di'i lung gzhung bzhin du 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba de lta bu'i tha snyad du byed pa ni thos pa'i phyir 'gro ba'o //
translated: Since this is the great scripture, one should engage in it according to the text of the scripture.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rjes su dran pa 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzugs la yongs su rtog pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rjes su dran pa 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzugs la yongs su rtog pa'i sgo nas /
translated: The recollection of the Buddha‚Äôs qualities is as follows: ‚ÄúThe Bhagavat Buddha is thus‚Äù and so on, by way of the investigation of form.

original: de'i gzhung la rjes su tha snyad byed pa ni gzugs yongs su rtog pa'i phyir 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de'i gzhung la rjes su tha snyad byed pa ni gzugs yongs su rtog pa'i phyir 'gro ba'o //
translated: The subsequent designation of the text of that is the going forth of the investigation of form.

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das de mthong bas shin tu mos pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis dpyad cing rtog pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das de mthong bas shin tu mos pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis dpyad cing rtog pa yin la /
translated: Here, the Bhagavat is investigated and examined by way of the aspect ‚Äúone who is extremely devoted by seeing that Bhagavat.‚Äù

original: rtog pa de la bzod par byed pa ni bzod pa yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa de la bzod par byed pa ni bzod pa yin te /
translated: Patience is the acceptance of that investigation.

original: des tha snyad du byed pa ni mthong ba la rtog pa'i bzod pa'i phyir 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: des tha snyad du byed pa ni mthong ba la rtog pa'i bzod pa'i phyir 'gro ba'o //
translated: The designation of that is the going forth of the patience that investigates seeing.

original: dge slong thams cad la 'di bsnyen bkur bya ba yin pa'i phyir bka' 'di ni gzung bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis tha snyad du byed pa ni dge sbyong la gus pa'i phyir 'gro ba'o //üîΩthams cad kyi sngon du 'di bdag cag gis ston pa nyid du khas blangs pa yin pa'i phyir bka' 'di ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis tha snyad du byed pa ni bla ma la gus pa'i phyir 'gro ba'o //üîΩgcig pu zhes bya ba 'dis ni lus kyis bden pa bstan pa yin la dben par song bla zhes bya ba sems bden pa'o //üîΩdon gyi yid dpyod pa ni sems pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong thams cad la 'di bsnyen bkur bya ba yin pa'i phyir bka' 'di ni gzung bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis tha snyad du byed pa ni dge sbyong la gus pa'i phyir 'gro ba'o // thams cad kyi sngon du 'di bdag cag gis ston pa nyid du khas blangs pa yin pa'i phyir bka' 'di ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis tha snyad du byed pa ni bla ma la gus pa'i phyir 'gro ba'o // gcig pu zhes bya ba 'dis ni lus kyis bden pa bstan pa yin la dben par song bla zhes bya ba sems bden pa'o // don gyi yid dpyod pa ni sems pa'o //
translated: The expression this is to be revered by all monks is conventional usage in the sense of going for refuge out of respect for the spiritual life.üîΩ The expression this word is not to be uttered is conventional usage in the sense of going for refuge out of respect for the teacher, in the sense that we have accepted him as our teacher before all others.üîΩ The expression alone indicates the truth of the body, and the expression gone to the forest indicates the truth of mind.üîΩ The expression reflecting on the meaning indicates the truth of the path.üîΩ

original: yon tan dang nyes pa'i sgo nas dpyod par byed pa ni 'jal ba'o //üîΩphyogs gcig khong du chud pa ni nye bar rtog pa'o //üîΩyang nas @58a * //

original: yang so sor rtog pa ni mang du byos shig pa'o //
analyzed: yang so sor rtog pa ni mang du byos shig pa'o //
translated: Moreover, one should repeatedly discriminate.

original: mngon sum du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni the tshom med par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni the tshom med par gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase having become manifest means having become free from doubt.

original: nye bar bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni shes pas yongs su rdzogs pa chen po shes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nye bar bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni shes pas yongs su rdzogs pa chen po shes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase having been accomplished means having been completed by knowledge. The phrase having been understood means having been understood in a great way.

original: bdag gi gling zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las yongs su skyob par byed pa'i gling yin la /
analyzed: bdag gi gling zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las yongs su skyob par byed pa'i gling yin la /
translated: The phrase my island and so on. It is an island because it protects from the cause of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal dngos las yongs su srung bar byed pa'i phyir skyabs yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dngos las yongs su srung bar byed pa'i phyir skyabs yin no //
translated: It is a refuge because it protects from the actuality of suffering.

original: bdag nyid gling dang skyabs gang yin pa de ni bdag nyid gling dang bdag nyid skyabs so //
analyzed: bdag nyid gling dang skyabs gang yin pa de ni bdag nyid gling dang bdag nyid skyabs so //
translated: That which is an island and a refuge for oneself is one's own island and one's own refuge.

original: chos ni don dam pa'i chos sam bstan pa'i chos yin te ;
analyzed: chos ni don dam pa'i chos sam bstan pa'i chos yin te ;
translated: The Dharma is the ultimate truth or the Dharma of scripture.

original: de'i gling dang skyabs gang yin pa de ni chos kyi gling dang chos kyi skyabs so //
analyzed: de'i gling dang skyabs gang yin pa de ni chos kyi gling dang chos kyi skyabs so //
translated: That which is an island and a refuge for it is the Dharma-island and the Dharma-refuge.

original: gling yang gzhan ma yin la skyabs kyang gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni gzhan la rag las pa'i gnas skabs las ldog par ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gling yang gzhan ma yin la skyabs kyang gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni gzhan la rag las pa'i gnas skabs las ldog par ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: This shows that one should turn away from a state of dependence on others.

original: gzhan la rag las pas gnas par mi bya'i 'on kyang bdag nyid kyis las su bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la rag las pas gnas par mi bya'i 'on kyang bdag nyid kyis las su bya ba yin no //
translated: One should not live in dependence on others, but rather one should do it oneself.

original: de skad du yang dge slong dag dgon pa'i shing drung 'di na zhes bya ba nas dge slong dag bag med par ma gyur par bsam gtan gyis shig / phyis 'gyod par gyur ta re zhes 'doms par byed do zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba yin no
analyzed: de skad du yang dge slong dag dgon pa'i shing drung 'di na zhes bya ba nas dge slong dag bag med par ma gyur par bsam gtan gyis shig / phyis 'gyod par gyur ta re zhes 'doms par byed do zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba yin no
translated: Thus it is said: ‚ÄúMonks, in this forest grove, etc., up to monks, do not be heedless, practice meditation, lest you regret it later.‚Äù

original: // nang zhes bya ba ni bdag gi dbang du byas nas nang zhes bya ste /
analyzed: // nang zhes bya ba ni bdag gi dbang du byas nas nang zhes bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúInternally‚Äù means that one takes the self as the basis and calls it ‚Äúinternal.‚Äù

original: rang gi lus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi lus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is synonymous with ‚Äúone‚Äôs own body.‚Äù

original: de la lus kyi rjes su lta ba zhes bya ba ni mi gtsang ba'i tshogs kyi rjes su lta ba yin te /
analyzed: de la lus kyi rjes su lta ba zhes bya ba ni mi gtsang ba'i tshogs kyi rjes su lta ba yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúContemplating the body‚Äù means contemplating the collection of impurities.

original: de ltar yang lus 'di la skra dang ba spu dang zhes bya ba nas klad pa dang klad rgyas 'dzag pa zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang lus 'di la skra dang ba spu dang zhes bya ba nas klad pa dang klad rgyas 'dzag pa zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Thus, this body is described as ‚Äúhair of the head, body hair, nails, and teeth,‚Äù and so on, up to ‚Äúbrain and membranes.‚Äù

original: so sor rtog pa ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas rtog pa'o //üîΩbrtson 'grus dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas gdung bar byed pas na /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas rtog pa'o // brtson 'grus dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas gdung bar byed pas na /
translated: Discernment is the investigation of the body in terms of its general and specific characteristics.üîΩEndowed with effort means that he is endowed with the effort that is applied.

original: gdung ba ste brtson 'grus de rtsom pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gdung ba ste brtson 'grus de rtsom pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Effort is that which torments, because it is applied in order to torment the body.

original: dran pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu dran pa dang 'byor bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu dran pa dang 'byor bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Endowed with mindfulness means that he is endowed with the mindfulness that is well-established.

original: shes bzhin dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: shes bzhin dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
translated: Endowed with full awareness means that he is endowed with the full awareness that is well-established.

original: zil gyis gnon pa zhes bya ba ni rengs par byas pa ste /
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa zhes bya ba ni rengs par byas pa ste /
translated: Subjugation means that he is able to control the body.

original: dus gzhan gyi tshe kun du rgyu bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gzhan gyi tshe kun du rgyu bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: At another time, he is able to move about freely.

original: brnab sems zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rdzas kyi yul la smon pa'i @58b mtshan nyid can yin la /
analyzed: brnab sems zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rdzas kyi yul la smon pa'i @58b mtshan nyid can yin la /
translated: Covetousness has the characteristic of longing for the wealth of others.

original: don ma thob pa'i snga rol gyi sems yongs su gdung ba ni yid mi bde ba yin te /
analyzed: don ma thob pa'i snga rol gyi sems yongs su gdung ba ni yid mi bde ba yin te /
translated: Mental dissatisfaction is the torment of the mind prior to the attainment of the object.

original: brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba zhes bya ba zil gyis gnon pa'o //
analyzed: brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba zhes bya ba zil gyis gnon pa'o //
translated: Thus, the subjugation of covetousness and mental dissatisfaction is mentioned.

original: yul gang la zhe na /
analyzed: yul gang la zhe na /
translated: With regard to what object?

original: smras pa / 'jig rten te nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i rang bzhin la'o //
analyzed: smras pa / 'jig rten te nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i rang bzhin la'o //
translated: It is said: with regard to the world, which has the nature of the five appropriative aggregates.üîΩThe internal body refers to one‚Äôs own continuum.

original: phyi'i lus la zhes bya ba ni pha rol po'i rgyud du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: phyi'i lus la zhes bya ba ni pha rol po'i rgyud du gyur pa'o //
translated: The external body refers to the continuum of another.

original: phyi nang gi lus la zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud dang gcig pa 'brel par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: phyi nang gi lus la zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud dang gcig pa 'brel par gyur pa'o //
translated: The internal-external body refers to the connection with one‚Äôs own and another‚Äôs continuum.

original: kun 'byung gi chos la rjes su lta zhing zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi lus 'di la kun 'byung zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: kun 'byung gi chos la rjes su lta zhing zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi lus 'di la kun 'byung zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The contemplation of the origination of the body is the contemplation of the origination of one‚Äôs own body.

original: 'di las sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas so //
analyzed: 'di las sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas so //
translated: This is because suffering originates from this.

original: zad pa'i chos la rjes su lta zhing zhes bya ba ni lus 'di gdon mi za bar 'jig par 'gyur ba'o zhes dpyod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zad pa'i chos la rjes su lta zhing zhes bya ba ni lus 'di gdon mi za bar 'jig par 'gyur ba'o zhes dpyod par byed pa'o //
translated: One contemplates the body as subject to destruction means that one examines the body, thinking, This body will certainly be destroyed.

original: lus mi gtsang ba'i tshogs kyi bdag nyid can yin zhing nang na byed pa'i skyes bus stong pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i dran pa skyed par 'jog pa can ni legs par so sor 'jog par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lus mi gtsang ba'i tshogs kyi bdag nyid can yin zhing nang na byed pa'i skyes bus stong pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i dran pa skyed par 'jog pa can ni legs par so sor 'jog par gyur pa'o //
translated: One generates mindfulness, thinking, The body is the self-nature of a collection of impurities and is empty of a self that is an agent within. One who is thus mindful is one who is well-established in mindfulness.

original: ji ltar nye bar 'jog par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar nye bar 'jog par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one become well-established?

original: gang kho na la shes pa tsam dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: gang kho na la shes pa tsam dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: It is said, Merely by knowledge, etc.

original: rnam pa nges pa 'dzin pa'i phyir shes pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam pa nges pa 'dzin pa'i phyir shes pa yin la /
translated: Knowledge is because of the ascertainment of aspects.

original: mngon sum du 'dzin pa'i phyir mthong ba tsam yin zhing so sor tha dad par ram khyad par du dran pa'i phyir so sor dran pa tsam mo //
analyzed: mngon sum du 'dzin pa'i phyir mthong ba tsam yin zhing so sor tha dad par ram khyad par du dran pa'i phyir so sor dran pa tsam mo //
translated: Merely seeing is because of the apprehension of direct perception. Merely mindfulness is because of the recollection of distinctions or differences.

original: mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni chags pa med par ro //
analyzed: mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni chags pa med par ro //
translated: Without abiding means without attachment.

original: 'jig rten cung zhig kyang mi len to zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rigs cung zad tsam la yang bdag nyid du 'dzin par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten cung zhig kyang mi len to zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rigs cung zad tsam la yang bdag nyid du 'dzin par mi byed pa'o //
translated: He does not accept even the slightest thing in the world means that he does not grasp even the slightest category of things as mine.

original: tshol ba la sogs pa dag la rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du yongs su rtog pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: tshol ba la sogs pa dag la rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du yongs su rtog pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true of the investigation of the characteristics of universals and particulars.

original: chos rnams la rjes su lta zhing zhas bya ba ni 'di ni chos tsam kho na yin gyi 'di la bdag dang bdag gi yod pa ni ma yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: chos rnams la rjes su lta zhing zhas bya ba ni 'di ni chos tsam kho na yin gyi 'di la bdag dang bdag gi yod pa ni ma yin no zhe'o //
translated: The phrase he observes phenomena means that he thinks, This is merely a phenomenon, but there is no self or mine here.

original: g-yo med pa ni sems kyi kun du spyod pas sems kyi kun du spyod pa gsal ba'o //
analyzed: g-yo med pa ni sems kyi kun du spyod pas sems kyi kun du spyod pa gsal ba'o //
translated: He is without deceit because his mental activity is clear, due to his mental conduct.

original: sgyu med pa ni gzhan slar bar mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu med pa ni gzhan slar bar mi byed pa'o //
translated: He is without pretense because he does not deceive others.

original: tshig thams cad la yid ches pa drang po dang rang bzhin can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tshig thams cad la yid ches pa drang po dang rang bzhin can zhes bya ste /
translated: He is honest and sincere in all his words.

original: rnam pa thams cad du drang ba la bya'i phyogs gcig gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du drang ba la bya'i phyogs gcig gis ni ma yin no //
translated: He is honest in every way, not just in part.

original: shes pa brda sprod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid du lung bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa brda sprod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid du lung bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúyou will be one who teaches the Dharma‚Äù refers to the prediction of arhatship.

original: nga'i legs par gsungs pa'i chos ni zhes bya ba la 'phags pa'i @59a * //
analyzed: nga'i legs par gsungs pa'i chos ni zhes bya ba la 'phags pa'i @59a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúmy well-taught Dharma‚Äù refers to the four noble truths.

original: bden pa bzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi chos yin la /üîΩde ni de'i legs par gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi chos yin la / de ni de'i legs par gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The four noble truths are the Dharma of the Lord Buddha.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du phyin ci ma log par yang dag par mthong ba la phan pa zhes bya ba yang dag par mthong bar byed pas na yang dag par mthong ba ste /üîΩzag pa med pa'i blo des dpyod pa yin la /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du phyin ci ma log par yang dag par mthong ba la phan pa zhes bya ba yang dag par mthong bar byed pas na yang dag par mthong ba ste / zag pa med pa'i blo des dpyod pa yin la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwell-taught‚Äù means that they are taught in a manner that accords with reality and is free of error.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúconducive to final nirvana‚Äù means that they are conducive to the attainment of nirvana.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúconducive to seeing what is true‚Äù means that they are conducive to seeing the truth.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i sgo nas mthong ba'i lam gyi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi bden pa bzhi'i rang bzhin can gyi chos mthong bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir yang dag pa mthong ba la phan pa ste /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i sgo nas mthong ba'i lam gyi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi bden pa bzhi'i rang bzhin can gyi chos mthong bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir yang dag pa mthong ba la phan pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúconducive to seeing what is true‚Äù means that they are conducive to seeing the truth of the four noble truths that are possessed by the Blessed One.

original: slu bar byed pa spangs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go//
analyzed: slu bar byed pa spangs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go//
translated: It is the opposite of that which deceives.

original: nad med pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i nad gdung bar byed pa'i rang bzhin can las rnam par grol ba ste /
analyzed: nad med pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i nad gdung bar byed pa'i rang bzhin can las rnam par grol ba ste /
translated: It is free from the sickness of the afflictions such as passion, etc., which have the nature of tormenting.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi chos lam gyi mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi chos lam gyi mtshan nyid can no //
translated: It is the Dharma of the Lord, which has the characteristic of a path.

original: dus kun du zhes bya ba ni 'di'i rtsom pa dang mthar phyin pa'i dus mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: dus kun du zhes bya ba ni 'di'i rtsom pa dang mthar phyin pa'i dus mtshungs pa'o //
translated: It is always so, i.e., its beginning and end are the same.

original: de ltar yang gang kho na la sdug bsngal la dmigs pa'i lam skyes par nyid du kun 'byung dang / 'gog nyon mongs pa spangs par gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar yang gang kho na la sdug bsngal la dmigs pa'i lam skyes par nyid du kun 'byung dang / 'gog nyon mongs pa spangs par gyur la /
translated: Thus, that very path which has suffering as its object, when it arises, abandons the afflictions, and when it is realized, it abandons the secondary afflictions.

original: gang kho na la kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam la dmigs pa'i lam skyes par gyur pa de nyid du kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang ; lam mthong bas spang par bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa yin pa'i phyir lam la rtsom pa dang 'bras bu mthar phyin pa'i dus mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang kho na la kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam la dmigs pa'i lam skyes par gyur pa de nyid du kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang ; lam mthong bas spang par bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa yin pa'i phyir lam la rtsom pa dang 'bras bu mthar phyin pa'i dus mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: The time of beginning the path and the time of completing the result are simultaneous, because the afflictions to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin, the truth of cessation, and the truth of the path are abandoned in the same place where the path that focuses on the truth of origin, the truth of cessation, and the truth of the path arises.

original: go bar sla ba zhes bya ba ni thob par byed pa yin pa'i phyir thob par byed pa ste /
analyzed: go bar sla ba zhes bya ba ni thob par byed pa yin pa'i phyir thob par byed pa ste /
translated: Easy to understand means easy to obtain, because it causes obtainment.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dag ston par mdzad pas na bcom ldan 'das yin la /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dag ston par mdzad pas na bcom ldan 'das yin la /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn is the one who teaches the four truths of the ƒÅryas.

original: de las byung ba ni go bar bla ba ste /
analyzed: de las byung ba ni go bar bla ba ste /
translated: Easy to understand arises from him.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi chos lam gyi rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi chos lam gyi rang bzhin yin te /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn‚Äôs Dharma is the nature of the path.

original: de ltar yang gang gi tshe lam skyes par gyur pa de'i tshe 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la the tshom med par gyur to //
analyzed: de ltar yang gang gi tshe lam skyes par gyur pa de'i tshe 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la the tshom med par gyur to //
translated: Thus, when the path arises, at that time there is no doubt about the four truths of the ƒÅryas.

original: ltos shig ces bya ba ni tshur shog 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i de kho na nyid ltos shig ces 'phags pa'i lam gyi skal ba dang ldan pa'i phyir 'gro ba la tshur shog ltos shig ces ston pa 'phags pa'i lam las skyes pa de kho na nyid la
analyzed: ltos shig ces bya ba ni tshur shog 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i de kho na nyid ltos shig ces 'phags pa'i lam gyi skal ba dang ldan pa'i phyir 'gro ba la tshur shog ltos shig ces ston pa 'phags pa'i lam las skyes pa de kho na nyid la
translated: The reality that arises from the noble path is the reality of the four noble truths.

original: bar chad med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bar chad med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of uninterrupted is as follows.

original: mkhas pas so sor rang gis rig pa zhes bya ba la mkhas @59b ba ste ;
analyzed: mkhas pas so sor rang gis rig pa zhes bya ba la mkhas @59b ba ste ;
translated: The wise should individually cognize it.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes so sor thob pa'i mkhas pas so so tha dad pa'i rang gi sems kyis rnam par shes pa yin zhing gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes so sor thob pa'i mkhas pas so so tha dad pa'i rang gi sems kyis rnam par shes pa yin zhing gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The wise who have individually attained supramundane wisdom should individually cognize it with their own minds, not with the minds of others.üîΩThe essence of the drink.

original: btung ba'i snying po zhes bya ba la snying po ni mchog ste dri ma dang bral ba yin la /
analyzed: btung ba'i snying po zhes bya ba la snying po ni mchog ste dri ma dang bral ba yin la /
translated: The essence is the supreme, which is free from stains.

original: snying po yang de yin la btung ba yang yin pas na btung ba'i snying po ste /
analyzed: snying po yang de yin la btung ba yang yin pas na btung ba'i snying po ste /
translated: Since it is the essence and it is a drink, it is the essence of the drink.

original: snying po nyid yin pa'i phyir btung bar bya ba yin pa'am /
analyzed: snying po nyid yin pa'i phyir btung bar bya ba yin pa'am /
translated: It is to be drunk because it is the essence.

original: snying po 'am bcud kyis len nam bdud rtsi dang 'dra bar btung bar bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: snying po 'am bcud kyis len nam bdud rtsi dang 'dra bar btung bar bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Or it is to be drunk like an essence, a panacea, or nectar.

original: gsung rab ces bya ba ni bkar gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: gsung rab ces bya ba ni bkar gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: The scriptures are the twelve branches of scripture.

original: ji ltar btung ba'i snying po yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar btung ba'i snying po yin zhe na /
translated: How is it the essence of what is drunk?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is said:

original: ston pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: ston pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The Teacher, etc.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ni mngon sum du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ni mngon sum du gyur pa ste /
translated: Omniscience is direct perception.

original: mthong ba'i yul du gyur cing gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mthong ba'i yul du gyur cing gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is said to be present in the domain of vision.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i chos so //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i chos so //
translated: The Dharma is the Dharma of teaching.üîΩWhat kind?

original: ci 'dra bas zhes bya ba ni nye bar zhi bar byed pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ci 'dra bas zhes bya ba ni nye bar zhi bar byed pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said to be that which brings peace.

original: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'o //
translated: It brings about the attainment of nirvana with remainder.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par byed pa ni phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par byed pa ni phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i phyir ro /
translated: It causes the attainment of complete nirvana because it causes the attainment of nirvana without remainder of aggregates.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gro bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i ye shes thob par byed pa'i 'phags pa'i lam thob par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gro bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i ye shes thob par byed pa'i 'phags pa'i lam thob par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It causes the attainment of perfect enlightenment because it causes the attainment of the noble path, which causes the attainment of perfect, complete knowledge.

original: bde bar gshegs pas gsungs pa ni sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pas gsungs pa ni sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the Sugata is the teaching of the Buddha.

original: de lta bas na zhes bya ba ni rgyu de kho na nyid kyi phyir de'i ched du bslang bar bya'o zhes bya bar rjes su sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes bya ba ni rgyu de kho na nyid kyi phyir de'i ched du bslang bar bya'o zhes bya bar rjes su sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore means for that very reason, it should be undertaken.

original: rang gi don gyi rjes su ltos la zhes bya ba la bdag gi don 'di ni nam zhig bdag rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi don gyi rjes su ltos la zhes bya ba la bdag gi don 'di ni nam zhig bdag rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: Looking out for one's own welfare refers to what is said, such as When will I go forth?

original: gdon mi za bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu med pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu med pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: It will certainly happen means it will not be fruitless.

original: ji ltar khas blangs pa bzhin du rjes su sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar khas blangs pa bzhin du rjes su sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they practice in accordance with their promises.

original: 'bras bu dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúWith fruit‚Äù means that they attain the fruit of stream-entry, etc.

original: bde bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs na spyod pa'i bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbde ba'i rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par @60a * //
analyzed: bde bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs na spyod pa'i bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir ro // bde ba'i rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par @60a * //
translated: ‚ÄúWith ease‚Äù means that they attain the fruit of the meditative absorptions practiced in the form realm.

original: smin pa'i bde ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smin pa'i bde ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúWith pleasant ripening‚Äù means that they attain the pleasant ripening of the meditative absorptions practiced in the desire realm.

original: ji ltar gzhan gyi don du 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan gyi don du 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
translated: How do they benefit others?

original: gang dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThose who give to them . . .‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúTo them‚Äù refers to the givers and benefactors.

original: gtong ba po dang sbyin bdag gi'o / kun du longs spyad par bya ba ni nye bar longs spyad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gtong ba po dang sbyin bdag gi'o / kun du longs spyad par bya ba ni nye bar longs spyad par bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTo be enjoyed‚Äù means to be used.

original: gang yongs su longs spyad par bya ba dag gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang yongs su longs spyad par bya ba dag gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are the things to be enjoyed?

original: chos gos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: chos gos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: The root text states, ‚Äúrobes, alms-food, beds, and seats.‚Äù

original: de la mchod pa byas na zhes bya ba ni mchod pa'i rnam pa'am gtong ba'i chos kyis so //
analyzed: de la mchod pa byas na zhes bya ba ni mchod pa'i rnam pa'am gtong ba'i chos kyis so //
translated: Worship is the form of worship or the object of giving.

original: 'tsho ba phun sum tshogs pa 'dzin pa'i phyir 'bras bu chen por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba phun sum tshogs pa 'dzin pa'i phyir 'bras bu chen por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is of great fruit because it brings about the perfection of livelihood.

original: nor la sogs pa yo byad phun sum tshogs pa 'byin pa'i phyir phan yon chen po'o //
analyzed: nor la sogs pa yo byad phun sum tshogs pa 'byin pa'i phyir phan yon chen po'o //
translated: It is of great benefit because it brings about the perfection of wealth, etc.

original: nad med pa phun sum tshogs pa 'byin pa'i phyir snang ba chen po'o //
analyzed: nad med pa phun sum tshogs pa 'byin pa'i phyir snang ba chen po'o //
translated: It is of great illumination because it brings about the perfection of health.

original: sdug bsngal dang phrad pa phun sum tshogs pa 'byin pa'i phyir rgya chen po'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang phrad pa phun sum tshogs pa 'byin pa'i phyir rgya chen po'o //
translated: It is of great extent because it brings about the perfection of the avoidance of misfortune.

original: de ltar dga' bo khyod kyis slobs shig ces bya ba ni shes nas bsgrub par bya ba'o //üîΩthob mar chags pa ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar dga' bo khyod kyis slobs shig ces bya ba ni shes nas bsgrub par bya ba'o // thob mar chags pa ni dga' ba'o //
translated: Thus, you should train yourself in this way, Nanda, is the practice after understanding.üîΩ Delight is the attachment to the initial attainment.

original: rgyun gyis chags pa ni mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: rgyun gyis chags pa ni mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: Fondness is the attachment to the continuity of that attainment.

original: mya ngan ni nang gi gdung ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan ni nang gi gdung ba'o //
translated: Sorrow is the inner burning.

original: smre sngags 'don pa ni dag gi brjod pa'o //
analyzed: smre sngags 'don pa ni dag gi brjod pa'o //
translated: Lamentation is the outer expression of that.

original: sdug bsngal ni lus kyi'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni lus kyi'o //
translated: Suffering is bodily.

original: yid mi bde ba ni yid kyi sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba ni yid kyi sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Mental suffering is depression.

original: 'khrug pa ni rna ba bcad pa la sogs pa las skyes pa'i lus can gyi gdung ba'o //
analyzed: 'khrug pa ni rna ba bcad pa la sogs pa las skyes pa'i lus can gyi gdung ba'o //
translated: Conflict is the distress of embodied beings born from the cutting off of ears and so on.

original: skad cig mas 'jig pa'i sgo nas yongs su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: skad cig mas 'jig pa'i sgo nas yongs su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Change is the transformation of the body through the process of momentariness.

original: rgyun chad pa'i sgo nas rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir bdag gi'o zhes khas len pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi nyid du 'dzin par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyun chad pa'i sgo nas rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir bdag gi'o zhes khas len pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi nyid du 'dzin par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The acceptance of ‚Äúmine‚Äù is the grasping of ‚Äúmine‚Äù through the process of continuity.

original: rnam pa gnag gi zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gnag gi zhe na /
translated: In what way?

original: de'i ni nga'i zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i ni nga'i zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThis is mine.‚Äù

original: 'di ni gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po yin la /
translated: This is a thing such as form, etc.

original: nga'i zhes bya ba ni bdag gis ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nga'i zhes bya ba ni bdag gis ston par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMine‚Äù is the teaching of the self.

original: de ltar na bdag gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na bdag gang yin zhe na /
translated: Thus, what is the self?

original: de'i phyir 'di ni bdag go smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni bdag go smos pa yin te /
