translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúThis is my self.‚Äù

original: 'di ni bdag yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag yin la /
translated: This is the self.

original: bdag ces bya ba de ni bdag nyid ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba de ni bdag nyid ston par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMy self‚Äù is the teaching of the self.

original: 'di ni nga'i bdag go zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa chos gzhan la bdag nyid du 'dzin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni nga'i bdag go zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa chos gzhan la bdag nyid du 'dzin par byed pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThis is mine‚Äù is the grasping of another thing, such as form, as the self.

original: 'di yang bdag ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang bdag ston par byed pa'o //
translated: This is also the self that is the teacher.

original: yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyis so //üîΩthos pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni lung dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyis so // thos pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni lung dang ldan pa'o //
translated: By means of right wisdom means by means of uncontaminated wisdom.üîΩEndowed with learning means endowed with scripture.

original: 'phags pa'i nyan thos zhes bya ba ni khong du chud pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i nyan thos zhes bya ba ni khong du chud pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The noble disciple means endowed with understanding.

original: skyo ba zhes bya ba ni rgyab @60b kyis phyogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: skyo ba zhes bya ba ni rgyab @60b kyis phyogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Disenchantment means turning away.

original: nyon mongs par gyur pa spyad pa'i phyir mi chags pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs par gyur pa spyad pa'i phyir mi chags pa'o //
translated: Because of the practice of the afflicted, there is nonattachment.

original: bral bar gyur pa skyed pa'i phyir rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: bral bar gyur pa skyed pa'i phyir rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: Because of the generation of the uncontaminated, there is liberation.

original: ye shes ni zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: ye shes ni zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes so //
translated: Knowledge is the knowledge of elimination and nonarising.

original: mthong ba ni mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba ni mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: Seeing is the right view of the adept.

original: bdag gi skye ba zad do zhes bya ba 'dis ni srid par skye bzad pa bstan to //
analyzed: bdag gi skye ba zad do zhes bya ba 'dis ni srid par skye bzad pa bstan to //
translated: By the statement, ‚ÄúMy births are exhausted,‚Äù the exhaustion of birth in existence is taught.

original: tshangs par spyod pa spyad do zhes bya ba ni rgyud la 'jog pa ni spyod pa spyad pa ste gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba spangs pa de'i tshe tshangs pa ste /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa spyad do zhes bya ba ni rgyud la 'jog pa ni spyod pa spyad pa ste gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba spangs pa de'i tshe tshangs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúI have practiced pure conduct‚Äù means that he has practiced the conduct of the path, because when he has abandoned the arising of the afflictions, then he has purity.

original: lam gyi ming can rgyud la gnas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lam gyi ming can rgyud la gnas par gyur pa'o //
translated: The path, which is named ‚Äúpurity,‚Äù has been practiced by him.

original: de'i phyir 'dis ni nyon mongs pa rnams yang mi 'byung bar spangs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dis ni nyon mongs pa rnams yang mi 'byung bar spangs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this passage teaches that he has abandoned the arising of the afflictions so that they will not arise again.

original: bya ba byas pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa zad pa dang skye ba spangs pa ni bya ba yin la des byas pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba byas pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa zad pa dang skye ba spangs pa ni bya ba yin la des byas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúI have done what must be done‚Äù means that he has done what must be done, namely, the abandonment of the afflictions and the abandonment of rebirth.

original: 'di las srid pa gzhan med do zhes bya ba 'di ni gang gis srid par skye bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi srid pa de ni bdag gis mi shes so //
analyzed: 'di las srid pa gzhan med do zhes bya ba 'di ni gang gis srid par skye bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi srid pa de ni bdag gis mi shes so //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no more existence other than this one‚Äù means that he does not know any existence that would be reborn in another existence.

original: zhes las kyi srid pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes las kyi srid pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: This passage refutes the existence of karma.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs zhes bya ba ni don gcig la rjod par byed pa'i sgra phan tshun ltos pa du ma ni rnam grangs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs zhes bya ba ni don gcig la rjod par byed pa'i sgra phan tshun ltos pa du ma ni rnam grangs zhes bya ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúdiscourse‚Äù means that many terms that express the same meaning are mutually dependent.

original: gcig la ni go rims bzhin du du ma'i sgo nas rjod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la ni go rims bzhin du du ma'i sgo nas rjod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is expressed in many ways, in order, with regard to a single thing.

original: rdul med pa ni gsal por snang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul med pa ni gsal por snang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is ‚Äúfree of dust‚Äù because it is clear.

original: dri ma dang bral pa ni zag pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ma dang bral pa ni zag pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is ‚Äúfree of defilement‚Äù because it is free of the outflows.

original: chos rnams te 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag la'o //
analyzed: chos rnams te 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWith regard to the dharmas‚Äù means with regard to the four noble truths.

original: chos kyi mig gis zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis so //
analyzed: chos kyi mig gis zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúWith the eye of dharma‚Äù means with the eye of uncontaminated wisdom.üîΩ‚ÄúWithout grasping‚Äù shows that it is abandoned without remainder.

original: nye bar len pa med cing zhes bya ba 'dis ni lhag ma med par spangs pa bstan to / gzhan yang 'di skad bka' stsal to zhes bya ba ni mdor gsungs pa'i don dang rjes su mthun pa'i don tshigs su bcad par sbyar ba'i sgo nas bka' stsal
analyzed: nye bar len pa med cing zhes bya ba 'dis ni lhag ma med par spangs pa bstan to / gzhan yang 'di skad bka' stsal to zhes bya ba ni mdor gsungs pa'i don dang rjes su mthun pa'i don tshigs su bcad par sbyar ba'i sgo nas bka' stsal
translated: Moreover, he spoke in this way means that he spoke in accordance with the meaning that was briefly taught, by applying it in verse.

original: pa'o // phung po ni nyon mongs pa'i phung po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o // phung po ni nyon mongs pa'i phung po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The aggregates are the aggregates of affliction, etc.

original: dag pa ni zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dag pa ni zag pa med pa'o //
translated: Purity is the uncontaminated.

original: rnal 'byor ni sems mnyam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni sems mnyam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Yoga is the mind in equipoise.

original: skye ba ni rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Birth is the going forth.

original: 'jig pa ni nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa ni nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Destruction is the degeneration.

original: dag pa rnyed par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ming can gyi dag pa gang gi tshe thob par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dag pa rnyed par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ming can gyi dag pa gang gi tshe thob par gyur pa'o //
translated: When one attains the purity that is called the attainment of purity, that is, when one attains the purity that is the name for nirvana with remainder.

original: yongs su spongs shig ces bya ba ni skye bo sdug pa dang 'grogs pa dang / rnyed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su spongs shig ces bya ba ni skye bo sdug pa dang 'grogs pa dang / rnyed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: One should abandon means one should abandon the company of dear ones, gain, and so on.

original: @61a * // tshogs ni mtshams so //
analyzed: @61a * // tshogs ni mtshams so //
translated: The heap is the boundary.

original: lcug ma las byas pa'i phyi rol lci ba dang sas zhal zhal byas pa'i rim pa gcig pa dang / nyis rtseg gam sum rtseg can 'bras la sogs pa gzhug pa'i gnas ni skon pa'o //
analyzed: lcug ma las byas pa'i phyi rol lci ba dang sas zhal zhal byas pa'i rim pa gcig pa dang / nyis rtseg gam sum rtseg can 'bras la sogs pa gzhug pa'i gnas ni skon pa'o //
translated: The enclosure is a single, double, or triple layer of mud or clay outside the boundary, made of grass or sticks, that is the place for storing rice and so on.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i ched kyi bya ba de dag thams cad la shin tu mthar thug par gyur pa yin pa'i phyir shin tu mthar thug pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i ched kyi bya ba de dag thams cad la shin tu mthar thug par gyur pa yin pa'i phyir shin tu mthar thug pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: It is the ultimate nirvana because it is the ultimate of all the activities that lead to the attainment of nirvana.

original: yon tan ma rnyed pa thob pa ni grub pa yin la /
analyzed: yon tan ma rnyed pa thob pa ni grub pa yin la /
translated: Attainment is the acquisition of a quality that has not been acquired.

original: rnyed pa yongs su skyong bar byed pa ni bde ba ste /
analyzed: rnyed pa yongs su skyong bar byed pa ni bde ba ste /
translated: Happiness is the preservation of what has been acquired.

original: 'khor ba ji srid du ma rnyed pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa rnyed nas rnyed pa yang mi 'dor ba'i phyir khyad par du 'phags pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba ji srid du ma rnyed pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa rnyed nas rnyed pa yang mi 'dor ba'i phyir khyad par du 'phags pa ste /
translated: It is preeminent because, having attained nirvana, which had not been attained for as long as cyclic existence has existed, one does not lose what has been attained.

original: grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'o //
translated: It is the attainment and happiness of one who is preeminent.

original: sbas shing bsrungs pa'i sgo gang yin pa de ni sgo sbas pa yin la /
analyzed: sbas shing bsrungs pa'i sgo gang yin pa de ni sgo sbas pa yin la /
translated: The door that is guarded and protected is the guarded door.

original: dbang po dag gi sgo sbas pa ni dbang po'i sgo sbas pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po dag gi sgo sbas pa ni dbang po'i sgo sbas pa ste /
translated: The guarded door of the sense faculties is the guarded door of the sense faculties.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i sgo nas kha na ma tho ba cung zad tsam yang mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir dbang po'i sgo sbas pa yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i sgo nas kha na ma tho ba cung zad tsam yang mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir dbang po'i sgo sbas pa yin no //
translated: The guarded door of the sense faculties here is the non-performance of even the slightest transgression through the door of the sense faculties such as the eyes.

original: nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba rnam par grol ba'i dga' ba gang yin pa dang / zag pa med pa'i bde ba gang yin pa de so sor myong bar byed pa'i ngang tshul can de ni rnam par grol ba'i dga' ba dang bde ba so sor myong ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba rnam par grol ba'i dga' ba gang yin pa dang / zag pa med pa'i bde ba gang yin pa de so sor myong bar byed pa'i ngang tshul can de ni rnam par grol ba'i dga' ba dang bde ba so sor myong ba'o //
translated: The joy of being liberated from the bondage of the afflictions and the undefiled bliss are experienced individually.

original: ldong ros zhes bya ba ni 'dir gur kum gyi ming gi rnam grangs yin pa'am /
analyzed: ldong ros zhes bya ba ni 'dir gur kum gyi ming gi rnam grangs yin pa'am /
translated: The term manjishtha is a synonym for saffron,

original: dri bzang po'i rdzas sna tshogs sbyar ba yin gyi /
analyzed: dri bzang po'i rdzas sna tshogs sbyar ba yin gyi /
translated: or it is a mixture of various fragrant substances.

original: ldong ros ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ldong ros ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not a mineral pigment,

original: dri yid du 'ong ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dri yid du 'ong ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is not a pleasant smell.

original: sdong bu ni 'bras bu'i rnam pa'o //üîΩbsam gtan zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sdong bu ni 'bras bu'i rnam pa'o // bsam gtan zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The stem is a form of the fruit.

original: bsam gtan ni dang po la sogs pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan ni dang po la sogs pa bzhi'o //
translated: The term meditation and so on refers to the four meditations beginning with the first.

original: rnam par thar pa ni brgyad de /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa ni brgyad de /
translated: The eight liberations are as follows:

original: gzugs can rnams la lta ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
analyzed: gzugs can rnams la lta ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
translated: The first liberation is called seeing forms while having form.

original: nang gzugs ma yin par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs la lta ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: nang gzugs ma yin par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs la lta ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second liberation is to consider internally that one does not have form, but to see externally that forms are limited.

original: sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas te rdzogs par byas nas gnas pa zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas te rdzogs par byas nas gnas pa zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third liberation is to consider that one has a beautiful body, and to see that this is so.

original: gzugs med pa bzhi dang 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa ste brgyad do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa bzhi dang 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa ste brgyad do //
translated: The four formless liberations are the four formless meditative attainments, and the eighth liberation is the attainment of cessation.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni gsum ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three concentrations:

original: rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med @61b la dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa 'ang med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med @61b la dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa 'ang med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: the concentration that is accompanied by both applied and sustained thought, the concentration that is accompanied by neither applied thought nor sustained thought, and the concentration that is accompanied by sustained thought but not by applied thought.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ste /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ste /
translated: There are nine serial absorptions:

original: bsam gtan dang po nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar du'o //
translated: the first concentration, and so on up to the absorption of cessation.

original: dri'i lag ris ni dpung rgyan gyi rnam pa lta bus bris pa'o //
analyzed: dri'i lag ris ni dpung rgyan gyi rnam pa lta bus bris pa'o //
translated: The lines of the scent-pouch are drawn like an armlet.

original: 'jam rtsi byos shig ces bya ba ni mas gtong ba dang / 'jam rtsi gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'jam rtsi byos shig ces bya ba ni mas gtong ba dang / 'jam rtsi gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Anoint it means to anoint it with the mother's milk and to anoint it with ointment.

original: sgo steng gi steng gi khang pa las khang pa gcig pa'am gnyis rtseg gcig gis shin tu mtho ba rlung 'jug pa dang 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i khang pa la sgo khang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sgo steng gi steng gi khang pa las khang pa gcig pa'am gnyis rtseg gcig gis shin tu mtho ba rlung 'jug pa dang 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i khang pa la sgo khang zhes bya'o //
translated: The upper story above the door is either one or two stories high, very high, with a room that has wind entering and leaving. That is called a doorway.

original: slob dpon tshul khrims bskyangs kyis nye bar sbyar ba las phran tshegs kyi tshig gi rnam par bshad pa ste sgo gnyis pa'o /üîΩ// / bam po bdun pa /
analyzed: slob dpon tshul khrims bskyangs kyis nye bar sbyar ba las phran tshegs kyi tshig gi rnam par bshad pa ste sgo gnyis pa'o / // / bam po bdun pa /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the minor points from the treatise composed by Master ≈öƒ´lapƒÅlita, the second door.

original: tshal bu'i snas non par ma gyur pa'i phyogs ni glegs bu yin te /
analyzed: tshal bu'i snas non par ma gyur pa'i phyogs ni glegs bu yin te /
translated: The side without the binding string is the tablet.

original: glegs bu glegs bu dang / glegs bu phyed pa glegs bu phyed pa dang mnyam por bya'o //
analyzed: glegs bu glegs bu dang / glegs bu phyed pa glegs bu phyed pa dang mnyam por bya'o //
translated: The tablet should be made equal to the tablet and the half-tablet should be made equal to the half-tablet.

original: mthe bong dang nye bar gyur pa mdzub mo gang yin pa de'i dbus ma'i tshigs gang yin pa de'i tshigs kyi logs gang yin pa de'i steng du mthe bo'i tshigs bzhag par gyur pa las mthor grub pa gang yin pa de la 'dir bya rog gi mtho nyid
analyzed: mthe bong dang nye bar gyur pa mdzub mo gang yin pa de'i dbus ma'i tshigs gang yin pa de'i tshigs kyi logs gang yin pa de'i steng du mthe bo'i tshigs bzhag par gyur pa las mthor grub pa gang yin pa de la 'dir bya rog gi mtho nyid
translated: The middle joint of the finger that is next to the thumb is the joint of the finger that is placed on top of the middle joint of the finger that is next to the thumb. The height of the crow is the height of the finger that is established above that.

original: du brjod pa yin la bya rog gi rkang pa dang 'dra pa'i sgo nas 'di la yang sor bzhi kho na'i tshad du rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: du brjod pa yin la bya rog gi rkang pa dang 'dra pa'i sgo nas 'di la yang sor bzhi kho na'i tshad du rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: The height of the crow is described here. It is established by another method as being only four finger-widths in size, because it is similar to the leg of a crow.

original: rtse mo rnon po zhes bya ba ni bsegs khar bcad pas rnon por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rtse mo rnon po zhes bya ba ni bsegs khar bcad pas rnon por gyur pa'o //
translated: The tip is sharp means that it is sharp because it is cut at an angle.

original: dri ma can du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni rngul gyis khyab par gyur pa'o //üîΩrnyings pa ni dus mang po can no //
analyzed: dri ma can du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni rngul gyis khyab par gyur pa'o // rnyings pa ni dus mang po can no //
translated: It is soiled means that it is covered with sweat.üîΩOld means that it has been around for a long time.

original: srabs pa ni shin tu dengs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: srabs pa ni shin tu dengs par gyur pa'o //
translated: Thin means that it is very worn out.

original: gsor mi rung ba ni btsems pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas bcos par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsor mi rung ba ni btsems pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas bcos par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not suitable for repair because it cannot be fixed by sewing and so forth.

original: tshal bu tshal bu zhes bya ba ni dum bu dum bur te srog shing la gdags su rung ba'o //
analyzed: tshal bu tshal bu zhes bya ba ni dum bu dum bur te srog shing la gdags su rung ba'o //
translated: The phrase in pieces means in parts, suitable for being placed on a central pole.

original: spu can ni gos gcig pu spus khebs pa ste par tang ngo //
analyzed: spu can ni gos gcig pu spus khebs pa ste par tang ngo //
translated: The phrase with hair means a single piece of cloth covered with hair, like a blanket.

original: ral ba btsems pa ni gos kyi dbus zad par gyur pa mtha' gnyis dkyil nyid du byed pa'o //
analyzed: ral ba btsems pa ni gos kyi dbus zad par gyur pa mtha' gnyis dkyil nyid du byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase with a patch means a cloth that has been worn out in the middle and the two ends are made into the middle.

original: gtun ni rdzas btags su rung ba'i rdo'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: gtun ni rdzas btags su rung ba'i rdo'i khyad par ro //
translated: The phrase pestle means a special kind of stone suitable for grinding.

original: rtsva'i khang pa las phyi rol du rim pa gnyis pa'am rim pa gsum pa'i brang khang gi tshogs la khang pa 'khor dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtsva'i khang pa las phyi rol du rim pa gnyis pa'am rim pa gsum pa'i brang khang gi tshogs la khang pa 'khor dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase with an enclosure means a house of grass and so on, with a second or third story, together with a courtyard.

original: @62a * // rgyab rings zhes bya ba ni 'dir sprul gyi don dang rjes su mthun pa'i ming ngo //
analyzed: @62a * // rgyab rings zhes bya ba ni 'dir sprul gyi don dang rjes su mthun pa'i ming ngo //
translated: The phrase with a veranda means a name that is suitable for a snake.

original: me mar gyi bya ba gang gis grub par 'gyur pa de ni me mar gyi 'od khang ngo //
analyzed: me mar gyi bya ba gang gis grub par 'gyur pa de ni me mar gyi 'od khang ngo //
translated: The phrase with a lamp means a lamp house, which is a place where a lamp is lit.

original: snga khang ni phyogs gcig ma gtogs par lhag ma yongs su bskor ba'o //
analyzed: snga khang ni phyogs gcig ma gtogs par lhag ma yongs su bskor ba'o //
translated: The phrase with a courtyard means a house surrounded on all sides except for one direction.

original: stan dang mnyam par zhes bya ba ni khre'u la sogs pa stan gyi steng gi cha mnyam par ro //
analyzed: stan dang mnyam par zhes bya ba ni khre'u la sogs pa stan gyi steng gi cha mnyam par ro //
translated: Sitting on the same seat means on the same part of the seat, such as a bench, etc.

original: mtshan ma thob shig ces bya ba ni de'i rigs can kho na'i tshon gyis chos gos la bris shing mtshan mar byas pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma thob shig ces bya ba ni de'i rigs can kho na'i tshon gyis chos gos la bris shing mtshan mar byas pa'o //
translated: Having obtained the sign means having drawn with the same color as the one used for the robe, and having made a sign on the robe.

original: ril chung zhes bya ba ni ril ba chung ngu chus yongs su bkang ba ske ba la skud pas btags pa rna ba la dpyangs pa na /
analyzed: ril chung zhes bya ba ni ril ba chung ngu chus yongs su bkang ba ske ba la skud pas btags pa rna ba la dpyangs pa na /
translated: The small water pot is a small water pot filled with water, tied around the neck with a string, and hung on the ear.

original: gang gi tshe gnyid log par gyur pa rab tu g-yo bar gyur pa de'i tshe yongs su bo ba gdong la babs pa des gnyid sad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gnyid log par gyur pa rab tu g-yo bar gyur pa de'i tshe yongs su bo ba gdong la babs pa des gnyid sad par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one falls asleep, it moves, and when it falls over, the water falls on one's face, and one wakes up.

original: byad bu'i rnam pa can du shing bzhogs pa mtho gang gi tshad du byas pa de yang rnal 'byor gyi dus su skud pas rna ba la dpyangs pa'am /
analyzed: byad bu'i rnam pa can du shing bzhogs pa mtho gang gi tshad du byas pa de yang rnal 'byor gyi dus su skud pas rna ba la dpyangs pa'am /
translated: The small pillow is made of wood, the size of a cubit, and at the time of practice, it is hung on the ear with a string.

original: mgo bo la bzhag na rab tu g-yo ba'i tshe des kyang yan lag gi tshogs la phog pa las gnyid sangs pa'i thabs yin no //
analyzed: mgo bo la bzhag na rab tu g-yo ba'i tshe des kyang yan lag gi tshogs la phog pa las gnyid sangs pa'i thabs yin no //
translated: If one places it on the head, when it moves very much, it will strike the collection of limbs, and that is the means of waking up.

original: pho long ni skud pa'i tshogs zlum por byas pa des gnyid bsal ba'i phan tshun 'phen par byed pa'o //
analyzed: pho long ni skud pa'i tshogs zlum por byas pa des gnyid bsal ba'i phan tshun 'phen par byed pa'o //
translated: The bladder is a collection of strings made into a circle. By that, one should remove sleep and mutually propel.

original: brtson pa ni sems kyi 'bad rtsol lo //
analyzed: brtson pa ni sems kyi 'bad rtsol lo //
translated: Exertion is the effort of the mind.

original: sgrub pa ni lus kyi sgo nas bya ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni lus kyi sgo nas bya ba byed pa'o //
translated: Practice is the performance of actions through the body.

original: rtsol bas zhes bya ba ni bya ba thams cad mthar phyin phar byed pas so //
analyzed: rtsol bas zhes bya ba ni bya ba thams cad mthar phyin phar byed pas so //
translated: By striving, all actions are brought to completion.

original: spyod lam ni skyil mo krung gis 'dug pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: spyod lam ni skyil mo krung gis 'dug pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Posture is sitting cross-legged and so forth.

original: spyod pa ni spyod yul du 'gro ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa ni spyod yul du 'gro ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Conduct is going to the range and so forth.

original: gang la nan tan du byed pa zhe na /
analyzed: gang la nan tan du byed pa zhe na /
translated: What is one diligent in?

original: bslab pa rnams la gus par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: bslab pa rnams la gus par byed pa nyid do //
translated: It is the respect for the trainings.

original: grong gi skye bo mang po rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni grong gi dbang byed rnams kyis so //
analyzed: grong gi skye bo mang po rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni grong gi dbang byed rnams kyis so //
translated: The many people of the town, means those who are in charge of the town.

original: gtam ni gang gi rnam par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gtam ni gang gi rnam par gyur pa'o //
translated: The story is what has happened to them.

original: mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni lus rnam par 'gyur pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni lus rnam par 'gyur pa'i chos can no //
translated: The term sign refers to a physical attribute.

original: kun dga' ra ba'i nang na zhes bya ba la nang gi sgra 'di ni 'dir dbus rjod par byed pa yin no //üîΩspongs shig ces bya ba ni dor zhing bsal ba'am /
analyzed: kun dga' ra ba'i nang na zhes bya ba la nang gi sgra 'di ni 'dir dbus rjod par byed pa yin no // spongs shig ces bya ba ni dor zhing bsal ba'am /
translated: The phrase within the monastery indicates the middle of the monastery.

original: mngag par byed pa'o //üîΩrnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam pa ni 'dir rang gi ngo bo yin par rig par bya ba yin la /üîΩrtags ni rang gi ngo bo la mi 'khrul pa'i mtshon par byed pa yin zhing /
analyzed: mngag par byed pa'o // rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam pa ni 'dir rang gi ngo bo yin par rig par bya ba yin la / rtags ni rang gi ngo bo la mi 'khrul pa'i mtshon par byed pa yin zhing /
translated: The term should be removed means that it should be discarded or expelled.üîΩThe term aspect refers to the essential nature of an object.üîΩThe term mark refers to the means by which that essential nature is made known.

original: mtshan ma ni rang gi ngo bo khong du chud par byed @62b pa'i rgyu yin par bstan to //
analyzed: mtshan ma ni rang gi ngo bo khong du chud par byed @62b pa'i rgyu yin par bstan to //
translated: The term sign refers to the cause by which that essential nature is understood.

original: yul ma yin pa ni khong du chud par mi 'gyur ba'o //üîΩskyil mo krung bcas pa ni skyil mo krung gis 'du gnas so //
analyzed: yul ma yin pa ni khong du chud par mi 'gyur ba'o // skyil mo krung bcas pa ni skyil mo krung gis 'du gnas so //
translated: The phrase not an object means that it is not understood.üîΩThe phrase having sat down cross-legged means that he sits down in the full lotus position.

original: lus drang po zhes bya ba ni drang por byas nas so //
analyzed: lus drang po zhes bya ba ni drang por byas nas so //
translated: The phrase with the body erect means that he sits up straight.

original: bsrang ba ni lus kyi rked pa'i phyogs nas brtsams nas lus drang por byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsrang ba ni lus kyi rked pa'i phyogs nas brtsams nas lus drang por byed pa'o //
translated: Straightening is beginning from the waist of the body and straightening the body.

original: dran ba mngon du zhes bya ba ni bzhin la so sor gtad pas na dran pa mngon du'o //
analyzed: dran ba mngon du zhes bya ba ni bzhin la so sor gtad pas na dran pa mngon du'o //
translated: The phrase mindfulness is present means that mindfulness is present because it is directed to the face.

original: rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni mig drang por lta bas zhugs pa ni bsam gtan byed pa yin no zhes 'jig rten la rab tu grags pa yod do /üîΩmig sna'i rtse mo la gtad pa na dran pa yang bsgom par bya ba don de kho na nyid la bzhag pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir 'dis ni brtson 'grus pa brtsams pa'i rgyu mtshan lus kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag la ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag
analyzed: rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni mig drang por lta bas zhugs pa ni bsam gtan byed pa yin no zhes 'jig rten la rab tu grags pa yod do / mig sna'i rtse mo la gtad pa na dran pa yang bsgom par bya ba don de kho na nyid la bzhag pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir 'dis ni brtson 'grus pa brtsams pa'i rgyu mtshan lus kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag la ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag
translated: The phrase yoga means that the eyes are directed straight ahead. It is well known in the world that one who is engaged in this way is practicing meditation.üîΩWhen the eyes are directed to the tip of the nose, mindfulness is also present, and the object of meditation is placed right there. Therefore, this passage teaches that the limbs of concentration are the causes of the exertion that is begun.

original: yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The limbs of concentration are the particular states of the body.

original: kha'i dri ma dag par bya ba'i phyir so shing dor bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa la /
analyzed: kha'i dri ma dag par bya ba'i phyir so shing dor bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa la /
translated: In order to purify the impurities of the mouth, one should discard the tooth stick.

original: dor ba yang kha'i dri ma sbyangs nas shing gi dum bu yongs su dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: dor ba yang kha'i dri ma sbyangs nas shing gi dum bu yongs su dor bar bya'o //
translated: And when it is discarded, the impurities of the mouth are cleansed and the piece of wood is completely discarded.

original: mig la phan pa ni mig la phan 'dogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mig la phan pa ni mig la phan 'dogs par byed pa'o //
translated: Beneficial to the eyes means it benefits the eyes.

original: skye bo mang po 'dus pa'i gnas ni 'dir mi dben pa'o //
analyzed: skye bo mang po 'dus pa'i gnas ni 'dir mi dben pa'o //
translated: A place where many people gather is not a solitary place here.

original: 'khums par gyur pa ni rnam par zhum ste /
analyzed: 'khums par gyur pa ni rnam par zhum ste /
translated: Cowering means shrinking.

original: ji ltar bya ba la rmongs par gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar bya ba la rmongs par gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is as if one is confused about what to do.

original: bsod nams brgya phrag du mas bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni mang pos so //
analyzed: bsod nams brgya phrag du mas bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni mang pos so //
translated: It is said to be produced by many hundreds of merits, meaning by many.

original: bsod nams brgya'i tshad kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsod nams brgya'i tshad kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What is the measure of a hundred merits?

original: smras pa / 'dir kha cig ni sems brgya la bsod nams brgya zhes bya bar 'thob ste /
analyzed: smras pa / 'dir kha cig ni sems brgya la bsod nams brgya zhes bya bar 'thob ste /
translated: Here, some obtain a hundred merits for a hundred minds.

original: mngon du song ba can gyi sems lnga bcu mngon sum du byed cing 'phen par byed la /
analyzed: mngon du song ba can gyi sems lnga bcu mngon sum du byed cing 'phen par byed la /
translated: They manifest and project fifty minds that are manifest.

original: de'i mjug gi sgo nas kyang yongs su rdzogs par byed pa lnga bcu mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i mjug gi sgo nas kyang yongs su rdzogs par byed pa lnga bcu mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: And they manifest the remaining fifty that complete it through its conclusion.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: las kyi lam bcu la brten pa'i phyir las kyi lam re re la yang lngar 'gyur te /üîΩ'di ltar srog gcod pa las ldog pa'i sems dang / de la 'god par byed pa'i sems dang / de'i bsngags pa brjod pa'i sems dang / de la rjes su yi rang ba'i sems dang / de'i 'bras bu yongs su sdo bar byed pa'i sems te /
analyzed: las kyi lam bcu la brten pa'i phyir las kyi lam re re la yang lngar 'gyur te / 'di ltar srog gcod pa las ldog pa'i sems dang / de la 'god par byed pa'i sems dang / de'i bsngags pa brjod pa'i sems dang / de la rjes su yi rang ba'i sems dang / de'i 'bras bu yongs su sdo bar byed pa'i sems te /
translated: Since they are based on the ten paths of action, each path of action has five aspects.

original: sangs rgyas nyid du yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid du yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, there is the thought to abstain from taking life, the thought to establish others in that, the thought to praise that, the thought to rejoice in that and the thought to dedicate the result of that to complete buddhahood.

original: de bzhin du log par lta ba las slar zlog pa'i bar du brjod par bya ste /üîΩlan gnyis mngon @63a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du log par lta ba las slar zlog pa'i bar du brjod par bya ste / lan gnyis mngon @63a * //
translated: Similarly, one should say up to the thought to abstain from wrong view.üîΩSince one has two thoughts, one hundred thoughts arise.

original: du byas pa las sems brgyar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / gzhan dag ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis srog gcod pa las ldog pa ni rgyu rnam pa lda dang ldan pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: du byas pa las sems brgyar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / gzhan dag ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis srog gcod pa las ldog pa ni rgyu rnam pa lda dang ldan pa nyid yin te /
translated: Others say: Abstaining from taking life is endowed with five causes and five results.

original: dngos gzhi las kyi lam yongs su dag pa dang / dbang du byed pa yongs su dag pa dang / rnam par rtog pa bzhin du gsod pa med pa dang / dran pas bsams pa nyid du ma yin pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la yongs su sdo ba nyid ces bya ba de la dmigs par byed pa'i sems lngar 'gyur la /üîΩde bzhin du las kyi lam bcu la dmigs pa'i sems lnga bcur 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos gzhi las kyi lam yongs su dag pa dang / dbang du byed pa yongs su dag pa dang / rnam par rtog pa bzhin du gsod pa med pa dang / dran pas bsams pa nyid du ma yin pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la yongs su sdo ba nyid ces bya ba de la dmigs par byed pa'i sems lngar 'gyur la / de bzhin du las kyi lam bcu la dmigs pa'i sems lnga bcur 'gyur te /
translated: There are five thoughts that focus on the path of action: the pure path of action, the pure subjugation, the absence of killing in accordance with conception, the absence of killing in accordance with recollection and the absence of killing in accordance with nirvana.üîΩThus, there are fifty thoughts that focus on the ten paths of action and since each of these is actualized twice, there are one hundred thoughts.

original: de lan gnyis mngon sum du byas pa las sems brgyar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / kha cig ni sangs rgyas kyi sku ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de lan gnyis mngon sum du byas pa las sems brgyar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / kha cig ni sangs rgyas kyi sku ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Some say: The body of a buddha is twofold:

original: bskrun pa'i sku dang / chos kyi sku'o //üîΩde la bskrun pa'i sku ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis yin la /
analyzed: bskrun pa'i sku dang / chos kyi sku'o // de la bskrun pa'i sku ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis yin la /
translated: the created body and the body of truth.

original: chos kyi sku yang sangs rgyas gyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi sku yang sangs rgyas gyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yin no //
translated: The created body is the thirty two marks of a great being and the body of truth is the eighteen distinctive qualities of a buddha.

original: de la sangs rgyas la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pa mngon sum du byas ba las sems lnga bcur 'gyur ba la bdag kyang 'di lta bur gyur cig ces bya ba gzhan lnga bcu ste /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pa mngon sum du byas ba las sems lnga bcur 'gyur ba la bdag kyang 'di lta bur gyur cig ces bya ba gzhan lnga bcu ste /
translated: The fifty minds that focus on the Buddha arise from manifesting the attention that focuses on the Buddha. The other fifty minds are ‚ÄúMay I also become like that.‚Äù

original: de ltar na bsod nams brgyar 'gyur ro zhes smras so //
analyzed: de ltar na bsod nams brgyar 'gyur ro zhes smras so //
translated: Thus, it is said, ‚Äúmerit increases a hundredfold.‚Äù

original: gzhan dag ni 'dod pa'i khams gnas ris nyi shu dang / gzugs khams bcu drug dang / gzugs med pa'i khams bzhi dang / grang ba'i dmyal ba brgyad ces bya ba bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad po ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'dod pa'i khams gnas ris nyi shu dang / gzugs khams bcu drug dang / gzugs med pa'i khams bzhi dang / grang ba'i dmyal ba brgyad ces bya ba bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad po ste /
translated: Others say: The four abodes of the desire realm, the sixteen abodes of the form realm, the four abodes of the formless realm and the eight cold hells are the forty eight abodes.

original: khams gsum po ma lus pa de la dmigs pa'i byang chub sems da pa'i snying rje'i thugs skye ba de dang yang dag par ldan pa'i sems bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad po dang / de'i rjes thogs su sangs rgyas la dmigs pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: khams gsum po ma lus pa de la dmigs pa'i byang chub sems da pa'i snying rje'i thugs skye ba de dang yang dag par ldan pa'i sems bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad po dang / de'i rjes thogs su sangs rgyas la dmigs pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: The forty eight minds that focus on the three realms without exception and the mind that focuses on the Buddha arise in succession.

original: ji ltar 'dis khams gsum po 'di las sems can thar bar mdzad do zhes bya ba'i sems 'di dang de'i 'og tu sems gnyis pa skye bar 'gyur te ;
analyzed: ji ltar 'dis khams gsum po 'di las sems can thar bar mdzad do zhes bya ba'i sems 'di dang de'i 'og tu sems gnyis pa skye bar 'gyur te ;
translated: After that, a second thought arises:üîΩI too will liberate in that way.

original: bdag gis kyang de bzhin du thar bar bgyi'o zhes bdag la dmigs pa'i phyir de ltar sems lnga bcur 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang de bzhin du thar bar bgyi'o zhes bdag la dmigs pa'i phyir de ltar sems lnga bcur 'gyur zhing /
translated: Since it is focused on the self, it becomes five thoughts.üîΩSince it is made manifest twice, it becomes one hundred thoughts.

original: de yang lan gnyis mngon sum du byas pa las sems brgyar 'gyur ba de ltar na bsod nams brgya zhes smra'o //
analyzed: de yang lan gnyis mngon sum du byas pa las sems brgyar 'gyur ba de ltar na bsod nams brgya zhes smra'o //
translated: Thus, it is said to be one hundred merits.

original: ao ra ti ka ni lus sogs pa'i bya ba @63b ma dad pa skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ao ra ti ka ni lus sogs pa'i bya ba @63b ma dad pa skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: Ortikas are the body, etc.

original: chol zangs ni 'dir rkang khrus snod kyi ming ngo //
analyzed: chol zangs ni 'dir rkang khrus snod kyi ming ngo //
translated: The copper basin here is the name of a foot-washing vessel.

original: gtsug lag khang na gnyug mar gnas pa ni gnod sbyin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang na gnyug mar gnas pa ni gnod sbyin la sogs pa'o //
translated: The permanent residents of the monastery are yakshas, etc.

original: 'khru ba ni aa ru ra la sogs pa'i rdzas sngon du song ba can gyi 'chug pa'o //
analyzed: 'khru ba ni aa ru ra la sogs pa'i rdzas sngon du song ba can gyi 'chug pa'o //
translated: The washing is a cloth that has been previously treated with substances such as myrobalan.

original: shing zhes bya ba ni lcug ma'i tshogs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: shing zhes bya ba ni lcug ma'i tshogs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The tree is a collection of vines.

original: lci phye ni lci ba skams pa'i phye ma'o //
analyzed: lci phye ni lci ba skams pa'i phye ma'o //
translated: Coarse flour is the flour of dried feces.

original: dka' bas bslang ba nyid yin pa'i phyir gnas ngan te sdug bsngal gyi rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dka' bas bslang ba nyid yin pa'i phyir gnas ngan te sdug bsngal gyi rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is called ‚Äúbad condition‚Äù because it is difficult to obtain. It means the cause of suffering.

original: de khas len pa'i phyir gnas ngan len yin la /
analyzed: de khas len pa'i phyir gnas ngan len yin la /
translated: It is bad condition because it is accepted.

original: gnas ngan len kun tu spyod pa ste /
analyzed: gnas ngan len kun tu spyod pa ste /
translated: It is the practice of bad condition.

original: lus dang ngag gi spyod pa gang la yod pa de ni gnas ngan len kun tu spyod pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi spyod pa gang la yod pa de ni gnas ngan len kun tu spyod pa'o //
translated: It is the practice of bad condition that exists in the conduct of body and speech.

original: don med par byas pa ni dbang du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: don med par byas pa ni dbang du gyur pa'o //
translated: It is useless because it is under control.

original: dad pa yod pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni dad pa med par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa yod pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni dad pa med par gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the absence of faith that exists where there is no faith.

original: smad pa'i dngos po la 'chol ba'i phyir le lo can no //
analyzed: smad pa'i dngos po la 'chol ba'i phyir le lo can no //
translated: It is laziness because it is the cause of the loss of what has been obtained.

original: tshig ngan ni tshig brnag par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: tshig ngan ni tshig brnag par mi nus pa'o //
translated: Bad speech is speech that cannot be trusted.

original: mi gus pa ni gus par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi gus pa ni gus par mi byed pa'o //
translated: Disrespect is the lack of respect.

original: sdig pa smad pa'i grogs su gyur pa gang yin pa de ni sdig pa'i grogs por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa smad pa'i grogs su gyur pa gang yin pa de ni sdig pa'i grogs por gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the cause of evil friends because it is the cause of the loss of what has been obtained.

original: dbyen du gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbyen du gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is called ‚Äúbelonging to division‚Äù because it is the cause of the loss of what has been obtained.

original: dge 'dun gyi dbyen pa dang 'brel pa'o //üîΩgzu bo skos shig ces bya ba ni drang por byed pa bsko ba'o //üîΩyo byad drug po zhes bya ba ni chos gos gsum dang gding ba dang / lhung bzed dang / chu tshags so //üîΩso phag gi phye ma ni pha gu so btang ba'i phye ma shin tu zhib pa ma yin pa'o //üîΩkun du chags par bya ba ni g-yo ba brtan por bya ba'i phyir shing la sogs pas kun nas bcing ba'i thabs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbyen pa dang 'brel pa'o // gzu bo skos shig ces bya ba ni drang por byed pa bsko ba'o // yo byad drug po zhes bya ba ni chos gos gsum dang gding ba dang / lhung bzed dang / chu tshags so // so phag gi phye ma ni pha gu so btang ba'i phye ma shin tu zhib pa ma yin pa'o // kun du chags par bya ba ni g-yo ba brtan por bya ba'i phyir shing la sogs pas kun nas bcing ba'i thabs su gyur pa'o //
translated: and the schism in the Sangha.üîΩThe word appoint means to assign.üîΩ The six articles are the three robes, the sitting mat, the begging bowl, and the water strainer.üîΩThe word mortar means a stone for grinding.üîΩ The word cement means a very fine powder of baked bricks.üîΩ The word binding means a means of binding with wood, etc., in order to make a swing stable.üîΩ

original: ka ba'i bar du spang leb kyis chod cig ces bya ba ni 'dir shing leb la spang leb kyi sgras bstan pa yin no //üîΩbsod nams kyi thabs ni bsod nams kyi 'bab stegs so //
analyzed: ka ba'i bar du spang leb kyis chod cig ces bya ba ni 'dir shing leb la spang leb kyi sgras bstan pa yin no //üîΩbsod nams kyi thabs ni bsod nams kyi 'bab stegs so //

original: khrel bar gyur pa'i ngang tshul gyis bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sa gzhi sbyongs shing byi dor byas pa'i sdig pa bsngags par gyur pas so //
analyzed: khrel bar gyur pa'i ngang tshul gyis bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sa gzhi sbyongs shing byi dor byas pa'i sdig pa bsngags par gyur pas so //
translated: The activity of one who is ashamed is praised by the Lord as the purification and polishing of the ground.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'don pas zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa klag pas so //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'don pas zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa klag pas so //
translated: By reciting verses means by reciting verses spoken by the Buddha.

original: mi shes pa rnam pa thams cad du spangs pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'o //üîΩyul thams cad mkhyen pas na thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa de'i phyir shes bya ste /
analyzed: mi shes pa rnam pa thams cad du spangs pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'o // yul thams cad mkhyen pas na thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa de'i phyir shes bya ste /
translated: Omniscience is the abandonment of all ignorance.

original: shes par bya ba'i dngos po dag la dbang @64a * //
analyzed: shes par bya ba'i dngos po dag la dbang @64a * //
translated: Since he knows all objects, he is omniscient. Therefore, he has attained mastery over all knowable things.

original: thob pa'o // rnam pa thams cad du khong du chud pa'i phyir bdag po thob par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: thob pa'o // rnam pa thams cad du khong du chud pa'i phyir bdag po thob par gyur pa'o //
translated: He has attained mastery over all objects of knowledge, since he has realized all aspects.

original: dad pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la sogs pa las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa dang / gzhan yang bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos pos skyes pa yid ches pa'o//
analyzed: dad pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la sogs pa las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa dang / gzhan yang bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos pos skyes pa yid ches pa'o//
translated: Faith is the confidence that arises from the relation between action and result, such as dependent origination, and from the relation between cause and effect, such as the elements.

original: sdig pa las rnam par ldog pa'i phyir bzang po'o //
analyzed: sdig pa las rnam par ldog pa'i phyir bzang po'o //
translated: It is good because it turns one away from evil.

original: bsam pa dge ba ni dge ba'i chos la 'jug pa'i sems te /
analyzed: bsam pa dge ba ni dge ba'i chos la 'jug pa'i sems te /
translated: The virtuous intention is the mind that engages in virtuous dharmas.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don du sbyin pa gtong bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni thams cad yongs su gtong ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don du sbyin pa gtong bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni thams cad yongs su gtong ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The one who gives gifts for the sake of all sentient beings is called the one who gives everything,

original: bdag nyid kyi bde ba la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi bde ba la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is not concerned with his own happiness.

original: 'dod pa ni dad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni dad pa'o //
translated: Desire is faith.

original: gser phur dang zhes bya ba ni 'dir gser phur gyi sgras gser to lo 'bum ston to //
analyzed: gser phur dang zhes bya ba ni 'dir gser phur gyi sgras gser to lo 'bum ston to //
translated: The word golden spade here indicates a hundred thousand golden coins.

original: rgyal po zhes bya ba ni grong khyer gyi bdag po'i rgyal po la 'bod pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po zhes bya ba ni grong khyer gyi bdag po'i rgyal po la 'bod pa'o //
translated: The word king refers to the king who is the lord of the city.

original: 'dod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ji ltar na thos bar 'gyur zhe'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ji ltar na thos bar 'gyur zhe'o //
translated: For the sake of desire means in order to hear.

original: kun du gdungs par 'gyur ba zhes bya bya ni ma rnyed pas gdungs pa nyams su myong bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: kun du gdungs par 'gyur ba zhes bya bya ni ma rnyed pas gdungs pa nyams su myong bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The one called tormented is one who experiences torment from not finding.

original: gsang ba pa zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin gyi ming gi rnam grangs yin la /
analyzed: gsang ba pa zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin gyi ming gi rnam grangs yin la /
translated: The one called secret is a synonym for yak·π£a.

original: gzugs bsgyur nas zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa 'jigs pa skyed par byed par bsgyur ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs bsgyur nas zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa 'jigs pa skyed par byed par bsgyur ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Having changed his form means having changed his form to generate fear in the eyes, etc.

original: chos spyod ces bya ba ni gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: chos spyod ces bya ba ni gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Dharma means should be practiced.

original: chos la rnam pa mang ba nyid kyi phyir mngon par 'dod par bya ba legs par spyad pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: chos la rnam pa mang ba nyid kyi phyir mngon par 'dod par bya ba legs par spyad pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Because there are many types of Dharma, good conduct that is to be desired is mentioned.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa las ldog pa'i ngo bo dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa 'jug pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa las ldog pa'i ngo bo dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa 'jug pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: the nature of turning away from killing, etc., and the nature of engaging in giving, etc.

original: nyes byas spyod pa ma spyod cig ces bya ba ni nyes par spyod pa'i phyir tshul can gyi chos lhag par spyad par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyes byas spyod pa ma spyod cig ces bya ba ni nyes par spyod pa'i phyir tshul can gyi chos lhag par spyad par mi bya ba'o //
translated: Do not practice bad conduct means: do not practice Dharma that has the nature of bad conduct.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos spyod bde bar gnas pa ni //
analyzed: chos spyod bde bar gnas pa ni //
translated: Abiding happily in the practice of Dharma

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus it is said.üîΩüîΩ

original: gang gi phyir legs par spyad pa'i rang bzhin can gyi chos spyod pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir grags pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas bde bar gnas pa dang / pha rol du mngon bar 'dod pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur pa de'i phyir 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol du zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir legs par spyad pa'i rang bzhin can gyi chos spyod pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir grags pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas bde bar gnas pa dang / pha rol du mngon bar 'dod pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur pa de'i phyir 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol du zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: Because the practice of Dharma, which is of the nature of good conduct, is here the happy abiding in terms of fame, etc., and the attainment of the result that is desired in the other world, therefore, it is said: in this world and the next.

original: me mur dang ni seng ldeng gi me mdag gis yongs su gang bar gyur pa'i me mar mur gyi dong ngo //
analyzed: me mur dang ni seng ldeng gi me mdag gis yongs su gang bar gyur pa'i me mar mur gyi dong ngo //
translated: The pit of live coals is completely filled with burning coals of the khadira tree.

original: cher 'jigs byed ces bya ba ni cher skrag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: cher 'jigs byed ces bya ba ni cher skrag par byed pa'o //
translated: The great terror is the great fear.

original: nyi ma 'char ka'i dmar po bzhin//
analyzed: nyi ma 'char ka'i dmar po bzhin//
translated: Like the red glow of the rising sunüîΩ.

original: @64b zhes pa ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor shar ma thag pa'i 'od dang 'dra ba'am /
analyzed: @64b zhes pa ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor shar ma thag pa'i 'od dang 'dra ba'am /
translated: This is like the light of the sun mandala as soon as it rises,

original: me dang 'dra bar ro //
analyzed: me dang 'dra bar ro //
translated: or like fire.

original: chos kyi phyir te chos kyi rgyu mtshan gyis bor ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi phyir te chos kyi rgyu mtshan gyis bor ba'o //
translated: For the sake of Dharma, for the reason of Dharma, one should cast it aside.

original: nges pa yid kyis zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis yin gyi /
analyzed: nges pa yid kyis zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis yin gyi /
translated: By the mind that is certain means by the mind that is naturally certain,

original: bcos ma'i sems kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bcos ma'i sems kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: and not by the mind that is artificially certain.

original: 'jigs pa med ces bya ba ni skrag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa med ces bya ba ni skrag pa med pa'o //
translated: Fearless means without fear.

original: bdag chos nyan pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis lus bor ba gang yin pa de ni bdag gi bsod nams kyis me mar mur gyi dong 'di dge bar 'gyur ba ni me'i gdung ba dang yongs su bral ba'o //
analyzed: bdag chos nyan pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis lus bor ba gang yin pa de ni bdag gi bsod nams kyis me mar mur gyi dong 'di dge bar 'gyur ba ni me'i gdung ba dang yongs su bral ba'o //
translated: If I were to give up my body for the sake of listening to the Dharma, then by my merit this pit of fire would become a virtuous place, completely free from the torment of fire.

original: tsan dan 'dam ste tsan dan gyi lde gu des bsgos pa dang / pad mas chu khebs par gyur pa ni pad ma can no //
analyzed: tsan dan 'dam ste tsan dan gyi lde gu des bsgos pa dang / pad mas chu khebs par gyur pa ni pad ma can no //
translated: The sandalwood mud is the mud made from sandalwood, and the lotus pond is the pond covered with lotuses.

original: bkur sti bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bsnyen bkur ni sems kyis chon po nyid du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bkur sti bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bsnyen bkur ni sems kyis chon po nyid du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: With respect to should be honored, etc., should be revered means should be held in the mind as most precious.

original: bla mar bya ba ni ston pa nyid du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bla mar bya ba ni ston pa nyid du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Should be esteemed means should be held as a teacher.

original: rim gror bya ba ni chos mang po dag las chen por 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rim gror bya ba ni chos mang po dag las chen por 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Should be respected means should be held as the greatest of many Dharmas.

original: mchod pa ni phyag la sogs pas so //
analyzed: mchod pa ni phyag la sogs pas so //
translated: Should be worshipped means with prostrations, etc.

original: mi rigs pa'i gtam ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i gtam ste /
analyzed: mi rigs pa'i gtam ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i gtam ste /
translated: Improper talk is false talk.

original: bud med dang / rkun po dang / rgyal po la sogs pa'i gtam dag go //
analyzed: bud med dang / rkun po dang / rgyal po la sogs pa'i gtam dag go //
translated: It is talk about women, thieves, kings, and so on.

original: dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa yid la byed pa byed pa ni 'phags pa'i mi smra bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa yid la byed pa byed pa ni 'phags pa'i mi smra bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The mental attention of virtuous thoughts is the noble silence.

original: mi brtan pa ni g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: mi brtan pa ni g-yo ba'o //
translated: Unstable is fickle.

original: bza' ba dang btung ba'i cho ga la zhes bya ba ni bza' ba dang btung ba'i sgrub pa la'o //
analyzed: bza' ba dang btung ba'i cho ga la zhes bya ba ni bza' ba dang btung ba'i sgrub pa la'o //
translated: The rules for eating and drinking are the means of obtaining food and drink.

original: gnas mal gyi cho ga la zhes bya ba ni gnas mal bsham pa'i bya ba la'o //
analyzed: gnas mal gyi cho ga la zhes bya ba ni gnas mal bsham pa'i bya ba la'o //
translated: The rules for bedding and cushions are the activities of arranging bedding and cushions.

original: kha zas la chags pa'i rang bzhin can ni brkam chags can no //
analyzed: kha zas la chags pa'i rang bzhin can ni brkam chags can no //
translated: One who is greedy for food is greedy.

original: rgyags nas zhes bya ba ni gnong sems kyis so //
analyzed: rgyags nas zhes bya ba ni gnong sems kyis so //
translated: Being intoxicated is being shameless.

original: srog la 'bab pa ni 'chi ba dang nye bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: srog la 'bab pa ni 'chi ba dang nye bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Life-threatening is being close to death.

original: gzims pa zhes bya ba ni gnyid log par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzims pa zhes bya ba ni gnyid log par gyur pa'o //
translated: Sleeping is falling asleep.

original: gcig ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dgra bcom pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba can gang yin pa de ni rtag par lta ba yin te /
analyzed: gcig ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dgra bcom pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba can gang yin pa de ni rtag par lta ba yin te /
translated: The view that denies the arhat is the view of eternalism.

original: dgra bcom pa thob par byed pa'i lam la skur pa 'debs pa las 'jig rten 'di rtag pa yin no zhes rtag par lta ba dang ; 'jig rten pha rol la skur ba 'debs pa gang yin pa bde ni 'chi ba las pha rol cung zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes mthong ba'i phyir chad par lta ba'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa thob par byed pa'i lam la skur pa 'debs pa las 'jig rten 'di rtag pa yin no zhes rtag par lta ba dang ; 'jig rten pha rol la skur ba 'debs pa gang yin pa bde ni 'chi ba las pha rol cung zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes mthong ba'i phyir chad par lta ba'o //
translated: Because it denies the path that leads to the attainment of arhatship, it is the view of eternalism that holds that this world is eternal. The view that denies the existence of the other world is the view of annihilationism, because it holds that nothing whatsoever exists beyond death.

original: rgya che ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sems can rgya che bas bsten pa nyid kyi phyir rgya che ba yin la /üîΩ'jigs pa med pa nyid kyi @65a * //
analyzed: rgya che ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sems can rgya che bas bsten pa nyid kyi phyir rgya che ba yin la / 'jigs pa med pa nyid kyi @65a * //
translated: It is vast, etc. It is vast because it is the support of vast sentient beings.

original: phyir khyu mchog yin la /
analyzed: phyir khyu mchog yin la /
translated: It is the leader because it is fearless.

original: khyu mchog dang 'dra ba yin bas na khyu mchog lta bu'o //
analyzed: khyu mchog dang 'dra ba yin bas na khyu mchog lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the leader because it is similar to the leader.

original: cha gcig gzung ste zhes bya ba ni gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba nyid du khas blangs nas so //
analyzed: cha gcig gzung ste zhes bya ba ni gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba nyid du khas blangs nas so //
translated: It is said to be the one part that is grasped, because it is the one part that is definitely accepted.

original: tshig gzhan thams cad zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir seng ge'i sgra'o //
analyzed: tshig gzhan thams cad zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir seng ge'i sgra'o //
translated: The lion's roar is so called because it overwhelms all other words.

original: pha ma dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba ni pha ma dang mtshungs par ro //
analyzed: pha ma dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba ni pha ma dang mtshungs par ro //
translated: Like a father and mother means like a father and mother.

original: yongs su skyo ba zhes bya ba ni dub pa'i gdung pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su skyo ba zhes bya ba ni dub pa'i gdung pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur pa'o //
translated: Weary means experiencing the torment of exhaustion.

original: dge ba 'chab pa ni yon tan sbed pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba 'chab pa ni yon tan sbed pa'o //
translated: Concealing virtue means hiding one's good qualities.

original: nyes pa sgrog pa zhes bya ba ni nyes pa rab tu gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa sgrog pa zhes bya ba ni nyes pa rab tu gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: Proclaiming faults means revealing one's faults.

original: gnas gang la snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba la gnas gang gi phyir snyoms par zhugs pa ni gnas gang la snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas gang la snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba la gnas gang gi phyir snyoms par zhugs pa ni gnas gang la snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
translated: The state of meditative equipoise means the state for which one has entered meditative equipoise.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa thob par byed pa'i lam dang bcom pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa thob par byed pa'i lam dang bcom pa nyid la'o //
translated: Supramundane refers to the path that leads to the attainment of arhatship and to arhatship itself.

original: bsil khang ni khang pa nyid rtseg gam sum rtseg can steng khang bzangs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bsil khang ni khang pa nyid rtseg gam sum rtseg can steng khang bzangs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: A pavilion is a building with multiple stories, such as two or three stories.

original: tshva khug ni lan tshva 'jog par byed pa'i snod do //
analyzed: tshva khug ni lan tshva 'jog par byed pa'i snod do //
translated: A salt cellar is a container for storing salt.

original: ba lci'i nang du bskol la zhes bya ba ni lci ba dang ba'i chu'i nang du bskol bar byas te'o //
analyzed: ba lci'i nang du bskol la zhes bya ba ni lci ba dang ba'i chu'i nang du bskol bar byas te'o //
translated: Cooked in cow dung means cooked in water mixed with cow dung.

original: sman phor zhes bya ba la sman sbyin pa'i phyir khar ba las byas pa'i snod nad pas bdag gir byas pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sman phor zhes bya ba la sman sbyin pa'i phyir khar ba las byas pa'i snod nad pas bdag gir byas pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: A medicine bowl is a vessel made of horn that belongs to the patient for the purpose of giving medicine. There is no fault.

original: dri dag gis byugs pa ni 'dir dris bsgos pa yin no //
analyzed: dri dag gis byugs pa ni 'dir dris bsgos pa yin no //
translated: Anointed with perfumes means perfumed with scents.

original: seng ras zhes bya ba ni gos seng ba'o //üîΩsnabs ni sna nas 'dzag pa'o //
analyzed: seng ras zhes bya ba ni gos seng ba'o // snabs ni sna nas 'dzag pa'o //
translated: A cloth is a garment.üîΩSnot is what drips from the nose.

original: mchil ma ni kha nas 'dzag pa'o //
analyzed: mchil ma ni kha nas 'dzag pa'o //
translated: Spittle is what drips from the mouth.

original: glang po che'i rmig mthil lta bu zhes bya ba ni 'og gi cha glang po che'i rmig mthil lta bu'o //
analyzed: glang po che'i rmig mthil lta bu zhes bya ba ni 'og gi cha glang po che'i rmig mthil lta bu'o //
translated: Like the sole of an elephant means the lower part is like the sole of an elephant.

original: zer mas phog nas zhes bya ba ni gos la sogs pa la mchil ma'i dum bu dag babs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zer mas phog nas zhes bya ba ni gos la sogs pa la mchil ma'i dum bu dag babs par gyur pa'o //
translated: Hit by a whip means drops of spittle fall on the cloth and so on.

original: rtse ba ni bud med rnams dang rdo 'phen pa la sogs pas bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rtse ba ni bud med rnams dang rdo 'phen pa la sogs pas bsgrub pa'o //
translated: Play is to engage in sports with women, throwing stones, and so on.

original: dga' ba ni 'khyud pa dang 'o byed pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: dga' ba ni 'khyud pa dang 'o byed pa la sogs pas so //
translated: Joy is to embrace, kiss, and so on.

original: mgu ba ni 'khrig pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: mgu ba ni 'khrig pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: The pleasing is by way of sexual intercourse.

original: rgyan ni lus mdzes pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyan ni lus mdzes pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: The ornaments are what make the body beautiful.

original: khra bor gyur te zhes bya ba ni bkra ba dang nye bar bkra bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: khra bor gyur te zhes bya ba ni bkra ba dang nye bar bkra bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The variegated is the variegated and the variegated-near.

original: 'jug pa ni khrus kyi don du'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni khrus kyi don du'o //
translated: The entering is for the purpose of bathing.

original: lcags kyi gzhong rings ni lcags las byas pa'i gzhong pa'o //
analyzed: lcags kyi gzhong rings ni lcags las byas pa'i gzhong pa'o //
translated: The iron basin is a basin made of iron.

original: me phyung la zhes bya ba ni bskyed nas so //
analyzed: me phyung la zhes bya ba ni bskyed nas so //
translated: The fire is what is produced.

original: dus ston ni dus tshigs kyi'o //
analyzed: dus ston ni dus tshigs kyi'o //
translated: The festival is the seasonal.

original: sdigs par byed pa ni gshe ba dang bcas pa'i tshig gis zil gyis gnon @65b par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sdigs par byed pa ni gshe ba dang bcas pa'i tshig gis zil gyis gnon @65b par byed pa'o //
translated: The threat is the oppression by words with contempt.

original: mtha' zegs pa zhes bya ba ni mtha'i phyogs nas zad par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' zegs pa zhes bya ba ni mtha'i phyogs nas zad par gyur pa'o //
translated: The edge is what is exhausted from the end.

original: zhal ta byos la bkru bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos gos nyams pa yong su spang bar bya ba'i phyir rjes su gnang bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhal ta byos la bkru bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos gos nyams pa yong su spang bar bya ba'i phyir rjes su gnang bar bya'o //
translated: The service is the permission to be given for the purpose of abandoning the fault of the robe.

original: brdabs te zhes bya ba ni phan tshun brdeg spyad kyis brdabs pa'o //
analyzed: brdabs te zhes bya ba ni phan tshun brdeg spyad kyis brdabs pa'o //
translated: The striking is the striking by mutual beating.

original: rgyun ni mchil lham gyi sgro gu'o //
analyzed: rgyun ni mchil lham gyi sgro gu'o //
translated: The strap is the strap of a shoe.

original: dul bar mi byed pa zhes bya ba ni lugs ma yin pa dang / tshul ma yin pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: dul bar mi byed pa zhes bya ba ni lugs ma yin pa dang / tshul ma yin pa byed pa'o //
translated: Not being disciplined means acting in a way that is not proper and not in accordance with the rules.

original: rnga ma'i srad bu ni rta'i mjug ma la sogs pa'i rnga ma la sogs pa las byas pa'o //
analyzed: rnga ma'i srad bu ni rta'i mjug ma la sogs pa'i rnga ma la sogs pa las byas pa'o //
translated: The leather strap is made from the tail of a horse, etc.

original: sprul pa ni sprul pa'i cha lugs so //
analyzed: sprul pa ni sprul pa'i cha lugs so //
translated: The form is the appearance of an emanation.

original: gnas ni tshang ngo //
analyzed: gnas ni tshang ngo //
translated: The place is the nest.

original: kha dog shin tu bzang bas zhes bya ba ni mi'i kha dog las shin tu 'das pa ste /
analyzed: kha dog shin tu bzang bas zhes bya ba ni mi'i kha dog las shin tu 'das pa ste /
translated: Very beautiful color means surpassing the color of humans,

original: lha'i gzugs su sprul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha'i gzugs su sprul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is emanated in the form of a god.

original: song ba ni rab tu zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: song ba ni rab tu zhugs pa'o //
translated: Gone means fully engaged.

original: gang gis dran par byas pa de ni dran par bgyi bar gsol ba ste /
analyzed: gang gis dran par byas pa de ni dran par bgyi bar gsol ba ste /
translated: That which is made mindful is the request to be mindful.

original: bdag gis bya pa ma yin pa 'di mi bya'o zhes dran pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gis bya pa ma yin pa 'di mi bya'o zhes dran pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it makes one mindful, thinking, I will not do this unwholesome action.

original: mi mdzes shing zhes bya ba ni bzang po ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi mdzes shing zhes bya ba ni bzang po ma yin pa'o //
translated: Not beautiful means not good.

original: mi rigs pa ni dge slong gi tshul ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi rigs pa ni dge slong gi tshul ma yin pa'o //
translated: Not proper means not in accordance with a monk's way of life.

original: shur bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la skud pa mang po las lhas pa srab pa zhing che bar gyur pa ni shur bu'o //
analyzed: shur bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la skud pa mang po las lhas pa srab pa zhing che bar gyur pa ni shur bu'o //
translated: A ‚Äúblanket‚Äù is a large piece of cloth made of many threads.

original: lcag pod ni zur bzhi ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: lcag pod ni zur bzhi ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: A ‚Äúpillow‚Äù is a square shape.

original: rgya cang ni steng 'og nas skud pa mang po dang lhas pa nyid do//
analyzed: rgya cang ni steng 'og nas skud pa mang po dang lhas pa nyid do//
translated: A ‚Äúnet‚Äù is made of many threads above and below.

original: shur bu phre'u ni skud pa phra mo dang lhas pa lnga 'am drug tu byas pas dra ba ltar bar bar du 'brel pa can no //
analyzed: shur bu phre'u ni skud pa phra mo dang lhas pa lnga 'am drug tu byas pas dra ba ltar bar bar du 'brel pa can no //
translated: A ‚Äúnet-like cloth‚Äù is made of five or six thin threads, connected by a net-like pattern.

original: nags ni thibs po'i phyogs so //
analyzed: nags ni thibs po'i phyogs so //
translated: A ‚Äúthicket‚Äù is a dense area.

original: rdo'i yol go ni rdo las bsgrubs pa'i bza' ba'i snod do //
analyzed: rdo'i yol go ni rdo las bsgrubs pa'i bza' ba'i snod do //
translated: A ‚Äústone plate‚Äù is a plate for eating made of stone.

original: 'gyod pa skyes nas ma blangs pa na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'gyod pa skyes nas ma blangs pa na zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúHaving given rise to regret, they do not take it‚Äù means:

original: gang las de dag 'dir 'gyod pa skyes par gyur pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang las de dag 'dir 'gyod pa skyes par gyur pa yin zhe na /
translated: From what do they give rise to regret here?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: dge slong dag la blo 'di skye ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag la blo 'di skye ste /
translated: Monks give rise to this thought:

original: 'di ltar bdag cag gis sngar rdo'i snod de dag la zos shing kho bo cag la rang gi lag pas kyang ma sbyangs pa nyi ma phyed las gzhan du khyim pas bkrus nas yang 'ga' zhig tu des zang zing med par ma byas pa srid pa de'i phyir
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag cag gis sngar rdo'i snod de dag la zos shing kho bo cag la rang gi lag pas kyang ma sbyangs pa nyi ma phyed las gzhan du khyim pas bkrus nas yang 'ga' zhig tu des zang zing med par ma byas pa srid pa de'i phyir
translated: Thus, we have eaten from those stone bowls, and we have not washed them with our own hands, except at noon. The householder has washed them.

original: de la 'bags pa'i zang zing ye bar gyur pa'i 'jigs pas de dag 'gyod pa skyes par gyur pa yin no //üîΩkhyim pa ni yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba la khyim pa'i snod de dag la 'dir sbags pa'i longs spyod pa'i kha na ma tho ba 'byung ba med pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'bags pa'i zang zing ye bar gyur pa'i 'jigs pas de dag 'gyod pa skyes par gyur pa yin no // khyim pa ni yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba la khyim pa'i snod de dag la 'dir sbags pa'i longs spyod pa'i kha na ma tho ba 'byung ba med pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, we have generated regret, fearing that the food that has been defiled by us will be given to others.

original: 'o ma can zhes bya @66a * //üîΩba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'o ma can zhes bya @66a * // ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The householder is pure means that the food that has been defiled in those bowls of the householder does not give rise to the sin of consumption.üîΩThe passage beginning with ‚ÄúThe milk tree‚Äù is as follows.

original: pib pa la la sogs pa 'o ma can gyi shing gi shun pa tshos nyid du nye bar mkho ba yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: pib pa la la sogs pa 'o ma can gyi shing gi shun pa tshos nyid du nye bar mkho ba yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: The bark of the milk tree, etc., is needed for dyeing.

original: ji srid skams par ma gyur pa de srid du tshon phyin par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji srid skams par ma gyur pa de srid du tshon phyin par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, as long as it is not dry, it is not able to take the dye.

original: rlams pa ni hams par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rlams pa ni hams par gyur pa'o //
translated: The word ha·πÉsa means one who makes a ha·πÉsa sound.

original: nyi grib phyed pa ni nyi ma gos seng bas bar du bcad pa'o //
analyzed: nyi grib phyed pa ni nyi ma gos seng bas bar du bcad pa'o //
translated: The half-sun means the sun is covered by a cloth.

original: grva nas skud pas thogs la zhes bya ba ni mtha' ma'i phyogs la skud pas btags shing skud pa de shing bu la bskyon te gzar thag la gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: grva nas skud pas thogs la zhes bya ba ni mtha' ma'i phyogs la skud pas btags shing skud pa de shing bu la bskyon te gzar thag la gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The word corner means the end of the cloth is tied to a stick, and that stick is placed in the rope.

original: nyi ma gzhan la chu blug par bya'o zhes bya ba de ni tshos 'dzag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyi ma gzhan la chu blug par bya'o zhes bya ba de ni tshos 'dzag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word other day means the next day.

original: bsku zhing byug par bya'o zhes bya ba la phyogs gcig zhal zhal byas pa ni bskus pa'o //
analyzed: bsku zhing byug par bya'o zhes bya ba la phyogs gcig zhal zhal byas pa ni bskus pa'o //
translated: The word anoint means to smear one side of the cloth.

original: phyogs kun zhal zhal byas pa ni byugs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs kun zhal zhal byas pa ni byugs pa'o //
translated: The word apply means to smear all sides of the cloth.

original: legs so legs so zhes bya ba de ni rigs so rigs so zhes zlos ba'i tshig gnyis yin no //
analyzed: legs so legs so zhes bya ba de ni rigs so rigs so zhes zlos ba'i tshig gnyis yin no //
translated: The word good is repeated twice, meaning it is appropriate, it is appropriate.

original: bram ze dang khyim bdag gis khyim gyi bza' ba stobs par byed pas na stobs pa ste /
analyzed: bram ze dang khyim bdag gis khyim gyi bza' ba stobs par byed pas na stobs pa ste /
translated: The word bhik·π£ƒÅ means to give food from the house.

original: de gang la yod pa de ni bsod snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni bsod snyoms pa'o //
translated: The word bhik·π£u means one who receives alms.

original: rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi bdun zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi bdun zhes bya ba la /
translated: The seven bases of meritorious works that arise from giving material things

original: rdzas ni skyed mos tshal dang / gtsug lag khang la sogs pa'i don gyi nor yin la /
analyzed: rdzas ni skyed mos tshal dang / gtsug lag khang la sogs pa'i don gyi nor yin la /
translated: Material things are wealth such as gardens, temples, etc.

original: rdzas las byung ba ni rgyu mtshan gyi mdun ma'i dbang du byas nas rdzas las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rdzas las byung ba ni rgyu mtshan gyi mdun ma'i dbang du byas nas rdzas las byung ba'o //
translated: That which arises from material things is that which arises from material things in consideration of the cause, the gift.

original: dge ba nyid yin pa'i phyir bsod nams yin la /
analyzed: dge ba nyid yin pa'i phyir bsod nams yin la /
translated: It is merit because it is virtuous.

original: lus dang ngag gi las kyi rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir bya ba yin zhing sems kyi rten gyi dngos po yin pa'i phyir gzhi yin no //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las kyi rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir bya ba yin zhing sems kyi rten gyi dngos po yin pa'i phyir gzhi yin no //
translated: It is a work because it is by nature action of body and speech. It is a basis because it is the foundation of the mind.

original: bdun po gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdun po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven?

original: kun dga' ra ba 'bul ba dang / 'dir gtsug lag khang bstabs pa dang / de nyid du mal stan gyi phyir byin pa dang / stan gyi rkyen ris bstabs pa dang / glo bur du 'ongs pa dang / 'gro bar chas pa la byin pa dang /
analyzed: kun dga' ra ba 'bul ba dang / 'dir gtsug lag khang bstabs pa dang / de nyid du mal stan gyi phyir byin pa dang / stan gyi rkyen ris bstabs pa dang / glo bur du 'ongs pa dang / 'gro bar chas pa la byin pa dang /
translated: Giving a park, giving a temple, giving bedding and seats in that temple, giving robes, giving the four necessities to visitors, giving the four necessities to those who are leaving, and giving the four necessities to the community of monks.

original: nad pa dang g-yog la byin pa dang / rlung langs pa dang / lhags pa byung ba la sogs pa'i phyir byin pa'o //
analyzed: nad pa dang g-yog la byin pa dang / rlung langs pa dang / lhags pa byung ba la sogs pa'i phyir byin pa'o //
translated: and when there is wind, rain, or cold.

original: gtsug lag khang gzhan gyi thang bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gang gtsug lag khang gzhan gyi dge slong dag gi thang bzhin du'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gzhan gyi thang bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gang gtsug lag khang gzhan gyi dge slong dag gi thang bzhin du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLike the floor of another monastery‚Äù means like the floor of the monks of another monastery.

original: sba'i lcug ma dang ko rgyun dang lhas pa ni mkhregs pa nyid kyi phyir gcad par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sba'i lcug ma dang ko rgyun dang lhas pa ni mkhregs pa nyid kyi phyir gcad par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúGrass, twigs, and leaves‚Äù are hard, so they should be cut.

original: nad pa la yang pags pa'i stan nyes pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: nad pa la yang pags pa'i stan nyes pa med pa yin no //
translated: Even for the sick, a skin mat is not faulty.

original: lo ma ltab @66b ba ni lo ma'i tshogs phan tshun brtsegs pa'o //
analyzed: lo ma ltab @66b ba ni lo ma'i tshogs phan tshun brtsegs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúA mat of leaves‚Äù is a pile of leaves.

original: 'bru mar tsha ba ni yungs kar ro //
analyzed: 'bru mar tsha ba ni yungs kar ro //
