translated: ‚ÄúHot oil‚Äù is mustard seed.

original: spags pa ni zang zing la sogs pas nye bar gos pa ste /üîΩdge slong spags pa la phyag mi bya /üîΩspags pas kyang phyag mi bya /
analyzed: spags pa ni zang zing la sogs pas nye bar gos pa ste / dge slong spags pa la phyag mi bya / spags pas kyang phyag mi bya /
translated: ‚ÄúSoiled‚Äù means defiled by excrement, etc.üîΩOne should not bow to a monk who is soiled.

original: spags pas phyag bdag gir mi bya /
analyzed: spags pas phyag bdag gir mi bya /
translated: One should not bow to one who is soiled.üîΩOne should not bow to one who is soiled.

original: gtsug tor zhes bya ba ni skra'i tshogs bcings pa'i gtsug tor ro //
analyzed: gtsug tor zhes bya ba ni skra'i tshogs bcings pa'i gtsug tor ro //
translated: The ‚Äúusnƒ´·π£a‚Äù is the topknot of hair.

original: yan lag lnga bkru bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni chu med par gyur pa dang nad pa cho ga 'di la yang dag par bsnyen par bya ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: yan lag lnga bkru bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni chu med par gyur pa dang nad pa cho ga 'di la yang dag par bsnyen par bya ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: ‚ÄúOne should wash the five parts‚Äù means that when there is no water, or when one is sick, one should perform this rite.

original: 'on kyang 'dir 'dod pas 'jug pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dir 'dod pas 'jug pas ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that one should do it here out of desire.

original: sngas su zhes bya ba sngas drung gi rtsig pa la khab bam phur pa gtsug pa de la gdags par bya'o //
analyzed: sngas su zhes bya ba sngas drung gi rtsig pa la khab bam phur pa gtsug pa de la gdags par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPillow‚Äù means that one should attach a needle or awl to a nail in the wall next to the pillow.

original: stan bzang po zhes bya ba ni stan gru bzhi pa chen po gos gya nom pa dang bcas pa'o //üîΩshing zur bzhi pa rgyab phyogs su bsgreng ba dang ldan pa'i stan ni rgyab rten dang bcas pa'i stan no //
analyzed: stan bzang po zhes bya ba ni stan gru bzhi pa chen po gos gya nom pa dang bcas pa'o // shing zur bzhi pa rgyab phyogs su bsgreng ba dang ldan pa'i stan ni rgyab rten dang bcas pa'i stan no //
translated: ‚ÄúGood seat‚Äù means a large square cushion with fine cloth.üîΩA seat with a back is a seat with a backrest, which is a wooden frame erected behind the seat.

original: ngos khung ni lhung bzed gzhag pa'i phyir rtsig ngos la glo skar gyi rnam pa can gyi bug pa gtod pa'o //
analyzed: ngos khung ni lhung bzed gzhag pa'i phyir rtsig ngos la glo skar gyi rnam pa can gyi bug pa gtod pa'o //
translated: A niche is a hole in the wall shaped like a niche for placing a bowl.

original: skon bu kha sbyar ni lcug ma las byas pa lhung bzed bzhag pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: skon bu kha sbyar ni lcug ma las byas pa lhung bzed bzhag pa'i gnas so //
translated: The two joined bowls were made of bamboo and were the place where the alms-bowl was kept.

original: 'bru mar snod kyi ko sku'i bar du shing bcug nas dge tshul dag gi phrag pa la bskyon nas bsod snyoms la zhugs par gyur pa na'o //
analyzed: 'bru mar snod kyi ko sku'i bar du shing bcug nas dge tshul dag gi phrag pa la bskyon nas bsod snyoms la zhugs par gyur pa na'o //
translated: The oil-container was a wooden box in which a stick was placed and the novices carried it on their shoulders when they went out for alms.

original: drug phul ni srang brgyad shong ba yin la /
analyzed: drug phul ni srang brgyad shong ba yin la /
translated: The six-measure is the one which holds eight seers.

original: bzhi pa ni drug phul phyed yin te /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni drug phul phyed yin te /
translated: The four-measure is half of the six-measure.

original: drug phul shong ba'i phyir drug phul lo //
analyzed: drug phul shong ba'i phyir drug phul lo //
translated: It is called six-measure because it holds six measures.

original: 'di gnyis gdon mi za bar mi gtang gis zhes bya ba ni bdag nges par 'di gnyis kyi phyi bzhin 'brang bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis gdon mi za bar mi gtang gis zhes bya ba ni bdag nges par 'di gnyis kyi phyi bzhin 'brang bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The two are not to be given up means that he will certainly follow after the two.

original: 'jigs par byed pa'i gzugs su sprul pa'i phyir skra gyen du brdzes pa dang thad kar brdzes pa'o ;
analyzed: 'jigs par byed pa'i gzugs su sprul pa'i phyir skra gyen du brdzes pa dang thad kar brdzes pa'o ;
translated: The hair is standing on end and is straight because he has emanated a fearful form.

original: / bag yod 'chi med gnas yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: / bag yod 'chi med gnas yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The verse beginning The heedful are in the abode of immortality and so on.

original: bag yod pa ni dge ba'i chos sgom pa'o //
analyzed: bag yod pa ni dge ba'i chos sgom pa'o //
translated: Heedfulness is the cultivation of virtuous dharmas.

original: 'chi med gnas yin te zhes bya ba 'chi med de srog dang bral ba med pa gang yin pa de ni 'chi med de /üîΩmya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'chi med gnas yin te zhes bya ba 'chi med de srog dang bral ba med pa gang yin pa de ni 'chi med de / mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The abode of immortality is the state of immortality, which is nirvana.

original: de'i gnas ni go 'phang yin /üîΩgang gi phyir bag yod pa la gnas na /
analyzed: de'i gnas ni go 'phang yin / gang gi phyir bag yod pa la gnas na /
translated: The abode of death is the state of death, which is samsara.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa rjes su thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩbag med pa zhes bya ba ni bag yod pa las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa rjes su thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // bag med pa zhes bya ba ni bag yod pa las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos yin no //
translated: Because one who is heedful does not attain nirvana,üîΩand one who is heedless does not die.

original: 'chi ba'i gnas zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i go 'phang yin te /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i gnas zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i go 'phang yin te /
translated: The abode of death is the state of death, which is samsara.

original: @67a * // gang gi phyir bag yod pa la gnas na 'khor bar yang dang yang du 'khor bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @67a * // gang gi phyir bag yod pa la gnas na 'khor bar yang dang yang du 'khor bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because one who is heedful does not attain nirvana,

original: bag yod 'chi bar mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: bag yod 'chi bar mi 'gyur te //
translated: and one who is heedless does not die.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu dang mood gal gyi bu chen po la sogs pa bag yod pa dag 'chi ba med pa'i go 'phang rjes su thob pa dag ni nam yang 'chi bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu dang mood gal gyi bu chen po la sogs pa bag yod pa dag 'chi ba med pa'i go 'phang rjes su thob pa dag ni nam yang 'chi bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: Those who are heedful, such as the noble Shariputra, Mahakashyapa, and so on, who have attained the state of immortality, never die.

original: ser skya la sogs pa bag med pa dag ni rtag tu 'chi ba nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ser skya la sogs pa bag med pa dag ni rtag tu 'chi ba nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: But those who are heedless, such as Kapila and so on, always die,

original: 'khor bar yang dang yang du 'khor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor bar yang dang yang du 'khor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they revolve again and again in cyclic existence.

original: gtum pa ni drag po 'am rtsub par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gtum pa ni drag po 'am rtsub par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Fierce means violent or rough.

original: gnod sbyin gtum bo ni lha'i phyogs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnod sbyin gtum bo ni lha'i phyogs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: The fierce yaksha is a type of god.

original: gtum po mi ma yin pa sha za dang / grul bum la sogs pa gtum po gnyug mar gnas pa ni nges pa can du gnas pa 'byung po'i bye brag go //üîΩthog mar glags tshol ba ni glags lta ba'o //
analyzed: gtum po mi ma yin pa sha za dang / grul bum la sogs pa gtum po gnyug mar gnas pa ni nges pa can du gnas pa 'byung po'i bye brag go // thog mar glags tshol ba ni glags lta ba'o //
translated: The fierce non-human flesh-eaters, such as rakshasas, kumbhandas, and so on, who are fierce and indigenous spirits, are a particular type of elemental spirit.

original: rgyun gyis ni skabs tshol ba'o //
analyzed: rgyun gyis ni skabs tshol ba'o //
translated: They seek an opportunity at the outset, so they are called opportunity-seekers.üîΩThey seek a chance through continuity, so they are called chance-seekers.

original: chos gos byas shing zin pa zhes bya ba ni chos gos btsems pa dang kha bsgyur ba la byas pa dang zin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos gos byas shing zin pa zhes bya ba ni chos gos btsems pa dang kha bsgyur ba la byas pa dang zin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe robes are made and finished‚Äù means that the robes are sewn and dyed.

original: glang po che'i sna lta bur gyur nas zhes bya ba ni glang po che'i sna bzhin du mi mdzes par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: glang po che'i sna lta bur gyur nas zhes bya ba ni glang po che'i sna bzhin du mi mdzes par gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThey become like the trunk of an elephant‚Äù means that they become ugly like the trunk of an elephant.

original: khyim nas zhes bya ba ni grong tha dad pa'i gzhan rnams lhags pa'o //
analyzed: khyim nas zhes bya ba ni grong tha dad pa'i gzhan rnams lhags pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the house‚Äù means from the houses of different villages.

original: zo ba ni khron pa'i nang nas chu blang ba'i thabs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zo ba ni khron pa'i nang nas chu blang ba'i thabs su gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúA bucket‚Äù is a device for drawing water from a well.

original: nan gyis zhes bya ba ni stobs sam nan gyis rnam pas tha snyad du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nan gyis zhes bya ba ni stobs sam nan gyis rnam pas tha snyad du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúForcefully‚Äù means by force or by pressure.

original: sen mo gcod pa ni sen mo gcod pa'i lag cha'o //
analyzed: sen mo gcod pa ni sen mo gcod pa'i lag cha'o //
translated: ‚ÄúA nail cutter‚Äù is a tool for cutting nails.

original: smang tsher ni sna la sogs pa'i spu btog pa'i thabs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: smang tsher ni sna la sogs pa'i spu btog pa'i thabs su gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTweezers‚Äù are a tool for removing hair from the nose and so on.

original: rab tu gzhon pa'i rang bzhin can ni ngo bo nyid kyis yin gyi bcos mas ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rab tu gzhon pa'i rang bzhin can ni ngo bo nyid kyis yin gyi bcos mas ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúVery young by nature‚Äù means that they are naturally young, not artificially so.

original: dris yongs su bsgos pa'i 'jim pa ni dri dang yang dag par ldan pa nang zhi bar byed pa can no //
analyzed: dris yongs su bsgos pa'i 'jim pa ni dri dang yang dag par ldan pa nang zhi bar byed pa can no //
translated: The clay that is thoroughly soaked with fragrance is endowed with fragrance, and it pacifies the internal.

original: slob dpon tshul khrims bskyangs kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
analyzed: slob dpon tshul khrims bskyangs kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
translated: This was composed by Master ≈öƒ´lapƒÅlita.

original: phran tshegs kyi tshig gi rnam par bshad pa ste sgo gsum pa'o /
analyzed: phran tshegs kyi tshig gi rnam par bshad pa ste sgo gsum pa'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the K·π£udraka-pi·π≠aka, the third door.

original: // / zla ba phyed phyed cing zhes bya ba ni phyed phyed du'o //
analyzed: // / zla ba phyed phyed cing zhes bya ba ni phyed phyed du'o //
translated: Every half month means every half month.

original: mi nus pa ni nus pa med par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mi nus pa ni nus pa med par gyur pa'o //
translated: Unable means not able.

original: gso sbyong ma btang bar zhes bya ba ni gso sbyong gi dus ma bor bar ro //
analyzed: gso sbyong ma btang bar zhes bya ba ni gso sbyong gi dus ma bor bar ro //
translated: Without giving up the po·π£adha means without missing the po·π£adha time.

original: slob dpon la sogs pa brgyud pas gnas pa'i gnas rnying pa 'di ni slob dpon la sogs pa la brtags pa yin pa'i phyir dus rtag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: slob dpon la sogs pa brgyud pas gnas pa'i gnas rnying pa 'di ni slob dpon la sogs pa la brtags pa yin pa'i phyir dus rtag pa'i phyir te /
translated: This old dwelling place that is passed down from master to master is for the sake of examining the master and so forth, because it is permanent.

original: 'jig @67b rten na dngos po rnyings par gyur pa la du ba chags pa zhes tha snyad du byed pa de'i phyir kho bo cag gi gnas khang rnyings pa 'di yang zhes bya ba'i blo 'dis tha snyad du 'dogs pa ni dus rtag tu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig @67b rten na dngos po rnyings par gyur pa la du ba chags pa zhes tha snyad du byed pa de'i phyir kho bo cag gi gnas khang rnyings pa 'di yang zhes bya ba'i blo 'dis tha snyad du 'dogs pa ni dus rtag tu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the world, it is conventional to say that smoke adheres to an old thing. Therefore, the idea of this old house of ours is always conventional.

original: rgyal byed kyi tshal du ci dgar 'gro zhing zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i dang ra med pa'i phyir dang / yongs su bgrang bar bya ba dag so so tha dad par gnas pa de'i phyir de'i nang du skye bo'i tshogs 'gro bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal byed kyi tshal du ci dgar 'gro zhing zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i dang ra med pa'i phyir dang / yongs su bgrang bar bya ba dag so so tha dad par gnas pa de'i phyir de'i nang du skye bo'i tshogs 'gro bar byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne can go to the Jeta Grove as one pleases‚Äù means that because there is no fence, the assembly of people can go there because the places are counted separately.

original: shing gi ri ba ma ni shing gi ra ba'o //
analyzed: shing gi ri ba ma ni shing gi ra ba'o //
translated: The ‚Äúwood fence‚Äù is a fence made of wood.

original: phyogs gcig brdungs pa'i phyir bcags pa yin la /üîΩphyogs gnyi gnas bcags pa'i phyir brdungs pa'am /
analyzed: phyogs gcig brdungs pa'i phyir bcags pa yin la / phyogs gnyi gnas bcags pa'i phyir brdungs pa'am /
translated: It is ‚Äúbroken‚Äù because one side is destroyed.üîΩIt is ‚Äúdestroyed‚Äù because both sides are destroyed.

original: skyes bus bcags pa'i phyir brdungs pa'o//
analyzed: skyes bus bcags pa'i phyir brdungs pa'o//
translated: Or it is ‚Äúdestroyed‚Äù because it is destroyed by people.

original: ba sos bdar ba zhes bya ba ni glang po che'i sos ji srid du gzugs brnyan snang bar gyur pa de srid du bdar zhing bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: ba sos bdar ba zhes bya ba ni glang po che'i sos ji srid du gzugs brnyan snang bar gyur pa de srid du bdar zhing bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: The phrase polished with a cow's hoof means that it is polished and prepared as long as the reflection of a form appears.

original: 'tsher bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu mdzes par ston pa lta bu'o //üîΩ'dir kha cig ni bcags shing brdungs pa'i chos gos yongs su longs spyod pa mi rung bar rjod la 'ga' zhig ni bcags par ni rung la /
analyzed: 'tsher bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu mdzes par ston pa lta bu'o // 'dir kha cig ni bcags shing brdungs pa'i chos gos yongs su longs spyod pa mi rung bar rjod la 'ga' zhig ni bcags par ni rung la /
translated: The phrase polished to a mirror finish means that it is polished to the point that it is very beautiful.üîΩHere, some say that it is not suitable to use a Dharma robe that is cut and sewn.üîΩSome say that it is suitable to cut, but not to sew.

original: brdungs pa ni mi rung bar brjod cing 'ga' zhig ni ba sos dung phyis bsgrubs pa'i chos gos gang yin ba ni bkag pa yin par brjod do //
analyzed: brdungs pa ni mi rung bar brjod cing 'ga' zhig ni ba sos dung phyis bsgrubs pa'i chos gos gang yin ba ni bkag pa yin par brjod do //
translated: Some say that it is prohibited to use a Dharma robe that is polished with a cow's hoof.

original: gzhan dag ni brdungs pa dang / bcags pa la dgag pa yod pa ma yin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni brdungs pa dang / bcags pa la dgag pa yod pa ma yin no zhes smra'o //
translated: Others say that there is no prohibition against cutting and sewing.

original: ngo mtshar gsal por byed pa ston par byed pa'i tshig gang du thos par byed pa'i gnas gang yin pa de ni 'dun khang yin te /
analyzed: ngo mtshar gsal por byed pa ston par byed pa'i tshig gang du thos par byed pa'i gnas gang yin pa de ni 'dun khang yin te /
translated: A place where one hears the words that teach the Dharma in a way that is clear and wondrous is a temple.

original: skye bo mang po 'dus pa'i gnas nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye bo mang po 'dus pa'i gnas nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the very place where many people gather.

original: sbyin pa 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sems kyi rgyan ni gtong ba la goms pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyin pa 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sems kyi rgyan ni gtong ba la goms pa yin te /
translated: The ornament of the mind is the practice of giving,

original: gang gi phyir des rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i bzhin dang 'dra bar sems mdzes bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir des rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i bzhin dang 'dra bar sems mdzes bar byed pa'o //
translated: because it adorns the mind like a face adorned with ornaments.

original: yo byad ni phyi rol gyi rnam par 'che ba yongs su srung ba la nye bar mkho ba yin la /
analyzed: yo byad ni phyi rol gyi rnam par 'che ba yongs su srung ba la nye bar mkho ba yin la /
translated: The equipment is the external requisites necessary for the protection of the body,

original: 'dir sems kyi yo byad ni ser sna dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dir sems kyi yo byad ni ser sna dang bral ba yin te /
translated: and here the mental equipment is freedom from avarice,

original: gang gi phyir ser sna dang bral bas ni rnam par 'tshe bar byed pa mi dge ba mang po las sems srung bar byed pa'o//
analyzed: gang gi phyir ser sna dang bral bas ni rnam par 'tshe bar byed pa mi dge ba mang po las sems srung bar byed pa'o//
translated: because the mind is protected from the many nonvirtues of harming others by freedom from avarice.

original: rnal 'byor ni zhi gnas lhag mthong stobs mtshungs pa de'i don du sbyin pa'i pha rol du phyin pa drug gi nang du 'dus par gzung ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni zhi gnas lhag mthong stobs mtshungs pa de'i don du sbyin pa'i pha rol du phyin pa drug gi nang du 'dus par gzung ste /
translated: Yoga is the equality of the powers of serenity and insight. For that purpose, the perfection of giving is included among the six perfections.

original: gang gi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i sbyin pas zag pa med pa'i lam zhi gnas dang lhag mthong skyed par byed pa bsdus pa yin no //üîΩdon gyi @68a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i sbyin pas zag pa med pa'i lam zhi gnas dang lhag mthong skyed par byed pa bsdus pa yin no // don gyi @68a * //
translated: Because generosity, included among the perfections, includes the generation of the uncontaminated path, calm abiding and insight.

original: mchog ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin pa de'i phyir /üîΩtshig bzhi po 'di ri ni gtong ba la goms pa dang / ser sna ldog pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam thob pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa khong du chud pa ste /
analyzed: mchog ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin pa de'i phyir / tshig bzhi po 'di ri ni gtong ba la goms pa dang / ser sna ldog pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam thob pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa khong du chud pa ste /
translated: The supreme goal is nirvana.üîΩTherefore, these four lines show the result of generosity:

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa yin no //
translated: the cultivation of giving, the cessation of stinginess, the attainment of the noble path, and the realization of nirvana.

original: de'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu gzhan kho na yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu gzhan kho na yod pa yin no //
translated: The result of evolutionary development is something else entirely.

original: ma gus pa ni gus pa med pa nyid kyis so //üîΩsgrog rten ni kun dga' gling de la lhan thabs su btab pa'o //
analyzed: ma gus pa ni gus pa med pa nyid kyis so // sgrog rten ni kun dga' gling de la lhan thabs su btab pa'o //
translated: Lack of respect is the absence of respect.üîΩThe courtyard is the courtyard of the monastery.

original: mdud pa ni zlum por brtsegs pa 'dzin par byed pa'i thabs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mdud pa ni zlum por brtsegs pa 'dzin par byed pa'i thabs su gyur pa'o //
translated: The knot is the means of holding the round structure together.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa thob pa ni de'i bya ba yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa thob pa ni de'i bya ba yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
translated: The attainment of completion is the completion of its function.

original: gzhan gyi nor 'phrog pa'i ngang tshul can ni gzhan gyi nor la 'phrog pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi nor 'phrog pa'i ngang tshul can ni gzhan gyi nor la 'phrog pa yin no //
translated: The nature of stealing others' wealth is to steal others' wealth.

original: gzhan gyi nor zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi nor zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the phrase the wealth of others, etc.

original: gzhan gyi nor 'phrog pa'i phyir skyes pa ni chags pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi nor 'phrog pa'i phyir skyes pa ni chags pa'o //
translated: The arising of attachment to the wealth of others is attachment to the wealth of others.üîΩThe phrase the passing of time means that time passes in the six times.

original: dus drug po dag las dus gzhan zhig tu phyin pas na dus zad par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dus drug po dag las dus gzhan zhig tu phyin pas na dus zad par gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase the end of the cloth means the end of the cloth. The phrase the end of the cloth means the end of the cloth.üîΩ The phrase the end of the cloth means the end of the cloth. The phrase the end of the cloth means the end of the cloth.

analyzed: gnas gnas su gnas pa'i don du btsems pas na zungs btab pa'o //
translated: The phrase the end of the cloth means the end of the cloth. The phrase the end of the cloth means the end of the cloth.

original: tshul khrims la brten pa zhes bya ba ni 'jug par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩshes rab kyi yul chen po gang yin ba de ni 'dir shes rab chen po'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims la brten pa zhes bya ba ni 'jug par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩshes rab kyi yul chen po gang yin ba de ni 'dir shes rab chen po'o //
translated: The phrase the end of the cloth means

original: spobs pa chen po ni lan thams cad sbyin par nus pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: spobs pa chen po ni lan thams cad sbyin par nus pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Great eloquence is the ability to give all replies.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba la 'dod do //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba la 'dod do //
translated: The root of the wholesome is the root of the wholesome that is free from passion.

original: gtong ba'i chos yongs su btang ba ni sbyin pa'i dngos po 'di gtong ba yin te chos ni bsod nams yin la gtong ba 'ang de yin la chos kyang rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtong ba'i chos yongs su btang ba ni sbyin pa'i dngos po 'di gtong ba yin te chos ni bsod nams yin la gtong ba 'ang de yin la chos kyang rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The Dharma of giving is the giving of the thing that is given. The Dharma is merit and it is also giving, because it is the cause of giving.

original: gtong ba'i chos de de'i yongs su gtong ba'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: gtong ba'i chos de de'i yongs su gtong ba'i sgo nas so //
translated: The Dharma of giving is given by him through his giving.

original: shan pa byed kyang zhes bya ba la lug gsod pa'i las ni shan pa yin la byed pa ni sgrub pa'o //üîΩbsdu ba'i dngos po zhes bya ba la bsdu ba'i phyir dngos po ste /
analyzed: shan pa byed kyang zhes bya ba la lug gsod pa'i las ni shan pa yin la byed pa ni sgrub pa'o // bsdu ba'i dngos po zhes bya ba la bsdu ba'i phyir dngos po ste /
translated: The butcher is the one who performs the work of killing sheep.üîΩThe bases of gathering are the bases for gathering.

original: rten ni bsdu pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: rten ni bsdu pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: The bases of gathering are the bases for gathering.

original: don spyod pa ni phan pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: don spyod pa ni phan pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The benefit is the engagement in benefit.

original: don mthun pa ni dngos po mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: don mthun pa ni dngos po mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: The same objective is the same thing.

original: gang de'i bya ba de bdag gi bya ba dang mtshungs par yongs su sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang de'i bya ba de bdag gi bya ba dang mtshungs par yongs su sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he accomplishes the activity of the latter as if it were his own activity.

original: byed par 'dod pa ni lan du phan 'dogs pa 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: byed par 'dod pa ni lan du phan 'dogs pa 'dod pa'o //
translated: One who desires to do means one who desires to reciprocate the benefit.

original: lam @68b du zhugs pa ni lam gyi rjes su zhugs pa gang yin ba de ni lam du zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: lam @68b du zhugs pa ni lam gyi rjes su zhugs pa gang yin ba de ni lam du zhugs pa ste /
translated: One who has entered the path is one who has entered the path of the latter.

original: gang gnas pa nyid du mi 'dod do //
analyzed: gang gnas pa nyid du mi 'dod do //
translated: One who does not desire to remain is one who does not desire to remain in the world.

original: sngon gyi gnas la gus pa med pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi slob dpon la mnyes par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas la gus pa med pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi slob dpon la mnyes par mi byed pa'o //
translated: Lack of respect for the former means lack of service to the former teacher.

original: de ste slob dpon ltos pa dang bcas la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la slob dpon 'di snyam du 'di ltar 'di ni kho bo kho na la gnas shing brten pa yin no zhes sems pa de'i phyir slob dpon ltos pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de ste slob dpon ltos pa dang bcas la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la slob dpon 'di snyam du 'di ltar 'di ni kho bo kho na la gnas shing brten pa yin no zhes sems pa de'i phyir slob dpon ltos pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: If the teacher is dependent on him, etc. means that the teacher thinks, In this way, he remains and relies on me alone, and for that reason, the teacher is dependent on him.

original: nye gnas ltos pa med na zhes bya ba ni nye gnas 'di snyam du bdag ni ljongs rgyur 'gro bar bya zhing der song nas kho bo gdon mi za bar slob dpon gzhan la gnas dgos pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bsam pa 'dis gang gi tshe nye
analyzed: nye gnas ltos pa med na zhes bya ba ni nye gnas 'di snyam du bdag ni ljongs rgyur 'gro bar bya zhing der song nas kho bo gdon mi za bar slob dpon gzhan la gnas dgos pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bsam pa 'dis gang gi tshe nye
translated: If the student is independent,üîΩwhen the student thinks, ‚ÄúI will go on a journey and when I return I will certainly rely on another master,‚Äù then he is independent.üîΩBut he is not independent if he thinks, ‚ÄúI will not go on a journey because I will certainly rely on this master.‚ÄùüîΩBut he is not independent if he thinks, ‚ÄúI will not go on a journey because I will certainly rely on this master.‚Äù

original: gnas ltos pa med par gyur pa de la ltos pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas ltos pa med par gyur pa de la ltos pa med pa yin te /
translated: But he is not independent if he thinks, ‚ÄúI will not go on a journey because I will certainly rely on this master.‚Äù

original: 'o na yang 'jig par gyur pa ni ma yin te /üîΩslob dpon ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na yang 'jig par gyur pa ni ma yin te / slob dpon ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: slob dpon ltos pa med pa la slob dpon 'di ltar kho bo gtsug lag khang gzhan du gnas pa'i phyir 'gro bar bya'o snyam pa de'i phyir slob dpon ltos pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: slob dpon ltos pa med pa la slob dpon 'di ltar kho bo gtsug lag khang gzhan du gnas pa'i phyir 'gro bar bya'o snyam pa de'i phyir slob dpon ltos pa med pa yin la /
translated: But he is not independent if he thinks, ‚ÄúI will not go on a journey because I will certainly rely on this master.‚ÄùüîΩBut he is not independent if he thinks, ‚ÄúI will not go on a

original: nye gnas kyis ni 'di ltar kho bo'i slob dpon 'gro bar 'dod par mi shes pa de'i phyir 'di ltos pa dang bcas pa yin pas de'i tshe yang gnas mi 'jig par brjod par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: nye gnas kyis ni 'di ltar kho bo'i slob dpon 'gro bar 'dod par mi shes pa de'i phyir 'di ltos pa dang bcas pa yin pas de'i tshe yang gnas mi 'jig par brjod par bya ba yin la /
translated: The disciple thinks, I do not know that my preceptor wishes to go. Therefore, since he is dependent on the preceptor, the dwelling place should not be destroyed.

original: slob dpon ltos pa dang bcas shing nye gnas kyang ltos pa dang bcas pa yin na gnas mi 'jig pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon ltos pa dang bcas shing nye gnas kyang ltos pa dang bcas pa yin na gnas mi 'jig pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: If the preceptor is dependent on the disciple and the disciple is dependent on the preceptor, the dwelling place should not be destroyed.

original: gang gi tshe slob dpon ltos pa med par gyur te /üîΩ'di ltar kho bo gtsug lag khang gzhan du 'gro bar bya'o snyam pa la nye gnas kyis kyang shes te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe slob dpon ltos pa med par gyur te / 'di ltar kho bo gtsug lag khang gzhan du 'gro bar bya'o snyam pa la nye gnas kyis kyang shes te /
translated: But when the preceptor becomes independent,üîΩthinking, I will go to another monastery, the disciple also knows thatüîΩand thinks, Since my preceptor definitely wishes to go to another monastery, I will also go to another dwelling place. At that time, both become independent.

original: 'di ltar kho bo'i slob dpon nges par gtsug lag khang gzhan du 'gro 'dod pas bdag kyang gnas gzhan la gnas par bya'o snyam pa de'i tshe gnyi ga ltos pa med par gyur pa yin bas slob dpon dang nye gnas mtshams gcig gi nang na gnas su zin
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo'i slob dpon nges par gtsug lag khang gzhan du 'gro 'dod pas bdag kyang gnas gzhan la gnas par bya'o snyam pa de'i tshe gnyi ga ltos pa med par gyur pa yin bas slob dpon dang nye gnas mtshams gcig gi nang na gnas su zin
translated: Therefore, even though the preceptor and disciple dwell within the same boundary,

original: kyang de lta na yang 'jig par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kyang de lta na yang 'jig par rig par bya'o //
translated: But even so, it should be understood that the retreat is broken.

original: gal te slob dpon yang rkyen gzhan 'ga' zhig gis gtsug lag khang gzhan du 'gro ba ma grub na nye gnas des kyang slob dpon gyi thad dam gzhan dag las gnas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: gal te slob dpon yang rkyen gzhan 'ga' zhig gis gtsug lag khang gzhan du 'gro ba ma grub na nye gnas des kyang slob dpon gyi thad dam gzhan dag las gnas blang bar bya ste /
translated: If the master is unable to go to another monastery due to some other condition, then the disciple should take up residence either in the presence of the master or in the presence of others.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na gnas med par gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na gnas med par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, he would be without a residence.

original: gal te nye gnas myur du ldog pa'i bsam pa med par gtsug lag khang gzhan du 'gro bar spro bas /
analyzed: gal te nye gnas myur du ldog pa'i bsam pa med par gtsug lag khang gzhan du 'gro bar spro bas /
translated: If the disciple is eager to go to another monastery without the intention of quickly returning,

original: slob dpon la @69a * //
analyzed: slob dpon la @69a * //
translated: he should inform the master

original: 'di skad du gtsug lag khang gzhan du gnas pa'i phyir mchi'o zhes smras pa na /
analyzed: 'di skad du gtsug lag khang gzhan du gnas pa'i phyir mchi'o zhes smras pa na /
translated: by saying, ‚ÄúI am going to another monastery to take up residence.‚Äù

original: slob dpon gyis kyang song shig ces kyang smras par gyur pa de'i tshi gnas 'jig pa yin la /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis kyang song shig ces kyang smras par gyur pa de'i tshi gnas 'jig pa yin la /
translated: If the master also says, ‚ÄúGo,‚Äù then at that time the retreat is broken.

original: ci ste song nas kyang dus gzhan du yang 'ongs na nye gnas des yang gnas bca' bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci ste song nas kyang dus gzhan du yang 'ongs na nye gnas des yang gnas bca' bar bya'o //
translated: But if, after going, he returns at another time, then the disciple should again take up the retreat.

original: gal te rnam pa thams cad du nye gnas slob dpon med par nyi ma lnga las lhag par gnas pas kyang gal te slob dpon de nyid rnyed par gyur na yang des kyang gnas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te rnam pa thams cad du nye gnas slob dpon med par nyi ma lnga las lhag par gnas pas kyang gal te slob dpon de nyid rnyed par gyur na yang des kyang gnas blang bar bya'o //
translated: If he thinks that he will take up residence in the place where he previously took up residence, he must take up residence there.

original: de ste len par mi byed na de'i phyir de mi gnas par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ste len par mi byed na de'i phyir de mi gnas par gnas pa yin no //
translated: If he does not take up residence there, he is no longer a bhik·π£u.üîΩIf he thinks that he will take up residence in the place where he previously took up residence, he must take up residence there.üîΩIf he does not take up residence there, he is no longer a bhik·π£u.üîΩIf he thinks that he will take up residence in the place where he previously took up residence, he must take up residence there.üîΩIf he does not take up residence there, he is no longer a bhik·π£u.

analyzed: gal te yang gnas gzhan na gnas pa'i nye gnas kyi phyir yang sngon slob dpon 'dug pa'i gnas su phyin par gyur pas yang gnas gzung ni dgos so snyam pa de ni gnas de nyid dam 'on te / gzhan dag gis sbyin par bya'o zhes gsung ba gang yin ba de don med par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'gyod pa skyes pa 'di nyid la 'brel pa yod pa ma yin no //

original: gal te sngar bzung ba'i gnas kho nas gnas par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sngar bzung ba'i gnas kho nas gnas par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If he does not take up residence there,

original: skabs de nyid kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di ltar dus de srid du des gnas de nyid ces bzung ba de'i phyir de la gnas de nyid ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: skabs de nyid kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di ltar dus de srid du des gnas de nyid ces bzung ba de'i phyir de la gnas de nyid ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One said that the time is the very place, because it is the very place that is grasped by that thought that is firmly placed.

original: dus de srid smos pas ni 'di skad du gal te brtan por gnas pa'i sems des gnas 'dzin pas gzung bar bya ba de'i phyir rnam pa gzhan du mi gnas pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus de srid smos pas ni 'di skad du gal te brtan por gnas pa'i sems des gnas 'dzin pas gzung bar bya ba de'i phyir rnam pa gzhan du mi gnas pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: By mentioning the time, he shows that if the place is grasped by the thought that is firmly placed, then it is not placed in any other way.

original: 'di yang bdag gi rang dgar smras pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang bla ma mkhas pa'i zhal nas thos pa yin ba de'i phyir 'di la the tshom mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang bdag gi rang dgar smras pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang bla ma mkhas pa'i zhal nas thos pa yin ba de'i phyir 'di la the tshom mi bya'o //
translated: This is not my own idea, but rather it is what I have heard from the mouth of the wise guru. Therefore, do not doubt it.

original: gal te yang gnas gzung bar bya ba nges pa yin ba de'i phyir sngar slob dpon nyid du gyur pa yang ldog par 'gyur ba de'i phyir ji srid du des kyang gnas ma bzung ba de srid du de la des kyang slob dpon zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod
analyzed: gal te yang gnas gzung bar bya ba nges pa yin ba de'i phyir sngar slob dpon nyid du gyur pa yang ldog par 'gyur ba de'i phyir ji srid du des kyang gnas ma bzung ba de srid du de la des kyang slob dpon zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod
translated: If the place to be grasped is fixed, then even one who has previously been a master would turn back. Therefore, as long as he has not grasped the place, he is not called a master by that name.

original: par mi bya'o zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: par mi bya'o zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that it is not so, that is not so.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ma gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ma gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Lord has not said that.

original: gang gi phyir gnyi ga ltos pa med par gyur pa las gnas 'jig par 'gyur ba bzhin du slob dpon nyid kyang bzlog par ni bcom ldan 'das kyis ma gsungs la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnyi ga ltos pa med par gyur pa las gnas 'jig par 'gyur ba bzhin du slob dpon nyid kyang bzlog par ni bcom ldan 'das kyis ma gsungs la /
translated: Because the Lord has not said that the master himself is to be turned away from both, just as the place is destroyed, since both are without reliance.

original: 'di la rigs pa cung zad kyang med pa des bas na 'di la nyes pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la rigs pa cung zad kyang med pa des bas na 'di la nyes pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since there is not the slightest reason for this, there is no fault in this.

original: blo ngan pa dag la gnod par gyur nas zhes bya ba ni yid gzhungs pa lung nod pa mang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: blo ngan pa dag la gnod par gyur nas zhes bya ba ni yid gzhungs pa lung nod pa mang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Having become harmful to those of poor intellect, means because of the abundance of the memorization of the scriptures.

original: @69b skabs skabs su zhes bya ba ni bar bar du'o //
analyzed: @69b skabs skabs su zhes bya ba ni bar bar du'o //
translated: From time to time means from time to time.

original: shing khri ni shing khri'u yin la gnon pa'i rnam pas thams cad stan len par byed pas na cig car 'khod pa'o //
analyzed: shing khri ni shing khri'u yin la gnon pa'i rnam pas thams cad stan len par byed pas na cig car 'khod pa'o //
translated: A wooden bench is a wooden chair. Since all sit down in the manner of pressing down, they sit down all at once.

original: rang bzhin te ngo bo nyid kyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas shing nyes pa dang bcas pa yin pas na rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa ste ;
analyzed: rang bzhin te ngo bo nyid kyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas shing nyes pa dang bcas pa yin pas na rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa ste ;
translated: Because it is naturally reprehensible, naturally faulty, it is naturally reprehensible.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa dang / chang ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pas nad pa bskyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa dang / chang ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pas nad pa bskyang bar bya'o //
translated: Except for alcohol, one should protect the sick with the rest.

original: shing 'di las me tog yang dag par skyes pas na me tog gi shing ngo //
analyzed: shing 'di las me tog yang dag par skyes pas na me tog gi shing ngo //
translated: Because a flower is produced from this tree, it is a flower tree.

original: dbang bskur bar 'os pa yin pa'i phyir dbang bskur bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dbang bskur bar 'os pa yin pa'i phyir dbang bskur bar rig par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that consecration is suitable for the consecration of a king.

original: rgyal tshab dbang bskur bar rigs pa yin la dbang bskur ba ni rgyal po chen po'o //
analyzed: rgyal tshab dbang bskur bar rigs pa yin la dbang bskur ba ni rgyal po chen po'o //
translated: It is suitable to consecrate a regent, and consecration is a great king.

original: dbang bskur ba thob pa zhes bya ba ni mtshams su phyin par gyur pa'o //üîΩbsrung ba ni nang gi rnam par 'tshe ba las so //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba thob pa zhes bya ba ni mtshams su phyin par gyur pa'o // bsrung ba ni nang gi rnam par 'tshe ba las so //
translated: One who has obtained consecration has arrived at the border.üîΩProtection is from internal harm.

original: bskyang ba ni nang gi mkho ba'i yo byad bye brag gis so //
analyzed: bskyang ba ni nang gi mkho ba'i yo byad bye brag gis so //
translated: Maintenance is by specific internal necessities.

original: lto dge ba'o zhes bya ba ni shin tu za ba'i ngang tshul can no //
analyzed: lto dge ba'o zhes bya ba ni shin tu za ba'i ngang tshul can no //
translated: The phrase who are virtuous in their eating means that they are very moderate in their eating.

original: bslus te zhes bya ba ni gyo byas nas so //
analyzed: bslus te zhes bya ba ni gyo byas nas so //
translated: The phrase who are deceitful means that they are dishonest.

original: rgyal pos bkrabs pa zhes bya ba ni rgyal po'i nang gi 'khor ro //
analyzed: rgyal pos bkrabs pa zhes bya ba ni rgyal po'i nang gi 'khor ro //
translated: The phrase who are appointed by the king means that they are members of the king's inner court.

original: shin tu myur par khro ba skye ba'i phyir ma rungs pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu myur par khro ba skye ba'i phyir ma rungs pa'o //
translated: The phrase who are violent means that they are quick to anger.

original: dpyod pa med par khro ba'i 'bras bu sgrub par byed pa'i phyir mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa med par khro ba'i 'bras bu sgrub par byed pa'i phyir mi rtog pa'o //
translated: The phrase who are unreflective means that they are quick to anger without any deliberation.

original: rtag tu khor ba thag nye ba nyid kyi phyir mi srun pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu khor ba thag nye ba nyid kyi phyir mi srun pa'o //
translated: The phrase who are unruly means that they are always close to anger.

original: lag pa gnyis sam lag pa gcig gi sbyor bas mtshon cha brdeg pa'i phyir rtsub pa'o //
analyzed: lag pa gnyis sam lag pa gcig gi sbyor bas mtshon cha brdeg pa'i phyir rtsub pa'o //
translated: The phrase who are rough means that they strike with both hands or with a weapon.üîΩThe phrase who are powerful means that they are strong.

original: tshan po che'i stobs zhes bya ba la tshan po che'i stobs kyi tshad gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshan po che'i stobs zhes bya ba la tshan po che'i stobs kyi tshad gang zhe na /
translated: What is the measure of a powerful person?

original: tha mal pa'i glang po che bcu'i stobs gang yin pa da ni spos kyi glang po che gcig gi stobs yin la /
analyzed: tha mal pa'i glang po che bcu'i stobs gang yin pa da ni spos kyi glang po che gcig gi stobs yin la /
translated: The strength of ten ordinary elephants is the strength of one fragrant elephant.

original: spos kyi glang po che bcu'i stobs gang yin ba de ni tshan po che'i stobs kyi tshad yin no //
analyzed: spos kyi glang po che bcu'i stobs gang yin ba de ni tshan po che'i stobs kyi tshad yin no //
translated: The strength of ten great nƒÅgas is the measure of the strength of one great nƒÅga.

original: yang ci'i phyir drug sde khros pas rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi khang bzangs g-yo bar rigs she na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir drug sde khros pas rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi khang bzangs g-yo bar rigs she na /
translated: Why did the six seers cause the palace of King Prasenajit to shake out of anger?

original: 'dir drug sde la mngon par dad pa'i lha'i mthus 'gul ba la drug sde stobs dang ldan pa'i rkang pa la sogs pas bsnun cing brgyab pas g-yo bar 'gyur zhes tha snyad du gdags pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir drug sde la mngon par dad pa'i lha'i mthus 'gul ba la drug sde stobs dang ldan pa'i rkang pa la sogs pas bsnun cing brgyab pas g-yo bar 'gyur zhes tha snyad du gdags pa yin no //
translated: Here, it is conventionally designated that it shook due to the power of the gods who had faith in the six seers, and the six seers struck and beat it with their powerful feet and so forth.

original: phyi bzhin 'brang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'khor du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: phyi bzhin 'brang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'khor du gyur pa'o //
translated: They will follow means they will be in the retinue.

original: gzhon nu'i spong ba zhes bya ba ni gzhon nu dang 'dra bar zil gyis mi non par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhon nu'i spong ba zhes bya ba ni gzhon nu dang 'dra bar zil gyis mi non par gnas pa'o //
translated: The renunciation of youth means dwelling without being overwhelmed, like a youth.

original: btsun mo'i spong ba ni btsun mo dag dang 'dra bar zil gyis mi non par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: btsun mo'i spong ba ni btsun mo dag dang 'dra bar zil gyis mi non par gnas pa'o //
translated: The renunciation of queens means dwelling without being overwhelmed, like queens.

original: lha khyod kyi bka' @70a * //
analyzed: lha khyod kyi bka' @70a * //
translated: O god, your command

original: bcag nas zhes bya ba ni bgrang ba med pa nyid du khyad du bsad par gyur nas so //
analyzed: bcag nas zhes bya ba ni bgrang ba med pa nyid du khyad du bsad par gyur nas so //
translated: Having broken them, having disregarded them,

original: bya ba ma yin ba ma byed cig ces bya ba ni tshul ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba ma yin ba ma byed cig ces bya ba ni tshul ma yin pa'o //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúDo not do what should not be done,‚Äù which is improper.

original: g-yang gzhi ni ri dags kyi pags pa'o //
analyzed: g-yang gzhi ni ri dags kyi pags pa'o //
translated: The antelope skin is the skin of a deer.

original: shun lpags ni shing shun no //
analyzed: shun lpags ni shing shun no //
translated: The bark is the bark of a tree.

original: bdag gi don sems pa zhes bya ba ni rang nyid la phan pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi yid la byed pa skyed par byed pa na'o //
analyzed: bdag gi don sems pa zhes bya ba ni rang nyid la phan pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi yid la byed pa skyed par byed pa na'o //
translated: Thinking of his own purpose means generating attention for the sake of his own benefit.

original: dus las 'das pa ni shi bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dus las 'das pa ni shi bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Having passed the time means having died.

original: dgos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir dor ba'i chos can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir dor ba'i chos can zhes bya'o //
translated: Because there is no purpose, he is said to be one who is cast off.

original: na bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni nad kyi rigs dmar byed kyis khab pa'am /
analyzed: na bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni nad kyi rigs dmar byed kyis khab pa'am /
translated: Having become sick means having been seized by a type of disease,

original: srog chags kyis zos par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: srog chags kyis zos par gyur pa'o //
translated: or having been eaten by a living being.

original: ske ba la lba ba yod pa gang yin pa de ni lba ba can te ;
analyzed: ske ba la lba ba yod pa gang yin pa de ni lba ba can te ;
translated: One who has a goiter on the neck is one who has a goiter.

original: yi dags kyi rigs de dag tu'o //
analyzed: yi dags kyi rigs de dag tu'o //
translated: In those types of hungry ghosts.

original: mi ma yin pas de rdog pas bsnun nas zhes bya ba la ci'i phyir la ba len par byed pa'i dus su des rdog par ma bsnun zhe na /
analyzed: mi ma yin pas de rdog pas bsnun nas zhes bya ba la ci'i phyir la ba len par byed pa'i dus su des rdog par ma bsnun zhe na /
translated: Why didn‚Äôt the nonhuman being kick him when he was picking up the robe?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here is the answer.

original: len pa'i tshe dga' byed nag po la bsnyad pa'i bsam pas ltos pa dang bcas par gyur pa de'i phyir des rdog pas bsnun ma nus pa yin te /
analyzed: len pa'i tshe dga' byed nag po la bsnyad pa'i bsam pas ltos pa dang bcas par gyur pa de'i phyir des rdog pas bsnun ma nus pa yin te /
translated: Since he was picking up the robe with the intention of giving it to KƒÅli·πÖga, he was not kicked by the nonhuman being because he was dependent on KƒÅli·πÖga.

original: des pa'i tshul las kyang gtum po dang mi ma yin pas zil gyis gnon par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des pa'i tshul las kyang gtum po dang mi ma yin pas zil gyis gnon par 'gyur te /
translated: Even though he was gentle, he was overcome by the nonhuman being and the yak·π£a.

original: gang gi tshe dga' byed nag pos bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' la slar zlog par gyur pa de'i tshe bag 'khums par gyur pa de'i phyir mi ma yin bas zil gyis non pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dga' byed nag pos bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' la slar zlog par gyur pa de'i tshe bag 'khums par gyur pa de'i phyir mi ma yin bas zil gyis non pa yin no //
translated: When KƒÅli·πÖga turned his back on the Blessed One‚Äôs word, he became timid. Therefore, he was overcome by the nonhuman being.

original: gnod sbyin gtum po mang po zhes bya ba ni ro dang dri la chags pa las gtum po rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gnod sbyin gtum po mang po zhes bya ba ni ro dang dri la chags pa las gtum po rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The yak·π£a was fierce because he was attached to corpses and smells.

original: lan gzhan du glan no zhes bya ba ni 'brel ba med pa'i lan 'debs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lan gzhan du glan no zhes bya ba ni 'brel ba med pa'i lan 'debs par byed pa'o //
translated: The response I will answer you later is a response that is irrelevant.

original: shin tu rnyog pa med pa'i yon tan ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: shin tu rnyog pa med pa'i yon tan ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan no //
translated: The quality of being completely free of turbidity is the quality of being purified.

original: lhag ma ni zas kyi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni zas kyi lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder is the remainder of food.

original: lham ma phud par zan bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni lham dang bcas pas zan bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: lham ma phud par zan bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni lham dang bcas pas zan bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not eat food without removing one's sandals means that one should not eat food while wearing sandals.

original: lham bkag pa'i phyir rtsva las byas pa'i lham la sogs pa shin tu khyad par du bkag pa ste /
analyzed: lham bkag pa'i phyir rtsva las byas pa'i lham la sogs pa shin tu khyad par du bkag pa ste /
translated: Because sandals are prohibited, sandals made of grass, etc., are also prohibited.

original: gang las 'di skad du sh'akya'i sras kyi dge sbyong de dag ni mi gtsang ba ste /
analyzed: gang las 'di skad du sh'akya'i sras kyi dge sbyong de dag ni mi gtsang ba ste /
translated: Because it is said, Those who are ascetics of the ≈öƒÅkya son are impure.

original: gang gi phyir lham dang bcas par zan za'o zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir lham dang bcas par zan za'o zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: Because they eat food while wearing sandals.

original: gal te lham tsam gyis mi gtsang ba nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te lham tsam gyis mi gtsang ba nyid yin na /
translated: If one is impure because of sandals,

original: rtsva'i lham la sogs pas shin tu mi gtsang ba nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: rtsva'i lham la sogs pas shin tu mi gtsang ba nyid ma yin nam /
translated: are sandals made of grass, etc., not even more impure?

original: de bas na thams cad du lham med pas zas bza' bar bya ba yin no zhes bya bar nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na thams cad du lham med pas zas bza' bar bya ba yin no zhes bya bar nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is certain that one should eat food without shoes.

original: de dag cher na bar @70b gyur te zhes bya ba ni sa rlan dang bcas pa la reg par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag cher na bar @70b gyur te zhes bya ba ni sa rlan dang bcas pa la reg par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When they become very ill, means because they have come into contact with moist earth.

original: lhung bzed kyi gnas ni skar khung gi rnam pa can lhung bzed 'jog par byed pa'i bu gu'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed kyi gnas ni skar khung gi rnam pa can lhung bzed 'jog par byed pa'i bu gu'o //
translated: The place for the alms bowl is a hole for placing the alms bowl that is like a window.

original: bka' bas ldang ba nyid kyi phyir gnas ngan yin la /
analyzed: bka' bas ldang ba nyid kyi phyir gnas ngan yin la /
translated: Because it is a bad place, it is a bad condition.

original: de len par byed pas na gnas ngan len te /
analyzed: de len par byed pas na gnas ngan len te /
translated: Because it takes that, it is a bad condition that is taken.

original: de sdig pa la 'jug par byed ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de sdig pa la 'jug par byed ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: That is the cause for engaging in evil.

original: lus dang ngag gi bya ba gnas ngan len kun du spyod pa gang la yod pa de ni gnas ngan len kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi bya ba gnas ngan len kun du spyod pa gang la yod pa de ni gnas ngan len kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: The performance of bad conduct of body and speech is the performance of bad conduct.

original: yo byad rnam pa drug ces bya ba ni chos gos gsum dang / lhung bzed dang / gding ba dang / chu tshags so //
analyzed: yo byad rnam pa drug ces bya ba ni chos gos gsum dang / lhung bzed dang / gding ba dang / chu tshags so //
translated: The six articles are the three Dharma robes, the alms bowl, the sitting mat, and the water strainer.

original: to lo brgyad kyi tshad kyi srang ni 'bras srang bcu drug btsos pa sran tshod dang tshod ma dang bcas pa shong ba'i lhung bzed de ni dge slong dag gi lhung bzed chung ba yin la bre'u chung do las lhag par shong ba gang yin pa de ni
analyzed: to lo brgyad kyi tshad kyi srang ni 'bras srang bcu drug btsos pa sran tshod dang tshod ma dang bcas pa shong ba'i lhung bzed de ni dge slong dag gi lhung bzed chung ba yin la bre'u chung do las lhag par shong ba gang yin pa de ni
translated: That which holds more than two and a half tol is

original: lhung bzed chen po'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed chen po'o //
translated: the large bowl.

original: skye ba ni lhung bzed ma btsos pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni lhung bzed ma btsos pa'o //
translated: The bowl of the novices is the unbaked bowl.

original: rgyal mtshan can zhes bya ba ni skye po thams cad kyis rab tu shes par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal mtshan can zhes bya ba ni skye po thams cad kyis rab tu shes par gyur pa'o //
translated: The one who is known to all people is the one who has the flag.

original: rkun pos dngos po blangs pa gang yin pa de ni brkus pa'o //
analyzed: rkun pos dngos po blangs pa gang yin pa de ni brkus pa'o //
translated: That which is taken by thieves is the stolen.

original: tshor ba ni shes par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba ni shes par gyur pa'o //
translated: The one who is known to feel is the one who feels.

original: ri dags kyis ri dags mi sos kyi zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba ri dags su gyur pa bdag nyid kyi bya bas 'tsho bar gyur pas so //
analyzed: ri dags kyis ri dags mi sos kyi zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba ri dags su gyur pa bdag nyid kyi bya bas 'tsho bar gyur pas so //
translated: The deer does not nourish the deer, because the one who has gone forth, who is like a deer, lives by his own action.

original: yab byon pa'i yul ni yab kyi yul te /
analyzed: yab byon pa'i yul ni yab kyi yul te /
translated: The country of the father is the country of the father.

original: dge slong gi dngos po skyed par byed pa'i gnas yin te /
analyzed: dge slong gi dngos po skyed par byed pa'i gnas yin te /
translated: It is the place which produces the state of a monk.

original: gang gi phyir bsod snyoms las dge slong gi dngos por 'gyur gyi bza' ba mang po tshol bar byed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsod snyoms las dge slong gi dngos por 'gyur gyi bza' ba mang po tshol bar byed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: Because one becomes a monk through alms, not through seeking many things to eat.

original: glags lta ba ni legs par rtog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: glags lta ba ni legs par rtog par byed pa'o //
translated: One who is looking for an opportunity is one who is seeking a chance.

original: bya ba rnams nyi ma re re zhing bya ba gang yin pa de ni nyi ma re re zhing bya ba ste /
analyzed: bya ba rnams nyi ma re re zhing bya ba gang yin pa de ni nyi ma re re zhing bya ba ste /
translated: What is to be done day by day is what is to be done day by day.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'o //
translated: Such as the mandala of the Blessed One.

original: dge slong btsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang gnas sbyin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong btsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang gnas sbyin par byed pa'o //
translated: One should seek a monk means one who will give a place to stay.

original: las res spangs nas zhes bya ba ni yongs su spong bar byed pas na spangs pa ste bor ba'o //
analyzed: las res spangs nas zhes bya ba ni yongs su spong bar byed pas na spangs pa ste bor ba'o //
translated: Having abandoned the turn of duties means having completely abandoned, having cast aside.

original: de'i phyir las res sko ba'i dus su de bor zhing gzhan la las res bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir las res sko ba'i dus su de bor zhing gzhan la las res bsko bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, when the turn of duties is cast aside, another should be appointed to the turn of duties.

original: gnas khang sko ba zhes bya ba ni sngar de la gnas khang bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas khang sko ba zhes bya ba ni sngar de la gnas khang bsko bar bya'o //
translated: One should appoint a place to stay means one should first appoint a place to stay for that monk.

original: mal stan yang de bzhin bya'o //
analyzed: mal stan yang de bzhin bya'o //
translated: One should also do the same with the bedding.

original: nad g-yog byed pa spong ba zhes bya ba ni de la dge slong gcig gi bsnyen bkur byin par bya'o //
analyzed: nad g-yog byed pa spong ba zhes bya ba ni de la dge slong gcig gi bsnyen bkur byin par bya'o //
translated: The phrase abandoning the care of the sick means that one should provide service to a single monk.

original: rnyed pa spangs te zhes bya ba ni de la rnyed pa dang bcas pa'i gnas khang bsko bar bya'o//üîΩ@71a * // gso sbyong gcig la sdod pa ni bzhes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa spangs te zhes bya ba ni de la rnyed pa dang bcas pa'i gnas khang bsko bar bya'o// @71a * // gso sbyong gcig la sdod pa ni bzhes par bya'o //
translated: The phrase abandoning gain means that one should assign a dwelling place together with gain.

original: dbyar nye bar gyur cing stobs par byed pa'i phyir dbyar tshul du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dbyar nye bar gyur cing stobs par byed pa'i phyir dbyar tshul du zhugs pa'o //
translated: The phrase staying in one place for the period of the rains retreat means that one should enter the rains retreat.

original: gcig la gcig dri zhing zhes bya ba ni phan tshun dris nas bya ba dag bya ba'o //
analyzed: gcig la gcig dri zhing zhes bya ba ni phan tshun dris nas bya ba dag bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase asking each other means that one should do what is to be done after having asked each other.

original: so sor brtags nas gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rab tu shes pas der gnas par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: so sor brtags nas gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rab tu shes pas der gnas par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: The phrase staying after having investigated means that one should stay there after having understood.

original: mi shes pa'i rgyu can tshul ma yin pa'i bya ba sgrub par byed pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i rgyu can tshul ma yin pa'i bya ba sgrub par byed pas ni ma yin no //
translated: One should not stay there on the basis of ignorance, which is the cause of improper action.

original: yo byad ni dge slong rnams kyi 'tsho ba'i thabs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yo byad ni dge slong rnams kyi 'tsho ba'i thabs su gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase the requisites refers to the means of subsistence for the monks.

original: ma byin par len par byed pa gang yin pa de ni ma byin par len pa'o //
analyzed: ma byin par len par byed pa gang yin pa de ni ma byin par len pa'o //
translated: Taking what is not given is taking the property of others through force or stealth.

original: ma gus nas zhes bya ba ni nongs pa la ltos nas bskul ba'o //
analyzed: ma gus nas zhes bya ba ni nongs pa la ltos nas bskul ba'o //
translated: Out of disrespect is when one is urged to do something out of a sense of propriety.

original: yo byad sbyor ba ni lus gnas pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yo byad sbyor ba ni lus gnas pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: The equipment is that which is used to maintain the body.

original: gso sbyong so sor zhes bya ba ni gso sbyong tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: gso sbyong so sor zhes bya ba ni gso sbyong tha dad pa'o //
translated: The observance of the purificatory fast is separate is when the purificatory fast is observed separately.

original: rnyed pa gcig tu zhes bya ba ni spyir 'tsho ba la sogs pa'i rnyed pa la 'dir rnyed par dgongs so //
analyzed: rnyed pa gcig tu zhes bya ba ni spyir 'tsho ba la sogs pa'i rnyed pa la 'dir rnyed par dgongs so //
translated: The acquisition is the same is when the acquisition of the means of livelihood is the same.

original: nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang dag tu mal stan bsham par bya ba zhig gtsug lag khang tha dad par gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las bya'o //üîΩmal stan ni khri la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang dag tu mal stan bsham par bya ba zhig gtsug lag khang tha dad par gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las bya'o // mal stan ni khri la sogs pa yin la /
translated: When bedding is to be assigned in the vicinity of the monastery, the assignment should be made in one monastery by the joint action of the two orders.üîΩBedding is a bed, etc.

original: snod ni zangs ma la sogs pa'i snod yin no //üîΩnye bar mkho ba de dag las gzhan pa dag ni yo byad yin te /
analyzed: snod ni zangs ma la sogs pa'i snod yin no // nye bar mkho ba de dag las gzhan pa dag ni yo byad yin te /
translated: Utensils are copper vessels, etc.

original: gos dang rgyan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gos dang rgyan la sogs pa'o //
translated: Other than these necessities are equipment, such as clothing, ornaments, etc.

original: 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gal te de dag la rku sems bskyed par gyur pa de'i tshe sbom por 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gal te de dag la rku sems bskyed par gyur pa de'i tshe sbom por 'gyur la /
translated: If one generates the thought of stealing with regard to them, then it is a serious transgression.

original: 'on te ma yin na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te ma yin na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not generate the thought of stealing, then it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: phrag khur ni lus kyi khur bu yin te /
analyzed: phrag khur ni lus kyi khur bu yin te /
translated: A load is a physical burden.

original: mtha' gnyis su sgrom la sogs pa'i rdzas 'jog par byed pa'i thabs su gyur pa dbyangs pa'i shing gis khur ba la phrag khur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis su sgrom la sogs pa'i rdzas 'jog par byed pa'i thabs su gyur pa dbyangs pa'i shing gis khur ba la phrag khur zhes bya'o //
translated: A load on the shoulder is called a ‚Äúshoulder-load‚Äù because it is a means of carrying goods such as a basket that is placed on the two shoulders.

original: bu mo ni chung ma'o //
analyzed: bu mo ni chung ma'o //
translated: A girl is a wife.

original: bran ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: bran ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: A slave is of five types:

original: nyos pa dang / rnyed pa dang / phrogs pa dang / khyim du skyes pa dang / khas blangs pa dag tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyos pa dang / rnyed pa dang / phrogs pa dang / khyim du skyes pa dang / khas blangs pa dag tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: purchased, inherited, captured, born in the home, and accepted.

original: bran mo yang de dag dang 'dra'o //üîΩlas byed pa ni skyes bu gla ba'o //üîΩskyes bu byed pa la brten nas 'tsho ba gang yin pa de ni zho shas 'tsho ba'o //
analyzed: bran mo yang de dag dang 'dra'o // las byed pa ni skyes bu gla ba'o // skyes bu byed pa la brten nas 'tsho ba gang yin pa de ni zho shas 'tsho ba'o //
translated: A female slave is similar to that.üîΩA laborer is a hired man.üîΩOne who lives in dependence on the work of another is a wage earner.

original: tshong gi skyed kyis 'tsho bar byed pas na tshong ba'o //
analyzed: tshong gi skyed kyis 'tsho bar byed pas na tshong ba'o //
translated: One who makes a living by the profit of trade is a merchant.

original: dar gyi thod bcings pas na rgyal po'o //
analyzed: dar gyi thod bcings pas na rgyal po'o //
translated: A king is one who is bound with a turban of silk.

original: lha ni gnyug mar gnas pa ste /
analyzed: lha ni gnyug mar gnas pa ste /
translated: A god is one who dwells in a natural abode.

original: de dag ni gtor ma'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni gtor ma'i phyir ro //
translated: They are to be worshipped because they are to be worshipped with offerings.

original: mtshun ni sngon shi ba ste /
analyzed: mtshun ni sngon shi ba ste /
translated: A deceased ancestor is one who has died previously.

original: de dag la dad pas sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la dad pas sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are to be honored because they are to be honored with faith.

original: dge sbyong ni khyim na gnas pa spong ba dang / @71b mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam la mngon bar sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: dge sbyong ni khyim na gnas pa spong ba dang / @71b mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam la mngon bar sbyor ba ste /
translated: A religious student is one who renounces the householder's life and applies himself to the path of nirvana.

original: de dag la snyoms par rjes su ba stabs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la snyoms par rjes su ba stabs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are to be treated with equality because they are to be treated with equality and respect.

original: bram ze de dag 'jig rten na rigs kyi mchog tu 'dod par rab tu grags pa ste /
analyzed: bram ze de dag 'jig rten na rigs kyi mchog tu 'dod par rab tu grags pa ste /
translated: A brahman is one who is well known as the best of the castes in the world.

original: de dag la yang sbyin pa'i phyir ro /üîΩ// / bam po brgyad pa /
analyzed: de dag la yang sbyin pa'i phyir ro / // / bam po brgyad pa /
translated: They are to be given because they are to be given gifts.

original: khyim yongs su spangs nas rab tu byung ba don du gnyer zhing mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: khyim yongs su spangs nas rab tu byung ba don du gnyer zhing mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: One who wishes to go forth is one who seeks to go forth, who desires to renounce the household life.

original: lhung bzed kyi 'brel pas bya ba gzhan byed pa'i nus pa med pa gang yin pa de ni lhung bzed lag tu thogs pa ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed kyi 'brel pas bya ba gzhan byed pa'i nus pa med pa gang yin pa de ni lhung bzed lag tu thogs pa ste /
translated: One who holds a begging bowl in his hand is one who is unable to perform other duties because of the connection with the begging bowl.

original: khyim yongs su spangs nas lhung bzed 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: khyim yongs su spangs nas lhung bzed 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: He has abandoned the household life and taken up the alms bowl.

original: yu ba sgra dang bcas pas na khar gsil dkrol ba'o //
analyzed: yu ba sgra dang bcas pas na khar gsil dkrol ba'o //
translated: The word rattle is used because the handle makes a sound.

original: yon tan gyi sgo nas skye bo thams cad la rab tu grags par gyur pa gang yin ba de dag ni rab tu grags pa'i dge slong ngo //
analyzed: yon tan gyi sgo nas skye bo thams cad la rab tu grags par gyur pa gang yin ba de dag ni rab tu grags pa'i dge slong ngo //
translated: The word renowned means that they are well known to everyone because of their good qualities.

original: bsams pa ni shes par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: bsams pa ni shes par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The word thought means desire to know.

original: gnas zhes bya ba la chos bzhi la brten nas na da pa 'tsho bar 'gyur zhing chos gsum la brten na rang bzhin du gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba la chos bzhi la brten nas na da pa 'tsho bar 'gyur zhing chos gsum la brten na rang bzhin du gnas pa yin te /
translated: The word abode means that the four things are the basis for the life of a monk and the three things are the basis for his natural state.

original: bsod snyoms dang / mal stan dang / gos dag gis ni rang bzhin du gnas par 'gyur la /üîΩsman dang bcas pa dag gis ni nad pa 'tsho ba yin pas don du gnyer ba rnams 'tsho ba'i don du sten par byed pa'i phyir gnas yin no //
analyzed: bsod snyoms dang / mal stan dang / gos dag gis ni rang bzhin du gnas par 'gyur la / sman dang bcas pa dag gis ni nad pa 'tsho ba yin pas don du gnyer ba rnams 'tsho ba'i don du sten par byed pa'i phyir gnas yin no //
translated: The natural state is maintained by alms, bedding, and robes.üîΩ The sick are sustained by medicine. Thus, the four are called abodes because those who seek them rely on them for the sake of life.

original: phyag dar khrod ces bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: phyag dar khrod ces bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: The word rag means refuse.

original: 'dir chu bo'i mtha' ni ngogs yin te /
analyzed: 'dir chu bo'i mtha' ni ngogs yin te /
translated: The word bank means the edge of a river.

original: der mthar thug pa'i phyir la gos kyi mtha' ni phyag dar yin te /
analyzed: der mthar thug pa'i phyir la gos kyi mtha' ni phyag dar yin te /
translated: The end of cloth is its fringe.

original: de'i mthar thug pa yin pa kho na'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mthar thug pa yin pa kho na'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called a refuse rag robe because it is just the end of a refuse rag.

original: de bas na phyag dar dang 'dra ba dang / ngogs dang 'dra ba'i gos gang yin pa de la phyag dar khrod ces bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na phyag dar dang 'dra ba dang / ngogs dang 'dra ba'i gos gang yin pa de la phyag dar khrod ces bya ste /
translated: Thus, a refuse rag robe is a robe made of refuse rags, or a robe like a refuse rag robe.

original: shin tu rnyings pa nyid kyi phyir nye bar mkho ba ma yin bas don du mi 'gyur ba nyid kyis phyag dar du bor ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnyings pa nyid kyi phyir nye bar mkho ba ma yin bas don du mi 'gyur ba nyid kyis phyag dar du bor ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is called a refuse rag robe because it is a robe made of cloth that is like a refuse rag, that is, cloth that has been discarded as useless because it is too worn out.

original: rnyed bla ba zhes bya ba ni 'bad rtsol nyung dus rnyed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnyed bla ba zhes bya ba ni 'bad rtsol nyung dus rnyed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is called easily acquired because it is acquired with little effort.

original: rung ba zhes bya ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rung ba zhes bya ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: It is called proper because it is acquired without offense.

original: khyim bdag las zas len par byed pas na bsod snyoms so //üîΩ'di la nyal bar byed pa'i phyir mal te khri la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag las zas len par byed pas na bsod snyoms so // 'di la nyal bar byed pa'i phyir mal te khri la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is called alms because it is received from householders.üîΩA bed is a place to sleep, such as a couch.

original: 'di la gnas par byed pas na stan te khri'u la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la gnas par byed pas na stan te khri'u la sogs pa'o //
translated: A seat is a place to sit, such as a stool.

original: bkus te bor ba zhes bya ba la bkus ni bkus shing khu ba btsir ba yin la /
analyzed: bkus te bor ba zhes bya ba la bkus ni bkus shing khu ba btsir ba yin la /
translated: The term cast off means that it is cast off after being nourished and squeezed.

original: bor ba ni phyi rol du bor @72a * //
analyzed: bor ba ni phyi rol du bor @72a * //
translated: The term cast off means that it is cast off outside.

original: ba gang yin pa de ni bkus te bor ba'o //
analyzed: ba gang yin pa de ni bkus te bor ba'o //
translated: That is the meaning of cast off.

original: pha zhes bya ba ni mngal 'dzin pa'i tshe pha'i khu ba dang ma'i khrag phan tshun 'dres pa de las kyang de'i lus 'grub pa yin pa de'i phyir 'dir pha zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: pha zhes bya ba ni mngal 'dzin pa'i tshe pha'i khu ba dang ma'i khrag phan tshun 'dres pa de las kyang de'i lus 'grub pa yin pa de'i phyir 'dir pha zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The term father means that the body is formed from the mixture of the father's semen and the mother's blood at the time of conception. Therefore, the father is known as such.

original: skya bor 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni mdangs zhan cing chung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: skya bor 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni mdangs zhan cing chung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The term pale means that the body is weak and thin.

original: 'di la gnas par shes nas song ngo zhes bya ba la song ba ni khyim par ro //
analyzed: 'di la gnas par shes nas song ngo zhes bya ba la song ba ni khyim par ro //
translated: Having understood that he was in this condition, he left. The term left means that he left the household life.

original: chung ma blangs pa ni me skor bya ba'i phyir de yongs su rdzogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: chung ma blangs pa ni me skor bya ba'i phyir de yongs su rdzogs pa nyid do //
translated: He took a wife in order to make fire offerings. The completion of that is the birth of a son.

original: bdag gis ni yo byad drug po rnyed do zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i skye mched drug po dag gi yul bdag gis btsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag gis ni yo byad drug po rnyed do zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i skye mched drug po dag gi yul bdag gis btsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: I have obtained the six objects‚Äù means that the self should seek the objects of the six sense bases such as the eyes.

original: blangs so blangs so zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa'i tshig gnyis so //
analyzed: blangs so blangs so zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa'i tshig gnyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúI have taken, I have taken‚Äù are two confused statements.

original: sbyor ba yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni rku ba'i bya ba yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni rku ba'i bya ba yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe act of application is complete‚Äù means the act of stealing is finished.

original: rdeg pa ni srog 'gog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rdeg pa ni srog 'gog par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBeaten‚Äù means life is stopped.

original: bcings pa ni lcags la sogs pas bcings pa'o //
analyzed: bcings pa ni lcags la sogs pas bcings pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBound‚Äù means bound by iron and so on.

original: bcad pa ni lag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bcad pa ni lag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCut‚Äù means hands and so on.

original: phug pa ni rus pa'o //
analyzed: phug pa ni rus pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPierced‚Äù means bones.

original: sdug bsngal pa ni yid kyi gdung pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal pa ni yid kyi gdung pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSuffering‚Äù means mental anguish.

original: rnam pa thams cad rdzogs par byad pa ni rnam pa mang po byas pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad rdzogs par byad pa ni rnam pa mang po byas pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving done all the various ways‚Äù means having done many different ways.

original: lci phye ni lci ba skam po'i phye ma'o //
analyzed: lci phye ni lci ba skam po'i phye ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDried and ground‚Äù means dried and ground flour.

original: yid brten pa lngas blang par bya'o zhes bya ba ni yid brtan pa'i sgo nas len pa'o //
analyzed: yid brten pa lngas blang par bya'o zhes bya ba ni yid brtan pa'i sgo nas len pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt should be taken with five kinds of trust‚Äù means it should be taken through trust.

original: mdza' bar gyur pa ni dga' ba'i rgyu nyid du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: mdza' bar gyur pa ni dga' ba'i rgyu nyid du gyur pa ste /
translated: One who is dear is a cause of joy.

original: rdzas kyi bdag por 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas kyi bdag por 'dzin pa'o //
translated: One who is a master of substances is one who holds the ownership of substances.

original: yid du 'ong ba ni yid dang rjes su mthun pa ste /
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba ni yid dang rjes su mthun pa ste /
translated: One who is pleasing is one who is agreeable.

original: thag ring po na gnas su zin kyang sems kyis rtag tu dran pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thag ring po na gnas su zin kyang sems kyis rtag tu dran pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One who is remembered is one who is always remembered by the mind, even though he is far away.

original: bla ma ni slob dpon la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma ni slob dpon la sogs pa'o //
translated: One who is a guru is a spiritual master and so forth.

original: mchod par bya ba nyid du 'gyur pa ni rdzas kyi bdag por 'dzin pa yin te zhes bya ba thams cad du sbyar bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: mchod par bya ba nyid du 'gyur pa ni rdzas kyi bdag por 'dzin pa yin te zhes bya ba thams cad du sbyar bar bya ba yin te /
translated: One who is worthy of worship is one who holds the ownership of substances.

original: yon tan khyar par can dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir rtag tu yid kyis yon tan dran par bya ba yin pas na mchod par bya ba nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan khyar par can dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir rtag tu yid kyis yon tan dran par bya ba yin pas na mchod par bya ba nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One who is worthy of worship is one who is always remembered by the mind because he possesses special qualities.

original: thos na dga' bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar bdag gi rdzas che ge mo zhig gis khyer ba rdzas kyi bdag por thos par gyur pa de'i tshe yongs su mgu bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: thos na dga' bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar bdag gi rdzas che ge mo zhig gis khyer ba rdzas kyi bdag por thos par gyur pa de'i tshe yongs su mgu bar gyur pa ste /
translated: One who is pleasing to hear about is one who is completely satisfied when he hears that his lost substance has been found by the owner of the substance.

original: mchog tu dga' ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir len par byed pa'i rgyu yid brtan pa lnga po de dag las gcig gis kyang yongs su len pa la ma byin par len pa'i nyes pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir len par byed pa'i rgyu yid brtan pa lnga po de dag las gcig gis kyang yongs su len pa la ma byin par len pa'i nyes pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since they are the cause of the acquisition of the five firm convictions which give rise to supreme joy, there is no fault of theft in the acquisition of the latter by means of any one of them.

original: gtsug lag khang la phyir @72b rol gyi stegs su gyur pa ni bang rim mo //üîΩrdul gyis phog ste zhes bya ba ni rdul gyis khyab par gyur pa'o //
