analyzed: gtsug lag khang la phyir @72b rol gyi stegs su gyur pa ni bang rim mo // rdul gyis phog ste zhes bya ba ni rdul gyis khyab par gyur pa'o //
translated: The temple is the platform outside.üîΩIt is covered with dust when it is pervaded by dust.

original: sas g-yogs pa ni bkab pa'o //
analyzed: sas g-yogs pa ni bkab pa'o //
translated: It is covered with earth when it is covered with earth.

original: yongs su sbyangs pa zhes bya ba mtshan med par yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'o //üîΩbyugs pa ni ba lcis byugs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su sbyangs pa zhes bya ba mtshan med par yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'o // byugs pa ni ba lcis byugs pa'o //
translated: It is purified when it is purified without signs.üîΩIt is anointed when it is anointed with cow dung.

original: rdo thal ni rdo'i zhal zhal gyi rnam par rab tu byugs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo thal ni rdo'i zhal zhal gyi rnam par rab tu byugs pa'o //
translated: It is plastered when it is plastered with a mixture of earth and cow dung.

original: lus 'phags kyi ri bo zhes bya ba ni ri rdo'i bye brag can no //üîΩgdungs pa ni gzir bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lus 'phags kyi ri bo zhes bya ba ni ri rdo'i bye brag can no // gdungs pa ni gzir bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The mountain of V·πõ·π£abhƒÅ is a mountain of a particular kind of stone.üîΩIt is heated when it is heated.

original: skams pa ni shi bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: skams pa ni shi bar gyur pa'o //
translated: It is dried when it is dried.

original: de la brtson par byas pa zhes bya ba ni de dang 'brel pa'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la brtson par byas pa zhes bya ba ni de dang 'brel pa'i bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúone should apply oneself to that‚Äù refers to the activity that is related to that.

original: dgun zla tha chungs dang / dpyid zla ra ba dag ni dgun smad kyi dus so //
analyzed: dgun zla tha chungs dang / dpyid zla ra ba dag ni dgun smad kyi dus so //
translated: The last winter month and the first spring month are the last winter months.

original: rtsvas g-yogs shig ces bya ba ni rtsva'i spyil pos so //
analyzed: rtsvas g-yogs shig ces bya ba ni rtsva'i spyil pos so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúcovered with grass‚Äù means covered with a grass hut.

original: ra bas bskor ba ni rtsig pas bskor ba'o //
analyzed: ra bas bskor ba ni rtsig pas bskor ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúsurrounded by a fence‚Äù means surrounded by a wall.

original: rlung mi 'jug pa ni rlung rab tu rgyu ba dang bral bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rlung mi 'jug pa ni rlung rab tu rgyu ba dang bral bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfree from wind‚Äù means free from the movement of wind.

original: glo skar ni nang gi rtsig pa kun nas bug pa gtod pa'o //
analyzed: glo skar ni nang gi rtsig pa kun nas bug pa gtod pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwith windows‚Äù means with holes in the inner walls.

original: ma rung bar gyur pa ni shin tu 'das par gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: ma rung bar gyur pa ni shin tu 'das par gyur pa yin la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot suitable‚Äù means not suitable for the performance of the rite.

original: ma rung bar gyur pas na ma rung bar gyur pa ste //
analyzed: ma rung bar gyur pas na ma rung bar gyur pa ste //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it is not suitable‚Äù means that the rite is not suitable.

original: gal te dus de'i tshe ma byas na dus gzhan gyi tshe bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir las de ma rung bar 'gyur pa de lta bu'i rnam pas gdon mi za bar las su bya ba byung na gus pa dang bcas pas bsgos te 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dus de'i tshe ma byas na dus gzhan gyi tshe bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir las de ma rung bar 'gyur pa de lta bu'i rnam pas gdon mi za bar las su bya ba byung na gus pa dang bcas pas bsgos te 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: If the rite is not performed at that time, it will not be possible to perform it at another time. Therefore, if the rite is not suitable, one should go to the place of the rite with respect and with a sense of urgency.

original: shing skyed par byed pa ni rung ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: shing skyed par byed pa ni rung ba byed pa'o //
translated: The tree-producer is the one who makes it possible.

original: rin po che dang 'dra bar shin tu rin che ba nyid kyi phyir dang / 'od gsal ba nyid kyi phyir rnyed dka' ba'i la ba ni zla ba rin po che'o //
analyzed: rin po che dang 'dra bar shin tu rin che ba nyid kyi phyir dang / 'od gsal ba nyid kyi phyir rnyed dka' ba'i la ba ni zla ba rin po che'o //
translated: The moon is a precious gem, because it is very valuable like a gem and because it is radiant.

original: dal gyis zhes bya ba ni shin tu drag par ma yin par ro //
analyzed: dal gyis zhes bya ba ni shin tu drag par ma yin par ro //
translated: Slowly means not very quickly.

original: bcas pa ni lus dang ngag gi spyod par tshul mthun pa'o //
analyzed: bcas pa ni lus dang ngag gi spyod par tshul mthun pa'o //
translated: The conduct of body and speech is consistent.

original: stobs ni lus kyi'o //
analyzed: stobs ni lus kyi'o //
translated: Strength is physical.

original: brtson 'grus ni yid kyi spro ba'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni yid kyi spro ba'o //
translated: Exertion is mental enthusiasm.

original: mthu ni bya ba byed par nus pa'o //
analyzed: mthu ni bya ba byed par nus pa'o //
translated: Power is the ability to perform actions.

original: rdzu 'phrul chen po gang la yod pa de ni rdzu 'phrul chen po ste /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul chen po gang la yod pa de ni rdzu 'phrul chen po ste /
translated: One who has great magical power is one with great magical power.

original: rdzu 'phrul ni rnal 'byor grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ni rnal 'byor grub pa yin no //
translated: Magical power is the accomplishment of yoga.

original: thu che ba ni ngo mtshar rab tu ston par nus pa'o //
analyzed: thu che ba ni ngo mtshar rab tu ston par nus pa'o //
translated: Greatness is the ability to display wonders.

original: rin cha ba 'am skyes bu chen po la 'os pas rin thang che ba'o //
analyzed: rin cha ba 'am skyes bu chen po la 'os pas rin thang che ba'o //
translated: It is valuable because it is suitable for a precious gem or a great person.

original: zos pas mi mkho bar byed pas na 'di la seng seng por gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zos pas mi mkho bar byed pas na 'di la seng seng por gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúlion-like‚Äù because it makes one useless by eating.

original: shing na me ru ka zhes bya ba ni lcug ma de'i lo ma skams la phye mar byas pa la ba'i blta ba tshigs su gzhug par bya ste /
analyzed: shing na me ru ka zhes bya ba ni lcug ma de'i lo ma skams la phye mar byas pa la ba'i blta ba tshigs su gzhug par bya ste /
translated: The tree called nimba is a tree whose leaves dry up and become powdered.

original: des srog chags skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des srog chags skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One should insert it into the eye, and no living beings will be born there.

original: shing kun gyi shing gi lo ma dang / @73a * //
analyzed: shing kun gyi shing gi lo ma dang / @73a * //
translated: The leaves of all trees and

original: ba sha ka'i lo ma ni rab tu grags pa yin no //
analyzed: ba sha ka'i lo ma ni rab tu grags pa yin no //
translated: the leaves of the banyan tree are well known.

original: nim pa ni shing 'chi ba bslu ba'i lo ma'o //
analyzed: nim pa ni shing 'chi ba bslu ba'i lo ma'o //
translated: The nimba tree is the tree of the leaf that deceives death.

original: blta ba tshigs su blta ba mi chog pa de'i tshe gos kyi steng du shing na me ru ka'i lo ma la sogs pa bcug nas de'i dris srog chags skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blta ba tshigs su blta ba mi chog pa de'i tshe gos kyi steng du shing na me ru ka'i lo ma la sogs pa bcug nas de'i dris srog chags skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When it is not possible to insert the leaf into the eye, one should put the leaves of the nimba tree, etc. on top of the cloth, and by its smell no living beings will be born there.

original: yang na steng stengs su mi reg par btags nas dus dus su sprug pa dang / skem par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang na steng stengs su mi reg par btags nas dus dus su sprug pa dang / skem par byed pa'o //
translated: Or, having tied it without touching the top, one should shake it from time to time and dry it.

original: bskum pas nyal ba ni lhags pas yan lag bskums par gyur pas so //
analyzed: bskum pas nyal ba ni lhags pas yan lag bskums par gyur pas so //
translated: Sleeping by contracting is sleeping by contracting the limbs due to cold.

original: shin tu brtson pa zhes bya ba ni gcig tu brtson pas bsgrub par bya ba'i 'bras bu khong du chud pa dang bcas pas so //
analyzed: shin tu brtson pa zhes bya ba ni gcig tu brtson pas bsgrub par bya ba'i 'bras bu khong du chud pa dang bcas pas so //
translated: Very diligent means that one should practice with single-pointed diligence, having understood the result to be accomplished.

original: slob dpon tshul khrims bskyangs kyis sbyar ba phran tshegs kyi tshig gi rnam par bshad pa las sgo bzhi pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: slob dpon tshul khrims bskyangs kyis sbyar ba phran tshegs kyi tshig gi rnam par bshad pa las sgo bzhi pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the fourth section of the commentary on the words of the K·π£udraka Collection composed by Master ≈öƒ´lapƒÅlita.

original: // / rim gro gyis shig ces bya ba ni mchod pa gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: // / rim gro gyis shig ces bya ba ni mchod pa gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Worship means to make offerings.

original: rma dang rma'i kha 'khor ni sna'i sbubs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rma dang rma'i kha 'khor ni sna'i sbubs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Wounds and wound openings are the nasal passages and so on.

original: sa rkos la zhes bya ba las ni 'dir ma 'thas pa'i sa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sa rkos la zhes bya ba las ni 'dir ma 'thas pa'i sa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: As for digging the earth, here one should understand that it refers to unbaked earth.

original: dbyar rnams su rgyun mi 'chad par 'bab pa'i phyir sa ma 'thas pa 'thas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbyar rnams su rgyun mi 'chad par 'bab pa'i phyir sa ma 'thas pa 'thas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Unbaked earth becomes baked during the rainy seasons due to the continuous rainfall.

original: sa 'thas pa yang mkhrang bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: sa 'thas pa yang mkhrang bar gyur pa ste /
translated: Baked earth is hardened.

original: 'jim pa'i gong bu 'thas par gyur pa'o //üîΩrtsva'i bam po ni rtsva chun gyi tshogs so //
analyzed: 'jim pa'i gong bu 'thas par gyur pa'o // rtsva'i bam po ni rtsva chun gyi tshogs so //
translated: It is like a lump of clay that has hardened.üîΩA bundle of grass is a collection of grass bundles.

original: lo ma dang 'dab mas g-yogs pa ni ma'i tshogs kyis so //
analyzed: lo ma dang 'dab mas g-yogs pa ni ma'i tshogs kyis so //
translated: Covered with leaves and branches means covered with a collection of leaves.

original: rgyud gsum pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas sam dkon mchog gi bstod pa ni rgyud gcig la /
analyzed: rgyud gsum pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas sam dkon mchog gi bstod pa ni rgyud gcig la /
translated: The third part is called the ‚Äúcontinuum‚Äù because it is the praise of the Buddha or the Jewels.

original: gzhung gi chos bshad pa ni rgyud gnyis pa yin zhing /
analyzed: gzhung gi chos bshad pa ni rgyud gnyis pa yin zhing /
translated: The second part is the ‚Äúcontinuum‚Äù because it is the explanation of the Dharma of the treatise.

original: mdo'i don rnam par bshad pa'i gtam rgyud ni rgyud gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo'i don rnam par bshad pa'i gtam rgyud ni rgyud gsum pa yin no //
translated: The third part is the ‚Äúcontinuum‚Äù because it is the story of the explanation of the meaning of the sutra.

original: yin bsngo ba ni chos kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa las yang dag par byung ba'i bsod nams kyi 'bras bu kun du bgo bsha' byed pa'o //
analyzed: yin bsngo ba ni chos kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa las yang dag par byung ba'i bsod nams kyi 'bras bu kun du bgo bsha' byed pa'o //
translated: The dedication is the distribution of the fruit of merit that arises from the gift of Dharma, etc.

original: de ltar gyur pa ni de skad smras par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa ni de skad smras par gyur pa'o //
translated: The one who has done that is the one who has spoken in that way.

original: kun nas skyo ba dag gi sems dang ba skyed pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi mchod rten la phyag bya ba ni rjes su gsang ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas skyo ba dag gi sems dang ba skyed pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi mchod rten la phyag bya ba ni rjes su gsang ba'o //
translated: The homage to the stupa of the Blessed One is the conclusion, in order to generate a clear mind in those who are completely weary.

original: kun du spyod pa ni gdon mi za bar bya ba nyid kyis goms par bya ba'o //
analyzed: kun du spyod pa ni gdon mi za bar bya ba nyid kyis goms par bya ba'o //
translated: The practice is the cultivation by means of the certainty of what must be done.

original: dmyal bar rgyu ba ni dmyal bar rgyu ba ste /
analyzed: dmyal bar rgyu ba ni dmyal bar rgyu ba ste /
translated: The wandering in hell is the wandering in hell.

original: sems can la phan gdags pa'i phyir 'gro bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can la phan gdags pa'i phyir 'gro bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is the going in order to benefit sentient beings.

original: yi dags su rgyu ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: yi dags su rgyu ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to the pretas and so on.

original: mtshams ni skabs yin te /
analyzed: mtshams ni skabs yin te /
translated: The ‚Äúintermediate‚Äù is the occasion.

original: shin tu skabs med pa'i phyir mtshams med pa yin la /
analyzed: shin tu skabs med pa'i phyir mtshams med pa yin la /
translated: It is ‚Äúimmeasurable‚Äù because it is a very long occasion.

original: dmyal @73b ba gzhan dag pas sdug bsngal che ba nyid kyi phyir dang / shin tu tshe ring ba'i phyir dmyal ba chen po'o //
analyzed: dmyal @73b ba gzhan dag pas sdug bsngal che ba nyid kyi phyir dang / shin tu tshe ring ba'i phyir dmyal ba chen po'o //
translated: It is a ‚Äúgreat hell‚Äù because the suffering is greater than in the other hells, and because the life span is very long.

original: ngal bso bar gyis shig ces bya ba ni dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal las dus de srid cig grol bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ngal bso bar gyis shig ces bya ba ni dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal las dus de srid cig grol bar gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTake a rest‚Äù means that for that length of time they are freed from the suffering of the hells.

original: mig tsam zhes bya ba ni shing rta'i 'khor lo'i bug pa'i tshad do //
analyzed: mig tsam zhes bya ba ni shing rta'i 'khor lo'i bug pa'i tshad do //
translated: ‚ÄúThe size of an eye‚Äù means the size of the hole in a chariot wheel.

original: bar du skoms pa ni mtshams med pa'i mes yongs su zad par byas pa'o //
analyzed: bar du skoms pa ni mtshams med pa'i mes yongs su zad par byas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the middle, it is parched‚Äù means that the fire of the immeasurably long hell has completely dried it up.

original: mos pa las byung ba'i zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mos pa las byung ba'i zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúArisen from aspiration‚Äù means:

original: lhag par mos pa ste /
analyzed: lhag par mos pa ste /
translated: Aspiration is the desire to do something.

original: yang dag pa nyid du ma yin ba la sems kyis yang dag pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du ma yin ba la sems kyis yang dag pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa yin la /
translated: It is the mind‚Äôs desire to accomplish what is not real as if it were real.

original: lhag par mos pa'i phyir 'byung bas mos pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: lhag par mos pa'i phyir 'byung bas mos pa las byung ba ste /
translated: Since it arises from aspiration, it is arisen from aspiration.

original: mos pa dang rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: mos pa dang rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: up to ‚Äúin accordance with their aspirations.‚Äù

original: 'dam du gyur pa ni dbyar gyi chus byas pa'i 'dam du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'dam du gyur pa ni dbyar gyi chus byas pa'i 'dam du gyur pa'o //
translated: Mud is the mud created by the waters of the rainy season.

original: gnod pa med ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal chung ngur gyur cing rgyu mthun pa'i bde ba rab tu skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gnod pa med ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal chung ngur gyur cing rgyu mthun pa'i bde ba rab tu skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout harm‚Äù means that the suffering is slight and the cause for the arising of a pleasant feeling is great.

original: de ltar gyur pa yin na ni las gzhan gyis byas la 'bras bu gzhan gyis myong par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa yin na ni las gzhan gyis byas la 'bras bu gzhan gyis myong par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then it would follow that one would experience the result of an action done by another.

original: 'di la nyes pa yod pa ma yin te /üîΩde dag kho na la rgyu mthun pa'i bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las bsags pa yod pa 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mthus lhan cig byed pa'i rgyud la rag las pa de nyid ni dus der 'bras bu 'byin pa de'i phyir rang gis
analyzed: 'di la nyes pa yod pa ma yin te / de dag kho na la rgyu mthun pa'i bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las bsags pa yod pa 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mthus lhan cig byed pa'i rgyud la rag las pa de nyid ni dus der 'bras bu 'byin pa de'i phyir rang gis
translated: There is no fault here.üîΩThe accumulation of the karma that would result in a pleasant feeling in those very beings is dependent on the cooperative conditions of the power of the samadhi of the noble Shariputra.

original: byas pa'i las kyis de dag la dbang gi 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byas pa'i las kyis de dag la dbang gi 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the result of the karma that they themselves created is born in them as the dominant result.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: las rnam bskal pa brgyar yang ni //
analyzed: las rnam bskal pa brgyar yang ni //
translated: And karma does not perish even in a hundred eons.

original: chud mi za ba'ang tshogs dang dus //
analyzed: chud mi za ba'ang tshogs dang dus //
translated: When the assemblage and the time are right,

original: rnyed na lus can rnams la ni //
analyzed: rnyed na lus can rnams la ni //
translated: then for embodied beings

original: 'bras bu dag tu 'gyur ba nyid //üîΩces 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu dag tu 'gyur ba nyid // ces 'byung ba yin no //
translated: the results will come to be.

original: kun nas chos log par bstan pa ni phyin ci log gi chos bstan pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas chos log par bstan pa ni phyin ci log gi chos bstan pa ste /
translated: The teaching of a perverted Dharma is the teaching of a false Dharma.

original: chos ma yin pa la chos nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩkun nas zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar 'di kho na bden pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bstan par bzung nas so //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa la chos nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro // kun nas zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar 'di kho na bden pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bstan par bzung nas so //
translated: Because it is the teaching of what is not Dharma as if it were Dharma.üîΩThe word ‚Äúperverted‚Äù means ‚Äúhaving the nature of a perversion.‚Äù

original: mthun par spyod pas zhes bya ba ni las de dang rjes su mthun par nan tan byas pas so //
analyzed: mthun par spyod pas zhes bya ba ni las de dang rjes su mthun par nan tan byas pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy practicing in accordance with it‚Äù means by practicing in accordance with that karma.

original: bslus te zhes bya ba ni rnam par skrod pa'o //üîΩmchod rten de la mchod pa byas pas de la rab tu gnod pa ste /
analyzed: bslus te zhes bya ba ni rnam par skrod pa'o // mchod rten de la mchod pa byas pas de la rab tu gnod pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúHaving been deceived‚Äù means having been expelled.

original: drag po'i tshor ba myong bar ji ltar rigs te /
analyzed: drag po'i tshor ba myong bar ji ltar rigs te /
translated: How could it be right that by making offerings to that stupa one would experience a severe calamity?

original: mchod pa'i las gzhan gyis byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mchod pa'i las gzhan gyis byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the act of worship is done by another.

original: 'di la yang de nyid kyis lan @74a * //
analyzed: 'di la yang de nyid kyis lan @74a * //
translated: In response to this, BhƒÅviveka says:üîΩ

original: gdab par bya ste /üîΩgang pos sdug bsngal chen po nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'i las de nyid sngon byas shing bsags pa yod pa mchod rten de la mchod pa byas pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu la rag las pa yin pa de'i phyir mchod rten la mchod pa byas pa las
analyzed: gdab par bya ste / gang pos sdug bsngal chen po nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'i las de nyid sngon byas shing bsags pa yod pa mchod rten de la mchod pa byas pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu la rag las pa yin pa de'i phyir mchod rten la mchod pa byas pa las
translated: Here, the same author gives the answer:üîΩP≈´r·πáa had previously accumulated the karma to experience great suffering.üîΩThe worship of the st≈´pa was the cooperating condition for that karma to ripen.

original: gang po la rab tu gnod pa'i tshor ba skye bar 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gang po la rab tu gnod pa'i tshor ba skye bar 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the worship of the st≈´pa was the cause of P≈´r·πáa‚Äôs experience of pain.

original: gzhan gyis byas pa'i las las gzhan gyis rnam par smin pa so sor myong bar gyur pa zhes smras pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa'i las las gzhan gyis rnam par smin pa so sor myong bar gyur pa zhes smras pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is illogical to say that one experiences the ripening of karma created by another.üîΩMoreover, it is said:

original: de yang / gal te las rnams 'pho 'gyur na /
analyzed: de yang / gal te las rnams 'pho 'gyur na /
translated: If karma were transferred,

original: de ni nges par khyed nyid gyi //
analyzed: de ni nges par khyed nyid gyi //
translated: then it would definitely be yours.

original: lha sbyin gyi ni rgyu nyid kyis //
analyzed: lha sbyin gyi ni rgyu nyid kyis //
translated: Because of the cause of Devadatta,

original: thams cad la ni nges 'jug 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad la ni nges 'jug 'gyur // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: it would definitely be engaged by all.

original: kun du rgyu ni brtul zhugs la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: kun du rgyu ni brtul zhugs la gnas pa'o //
translated: A parivrƒÅjaka is one who follows the life of an ascetic.

original: dbyig pa dang gtsug phud dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la dbyig pa ni 'khar ba yin la /
analyzed: dbyig pa dang gtsug phud dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la dbyig pa ni 'khar ba yin la /
translated: He is called a staff-holder because he holds a staff, and a topknot-holder because he holds a topknot.

original: gtsug phud ni spyi gtsug ste /
analyzed: gtsug phud ni spyi gtsug ste /
translated: A staff is a cane.üîΩA topknot is a tuft of hair on the crown of the head.

original: dbyig pa dang gtsug phud dag gis legs par gyur pa ni dbyig pa dang / gtsug phud kho na can yin la dbyig pa dang gtsug phud kho na dang ldan pas na dbyig pa dang gtsug phud can nyid do //
analyzed: dbyig pa dang gtsug phud dag gis legs par gyur pa ni dbyig pa dang / gtsug phud kho na can yin la dbyig pa dang gtsug phud kho na dang ldan pas na dbyig pa dang gtsug phud can nyid do //
translated: He is called a staff-holder because he holds a staff, and a topknot-holder because he holds a topknot.

original: dge sbyong ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i 'bras bu thob pa'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i 'bras bu thob pa'o //
translated: An ascetic is one who has attained the result of his philosophical view.

original: 'tsho ba dag la dge sbyong med pa ste /
analyzed: 'tsho ba dag la dge sbyong med pa ste /
translated: An ascetic does not exist in the world.

original: yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: He does not exist.

original: sh'akya la ni de yod do //üîΩdgra bcom pa yang chags ldan med //
analyzed: sh'akya la ni de yod do // dgra bcom pa yang chags ldan med //
translated: But he exists among the Shakyas.üîΩAn arhat is not attached.

original: so so'i skye bo byis min med //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo byis min med //
translated: An ordinary person is not a child.

original: 'on kyang so so'i skye bo thams cad la byis pa kho na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang so so'i skye bo thams cad la byis pa kho na zhes bya'o //
translated: However, all ordinary persons are called children.üîΩAn ascetic exists in the world.

original: 'tsho ba dag la dge sbyong yod ces bya ba de ltar tshigs su bcad pa'i don de dag gis rtogs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba dag la dge sbyong yod ces bya ba de ltar tshigs su bcad pa'i don de dag gis rtogs par gyur pa'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the verses.

original: sngon gyi las kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúDue to former karma‚Äù and so on.

original: sngon gyi skye ba des las byas shing bsags pa gang yin pa de ni las kyi rnam par smin pa nye bar gnas pa ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi skye ba des las byas shing bsags pa gang yin pa de ni las kyi rnam par smin pa nye bar gnas pa ste /
translated: Whatever karma was created and accumulated in former lives, that karma is present as the ripening of karma.

original: rnam par smin pa 'byin pa'i phyir gsal por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa 'byin pa'i phyir gsal por gyur pa'o //
translated: It is clear because it produces the ripening.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHere‚Äù means in the teaching of the TathƒÅgata.

original: dge sbyong dang po zhes bya ba ni lam ston par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong dang po zhes bya ba ni lam ston par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The first ascetic is the one who teaches the path.

original: dge sbyong gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni lam gyis rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni lam gyis rgyal ba'o //
translated: The second ascetic is the one who conquers by the path.

original: dge sbyong gsum pa zhes bya ba ni lam gyis 'tsho ba'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gsum pa zhes bya ba ni lam gyis 'tsho ba'o //
translated: The third ascetic is the one who lives by the path.

original: dge sbyong bzhi pa zhes bya ba ni lam sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong bzhi pa zhes bya ba ni lam sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: The fourth ascetic is the one who disparages the path.

original: de la lam ston par mdzad pa ni bcom ldan 'das yin la /
analyzed: de la lam ston par mdzad pa ni bcom ldan 'das yin la /
translated: Among them, the one who teaches the path is the Blessed One.

original: lam gyis @74b rgyal ba ni rang sangs rgyas dang dgra bcom pa yin zhing /
analyzed: lam gyis @74b rgyal ba ni rang sangs rgyas dang dgra bcom pa yin zhing /
translated: The one who conquers by the path is the pratyekabuddhas and arhats.

original: lam gyis 'tsho ba ni 'phags pa'i gang zag bdun yin no //
analyzed: lam gyis 'tsho ba ni 'phags pa'i gang zag bdun yin no //
translated: The one who lives by the path is the seven types of noble beings.

original: lam sum 'byin pa ni tshul khrims 'chal ba'o //
analyzed: lam sum 'byin pa ni tshul khrims 'chal ba'o //
translated: The one who is the source of three paths is the one who has violated morality.

original: kha cig ni dge sbyong dang po la sogs pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa nas dgra bcom pa'i mthar thug pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni dge sbyong dang po la sogs pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa nas dgra bcom pa'i mthar thug pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: The first ascetic, etc. are the stream-enterer, etc. up to the arhat.

original: dge sbyong nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir dge sbyong yin la /
analyzed: dge sbyong nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir dge sbyong yin la /
translated: He is an ascetic because he possesses the nature of an ascetic.

original: sdig pa bsal ba nyid kyi phyir bram ze yin te /üîΩphas kyi rgol ba dag de dag gis gtong ba yin te /
analyzed: sdig pa bsal ba nyid kyi phyir bram ze yin te / phas kyi rgol ba dag de dag gis gtong ba yin te /
translated: He is a brahmin because he has removed evil.üîΩHe is a mendicant because he has abandoned the opponent's side.

original: dge sbyong la sogs pa khong du chud pa'i bya ba dang bral bar gyur ches bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge sbyong la sogs pa khong du chud pa'i bya ba dang bral bar gyur ches bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He is a monk because he has abandoned the activities of the ascetic, etc.

original: mgo reg ces bya ba ni mgo smad pa dang / ngan pa yod pa'o //
analyzed: mgo reg ces bya ba ni mgo smad pa dang / ngan pa yod pa'o //
translated: Shaven-headed means having a shaven head and being inferior.

original: ngan pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir gnad las bskul ba'o //
analyzed: ngan pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir gnad las bskul ba'o //
translated: Inferior means here that he is despised.

original: ngan du zer ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i skyon brjod pa'o //üîΩyan lag ni lag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ngan du zer ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i skyon brjod pa'o // yan lag ni lag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Slander means expressing false faults.üîΩLimbs are the arms, etc.

original: nying lag ni sor mo'i tshigs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nying lag ni sor mo'i tshigs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Minor limbs are the joints of the fingers, etc.

original: ring zhing thogs so zhes bya ba ni ring por 'gor ba'o //
analyzed: ring zhing thogs so zhes bya ba ni ring por 'gor ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFor a long time‚Äù means for a long period of time.

original: g-yos pa ni lan cig ste chung ngu'o //
analyzed: g-yos pa ni lan cig ste chung ngu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúShaken‚Äù means shaken once, slightly.

original: rab tu g-yos pa ni rgyun gyis 'bring du yin la /
analyzed: rab tu g-yos pa ni rgyun gyis 'bring du yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúStrongly shaken‚Äù means shaken continuously, moderately.

original: kun du rab tu g-yos pa ni rgyun gyis chen por ro //
analyzed: kun du rab tu g-yos pa ni rgyun gyis chen por ro //
translated: ‚ÄúCompletely and strongly shaken‚Äù means shaken continuously, greatly.

original: rdzu 'phrul che ba ni rdzu 'phrul che ba ste /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul che ba ni rdzu 'phrul che ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOf great spiritual power‚Äù means of great spiritual power.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis sgrub par byed pa la mkhas pa dag gi'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis sgrub par byed pa la mkhas pa dag gi'o //
translated: It is the spiritual power of those who are skilled in the means of accomplishing miracles.

original: mthu che ba dag gi nang zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar rab tu ston par nus pa dang ldan pa dag gi nang na'o //
analyzed: mthu che ba dag gi nang zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar rab tu ston par nus pa dang ldan pa dag gi nang na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAmong those of great power‚Äù means among those who are able to demonstrate miracles.

original: mi dga' ba ni skyo ba'o //
analyzed: mi dga' ba ni skyo ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDismayed‚Äù means frightened.

original: grong las rgyang grags kyi mtha' ni dgon pa'o //
analyzed: grong las rgyang grags kyi mtha' ni dgon pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúA wilderness‚Äù is beyond the range of a village.

original: nags 'dab ni dgon pa'i nags kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: nags 'dab ni dgon pa'i nags kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: ‚ÄúA forest grove‚Äù is a part of a forest in a wilderness.

original: bas mthar gnas bcas te yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: bas mthar gnas bcas te yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving gone to a wilderness, to the foot of a tree, or to an empty building, he should practice attention accompanied by the aspects of impermanence, etc.‚Äù

original: rab tu khros pa ni kun nas dkris pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu khros pa ni kun nas dkris pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúGreat anger‚Äù means great affliction.

original: btsun mo ni spyad par bya ba'i bud med do //
analyzed: btsun mo ni spyad par bya ba'i bud med do //
translated: The queen is a woman who is to be enjoyed.

original: gzhon nu ni rgyal tshab tu dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: gzhon nu ni rgyal tshab tu dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: The prince is one who has been consecrated as the heir apparent.

original: blon po ni blo'i grogs su gyur pa'o //üîΩgrong na gnas pas na grong mi'o //
analyzed: blon po ni blo'i grogs su gyur pa'o // grong na gnas pas na grong mi'o //
translated: The minister is one who is a friend of the mind.üîΩThe townsman is one who lives in a town.

original: ljongs na gnas pas na ljongs kyi mi'o //
analyzed: ljongs na gnas pas na ljongs kyi mi'o //
translated: The countryman is one who lives in the country.

original: mig mchi mas yongs su dkrugs nas zhes bya ba ni mig mchi mas khyab par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mig mchi mas yongs su dkrugs nas zhes bya ba ni mig mchi mas khyab par gyur pa'o //
translated: With eyes filled with tears means with eyes covered with tears.

original: snying rje'i tshig ni snying rje skyed pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i tshig yin la /
analyzed: snying rje'i tshig ni snying rje skyed pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i tshig yin la /
translated: Words of compassion are words that accord with the arising of compassion.

original: yid gdung ba'i tshig ni sdug bsngal ston bar byed pa'i tshig yin @75a * //
analyzed: yid gdung ba'i tshig ni sdug bsngal ston bar byed pa'i tshig yin @75a * //
translated: Words of grief are words that express suffering.

original: zhing ; mi gsal ba'i tshig ni mi gsal ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: zhing ; mi gsal ba'i tshig ni mi gsal ba nyid yin te /
translated: Words of indistinctness are words that are indistinct.

original: tshig gsum po de dag ni bya ba'i khyad par yin te /
analyzed: tshig gsum po de dag ni bya ba'i khyad par yin te /
translated: These three words are particularized actions.

original: bya ba mi gsal ba khyad par du byed pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba mi gsal ba khyad par du byed pa'o //
translated: The particularization is of indistinct action.

original: las rnams bskal pa brgyar yang ni /
analyzed: las rnams bskal pa brgyar yang ni /
translated: Even after a hundred eons,

original: chud mi za ba zhes bya ba ni bsams bzhin du byas pa dang / bsags par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: chud mi za ba zhes bya ba ni bsams bzhin du byas pa dang / bsags par gyur pa'o //
translated: Non-expiration is the performance and accumulation of karma as intended.

original: bskal pa brgyar smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bskal pa brgyar smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The mention of a hundred eons is for the purpose of illustration.

original: bskal ba bye bar yang las byas shing bsags pa dag chud za bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bskal ba bye bar yang las byas shing bsags pa dag chud za bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if karma is performed and accumulated for a hundred million eons, it does not expire.

original: tshogs ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: tshogs ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: A collection is a co-originating cause.

original: dus ni 'dir 'bras bu de longs spyad du rung ba la 'dod de /
analyzed: dus ni 'dir 'bras bu de longs spyad du rung ba la 'dod de /
translated: Time is the suitability of the result to be experienced.

original: de ltar 'khor los sgyur ba sgrub par byed pa'i las tshe lo stong phrag brgyad cu'i 'og dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sgrub par byed pa'i las tshe lo brgya ba'i 'og tu rnam par smin pa 'byin pa'i nus pa med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'khor los sgyur ba sgrub par byed pa'i las tshe lo stong phrag brgyad cu'i 'og dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sgrub par byed pa'i las tshe lo brgya ba'i 'og tu rnam par smin pa 'byin pa'i nus pa med pa lta bu'o //
translated: Thus, the karma that establishes a universal monarch does not have the power to yield a result when the life expectancy is less than eighty thousand years, and the karma that establishes a perfect buddha does not have the power to yield a result when the life expectancy is less than one hundred years.

original: mchi ma phyis te zhes bya ba ni bsal te'o //
analyzed: mchi ma phyis te zhes bya ba ni bsal te'o //
translated: Wiping away tears means to remove them.

original: 'tsho ba ni 'tsho ba'i thabs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba ni 'tsho ba'i thabs su gyur pa'o //
translated: Livelihood is the means of livelihood.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis na ba so sor bsal te zhes bya ba ni chung ba nyid du byas nas so //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis na ba so sor bsal te zhes bya ba ni chung ba nyid du byas nas so //
translated: By means of his magical power, he individually removed their illnesses, that is, he reduced them.

original: mdza' ba'i bag chags ni srid pa'i bag chags yin te /
analyzed: mdza' ba'i bag chags ni srid pa'i bag chags yin te /
translated: The latent impressions of affection are the latent impressions of existence.

original: ji ltar me tog gis bsgos pa'i til dag las me tog bsal du zin kyang me tog dri 'byung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar me tog gis bsgos pa'i til dag las me tog bsal du zin kyang me tog dri 'byung ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as sesame seeds are perfumed by flowers, even though the flowers are removed, the fragrance of the flowers arises.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs su zin kyang dgra bcom pa la nyon mongs pa'i bag chags yod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs su zin kyang dgra bcom pa la nyon mongs pa'i bag chags yod pa lta bu'o //
translated: In the same way, even though the defilements such as passion are abandoned, the latent impressions of the defilements remain in the Arhat.

original: shin tu na bas zhes bya ba ni phyir gso bar mi nus pa'i nad do //
analyzed: shin tu na bas zhes bya ba ni phyir gso bar mi nus pa'i nad do //
translated: By a very serious illness means by an illness that cannot be cured.

original: gnod pa dang ldan yang phyir gnod pa yin yang sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan to ;
analyzed: gnod pa dang ldan yang phyir gnod pa yin yang sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan to ;
translated: Even though he is afflicted, he does not generate suffering.

original: / sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal du 'bying ba'o //
analyzed: / sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal du 'bying ba'o //
translated: Suffering is the sinking in suffering.

original: dge sbyong du ston pa zhes bya ba la dge sbyong gi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir dang / dge sbyong yongs su ma rdzogs pa nyid kyi phyir dge sbyong du ston pa'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong du ston pa zhes bya ba la dge sbyong gi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir dang / dge sbyong yongs su ma rdzogs pa nyid kyi phyir dge sbyong du ston pa'o //
translated: He is called a ‚Äúteacher of ascetics‚Äù because he is a part of the group of ascetics and because he is the perfect ascetic.

original: yongs su mya nan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar zhi bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya nan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar zhi bar gyur pa'o //
translated: He is called ‚Äúone who has attained final nirvƒÅ·πáa‚Äù because he has attained complete peace.

original: dbang dang ldan pa ni 'dir gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba la 'dod pa de nyid kyi phyir gang phal cher zhes smos pa byas pa yin la /
analyzed: dbang dang ldan pa ni 'dir gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba la 'dod pa de nyid kyi phyir gang phal cher zhes smos pa byas pa yin la /
translated: Here, ‚Äúone who has attained mastery‚Äù refers to one who is liberated from both parts. It is for this very reason that the word ‚Äúmostly‚Äù is used.

original: 'ga' zhig shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba yang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba yang yod pa yin no //
translated: There are some who are liberated by wisdom alone.

original: so sor bzhag nas zhes bya ba ni gnas ji lta ba bzhin du bzhag nas so //
analyzed: so sor bzhag nas zhes bya ba ni gnas ji lta ba bzhin du bzhag nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving been placed‚Äù means having been placed in the proper place.

original: btsun @75b pa ni mkhan po'i ming nas smos pa'i nye ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: btsun @75b pa ni mkhan po'i ming nas smos pa'i nye ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable‚Äù is a term of address for a preceptor.

original: 'di la bslab pa'i gzhi la rags pa nyid kyi phyir byas pa yin no zhes shes par bya'i //
analyzed: 'di la bslab pa'i gzhi la rags pa nyid kyi phyir byas pa yin no zhes shes par bya'i //
translated: It should be understood that this is done because the bases of training are coarse.

original: rnam par gzhan du na ji ltar rigs te /
analyzed: rnam par gzhan du na ji ltar rigs te /
translated: Otherwise, how could it be reasonable?

original: skul byed kyis bsams bzhin du bslab pa las 'das pa byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skul byed kyis bsams bzhin du bslab pa las 'das pa byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he committed the transgression of the precepts intentionally.

original: ring bsrel bsregs pa'i rus pa'o //
analyzed: ring bsrel bsregs pa'i rus pa'o //
translated: The relics are the bones of one who has been cremated.

original: dug skyes te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dug skyes te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe poison has arisen‚Äù and so on.

original: dug skyes shing 'byung bar gyur pa'i lus gang yin pa de ni dug skyes pa ste /
analyzed: dug skyes shing 'byung bar gyur pa'i lus gang yin pa de ni dug skyes pa ste /
translated: The body in which the poison has arisen and come into existence is one in which the poison has arisen.

original: dug gis khyab par gyur pa'i chos lus las skyes pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dug gis khyab par gyur pa'i chos lus las skyes pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The body is pervaded by poison, and the Dharma has arisen from the body, that is the meaning of the expression.

original: bdag gis phyogs ma 'tshal to zhes bya ba ni sems rnam par 'khrugs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩde bas na bdag gis shar la sogs pa'i phyogs 'di ltar 'di ni shar yin la /
analyzed: bdag gis phyogs ma 'tshal to zhes bya ba ni sems rnam par 'khrugs pa nyid kyi phyir ro // de bas na bdag gis shar la sogs pa'i phyogs 'di ltar 'di ni shar yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúI do not know the direction‚Äù means that his mind is disturbed.üîΩTherefore, I do not know the direction, such as east, etc., in this way: ‚ÄúThis is the east,

original: 'di ni nub kyi phyogs yin no zhes bya ba'i snang ba ma 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nub kyi phyogs yin no zhes bya ba'i snang ba ma 'tshal ba'o //
translated: this is the west.‚Äù

original: da ltar mi dran no zhes bya ba ni dran pa'i yul nyid du gyur pa med pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar mi dran no zhes bya ba ni dran pa'i yul nyid du gyur pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúI do not remember now‚Äù means that it is not the object of memory.

original: ci kun dga' bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: ci kun dga' bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of ‚ÄúWhat is this, ƒÄnanda?‚Äù and so on is as follows.

original: khyod sh'a ri'i bu rab tu byung ba la nan tan byed pa ni ma yin gyi /üîΩ'on kyang tshul khrims la sogs pa la mngon par sbyor ba'i sgo nas mya ngan las 'das pa la nan tan byed pa de'i phyir ma lags so zhes smras pa yin no //
analyzed: khyod sh'a ri'i bu rab tu byung ba la nan tan byed pa ni ma yin gyi / 'on kyang tshul khrims la sogs pa la mngon par sbyor ba'i sgo nas mya ngan las 'das pa la nan tan byed pa de'i phyir ma lags so zhes smras pa yin no //
translated: You are not intent on the renunciation of ≈öƒÅriputra,üîΩbut rather on nirvƒÅ·πáa through the application of morality, etc.

original: tshul khrims kyi phung po bzung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phung po bzung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The passage beginning with ‚Äúhaving taken up the aggregate of morality‚Äù means:

original: tshul khrims kyi phung po ni tshul khrims kyi tshogs yin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phung po ni tshul khrims kyi tshogs yin te /
translated: The aggregate of morality is the collection of morality.

original: de yang so sor thar pa dang / bsam gtan dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang so sor thar pa dang / bsam gtan dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: It is also the nature of the vows of individual liberation, concentration, and uncontaminated vows.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi phyung po ni ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs yin te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi phyung po ni ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs yin te /
translated: The aggregate of concentration is the collection of concentration.

original: de yang rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / spyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / spyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: It is also the nature of concentration with investigation, with joy, etc.

original: shes rab kyi phung po ni shes rab kyi tshogs yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi phung po ni shes rab kyi tshogs yin te /
translated: The aggregate of wisdom is the collection of wisdom.

original: de yang zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa la sogs pa dmigs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa du ma yod de /
analyzed: de yang zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa la sogs pa dmigs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa du ma yod de /
translated: Moreover, liberation has many aspects due to the specific objects it focuses on, such as contaminated and uncontaminated states.

original: rnam bar grol ba ni sems rnam par grol ba ste /
analyzed: rnam bar grol ba ni sems rnam par grol ba ste /
translated: Liberation is the mind liberated from afflictions.

original: de yang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis yin te /
translated: It has two aspects due to the unconditioned and conditioned.

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa ni 'dus ma byas yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa ni 'dus ma byas yin la /
translated: The abandonment of afflictions is unconditioned and

original: lhag par mos pa ni 'dus byas yin zhing de yang 'das pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas tshogs nyid yin @76a * //
analyzed: lhag par mos pa ni 'dus byas yin zhing de yang 'das pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas tshogs nyid yin @76a * //
translated: superior motivation is conditioned and it is also a collection due to the classification of past and so on.

original: no ; / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba 'dus ma byas la dmigs pa'i ye shes dang mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: no ; / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba 'dus ma byas la dmigs pa'i ye shes dang mthong ba yin te /
translated: The aggregate of seeing the wisdom of liberation is the wisdom and seeing that focuses on unconditioned liberation.

original: de yang zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes dang / mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba la rnam par grol ba la ye shes mthong ba zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes dang / mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba la rnam par grol ba la ye shes mthong ba zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: Furthermore, the aggregates of liberation and the aggregates of the vision of wisdom refer to the wisdom of extinction and non-production, and to the right view of the adept.

original: ngas zhes bya ba 'dis ni gzhan gyi man ngag la ltos pa med pa nyid ston pa'o //
analyzed: ngas zhes bya ba 'dis ni gzhan gyi man ngag la ltos pa med pa nyid ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase I have fully awakened to shows that he does not depend on the instruction of another.

original: mngon par mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: mngon par mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis so //
translated: The phrase I have fully known means that he has known by means of the wisdom of omniscience.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen nas so //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen nas so //
translated: The phrase having fully awakened to means that he has known reality just as it is.

original: bshad pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase I have taught means that he has revealed.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni /
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness are:

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ste /
translated: the foundation of mindfulness of body, the foundation of mindfulness of feeling, the foundation of mindfulness of thought, and the foundation of mindfulness of dharmas.

original: 'dis yul dag la dran pa nye bar 'jog pa dang / rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i dbang du byas nas 'dir shes rab la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis yul dag la dran pa nye bar 'jog pa dang / rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i dbang du byas nas 'dir shes rab la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In this context, wisdom is called the application of mindfulness because it is the application of mindfulness to objects and it is the engagement in them.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi ni /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi ni /
translated: The four right efforts are

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir dang / skyes pa rnams spangs pa'i phyir dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed ba'i phyir dang / skyes pa rnams phyir bogs dbyung ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed par byed /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir dang / skyes pa rnams spangs pa'i phyir dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed ba'i phyir dang / skyes pa rnams phyir bogs dbyung ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed par byed /
translated: the generation of will,

original: 'bad par byed /
analyzed: 'bad par byed /
translated: exertion,

original: brtson 'grus rtsom par byed /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom par byed /
translated: the instigation of effort,

original: sems rab tu 'dzin par byed //
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin par byed //
translated: the control of mind, and

original: yang dag par rab tu 'jog par byed pa'i phyir bzhi'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu 'jog par byed pa'i phyir bzhi'o //
translated: the correct establishment of non-arisen unfavorable things,üîΩof the abandonment of arisen unfavorable things,üîΩof the production of unarisen favorable things, andüîΩof the increase of arisen favorable things.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ni 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ni 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
translated: the base of supernatural power that is achieved through the concentration of mind,üîΩand the base of supernatural power that is achieved through the concentration of investigation.

original: rdzu 'phrul ni ting nge 'dzin yin la /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ni ting nge 'dzin yin la /
translated: Supernatural power is concentration.

original: rkang pa ni rten yin no //
analyzed: rkang pa ni rten yin no //
translated: The bases are the supports.

original: dbang po lnga ni /
analyzed: dbang po lnga ni /
translated: The five faculties are

original: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab ces bya ba yin te /
translated: faith, striving, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: dbang byed pa thob ba nyid kyi phyir de dag la dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang byed pa thob ba nyid kyi phyir de dag la dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called faculties because they obtain the power to rule.

original: stobs lnga ni /
analyzed: stobs lnga ni /
translated: The five powers are

original: de dag nyid mi brdzi ba nyid gyi gnas skabs gzhan thob par gyur pa @76b la bstan to //
analyzed: de dag nyid mi brdzi ba nyid gyi gnas skabs gzhan thob par gyur pa @76b la bstan to //
translated: the same as the above, but are called powers because they have attained another state in which they cannot be overcome.

original: byang chub ni zad la mi skye ba'i ye shes yin la /
analyzed: byang chub ni zad la mi skye ba'i ye shes yin la /
translated: Enlightenment is the knowledge of the extinction of the impurities and of their non-production.

original: de'i rjes su mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yan lag bdun yin te /
analyzed: de'i rjes su mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yan lag bdun yin te /
translated: The seven factors are in conformity with it.

original: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go //
translated: The seven factors of enlightenment are the enlightenment factor of mindfulness, the enlightenment factor of the investigation of things, the enlightenment factor of effort, the enlightenment factor of rapture, the enlightenment factor of tranquility, the enlightenment factor of concentration, and the enlightenment factor of equanimity.

original: lam gang yin pa de ni yan lag brgyad pa yin la /
analyzed: lam gang yin pa de ni yan lag brgyad pa yin la /
translated: The path is the eightfold path.üîΩIt is the noble path because it is the path of the noble ones.

original: 'phags pa yang de nyid la yan lag brgyad pa yang de nyid yin pas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ste /üîΩzag pa med pa'i lam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'phags pa yang de nyid la yan lag brgyad pa yang de nyid yin pas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ste / zag pa med pa'i lam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the noble eightfold path because it is the eightfold path of the noble ones.

original: yan lag brgyad ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
analyzed: yan lag brgyad ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
translated: The eight members are right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: It is right concentration.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pa la sogs pa'i tshul khrims dang 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pa la sogs pa'i tshul khrims dang 'byor pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with morality means that he is endowed with the morality of the vow of individual liberation and so on.

original: mang du thos pa zhes bya ba ni thos pa dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mang du thos pa zhes bya ba ni thos pa dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
translated: He is learned means that he is endowed with learning.

original: dngos po chung dus srog 'dzin par 'dod pa gang la yod pa de ni 'dod pa chung ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po chung dus srog 'dzin par 'dod pa gang la yod pa de ni 'dod pa chung ba'o //
translated: He is content means that he is satisfied with little, since he is satisfied with little for the sake of maintaining his life.

original: srog 'dzin pa'i bsod snyoms la sogs pa rnyed pa na shin tu bsod pa dang lhag pa mi 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir mgu sla ba'o //
analyzed: srog 'dzin pa'i bsod snyoms la sogs pa rnyed pa na shin tu bsod pa dang lhag pa mi 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir mgu sla ba'o //
translated: He is easily satisfied means that he is easily satisfied with what he obtains, such as alms for the sake of maintaining his life, because he does not desire what is better or more.

original: rab tu dben pa ni lus dang sems dben pa nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rab tu dben pa ni lus dang sems dben pa nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
translated: He is secluded means that he is endowed with physical and mental seclusion.

original: lus kyi sgo nas skye po gzhan dang 'dre ba spong ba dang / sems kyi sgo nas sdig pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa spangs nas zhes bya ba ni dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi sgo nas skye po gzhan dang 'dre ba spong ba dang / sems kyi sgo nas sdig pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa spangs nas zhes bya ba ni dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: He is secluded physically by abandoning contact with other people and mentally by abandoning sinful thoughts.üîΩHe is not a seeker of service means that he does not seek service, such as being massaged, for the sake of his body.

original: rtag tu lhag pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'i brtson 'grus gang la yod pa de ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa'o //üîΩnye bar 'jog pa ste /üîΩrtag tu dran pa mngon du byed pa gang la yod pa de ni dran pa nye bar 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: rtag tu lhag pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'i brtson 'grus gang la yod pa de ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa'o // nye bar 'jog pa ste / rtag tu dran pa mngon du byed pa gang la yod pa de ni dran pa nye bar 'jog pa ste /
translated: He is one who is well-established,üîΩbecause he is always intent on the establishment of mindfulness.

original: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag la nye bar 'jog par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag la nye bar 'jog par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He is one who is well-established in the establishment of mindfulness of the mind.üîΩHe is one who is well-controlled,

original: shin tu thul ba zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin rtse gcig pa la bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu thul ba zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin rtse gcig pa la bya'o //
translated: because he is one who has attained one-pointedness of mind.üîΩHe is one who is endowed with wisdom,

original: shes rab dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab 'chal bar mi 'gyur ba'i yon tan dang 'byor cing ldan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab 'chal bar mi 'gyur ba'i yon tan dang 'byor cing ldan par gyur pa'o //
translated: because he is endowed with the qualities of non-delusion.üîΩThe four terms: swift wisdom,üîΩrapid wisdom,üîΩsharp wisdom,

original: shes rab myur ba dang / mgyogs pa dang / rno ba @77a * //
analyzed: shes rab myur ba dang / mgyogs pa dang / rno ba @77a * //
translated: and penetrating wisdom,

original: dang ; nges par byung ba zhes bya ba'i tshig bzhi po dag gis shes rab kyi rang bzhin bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: dang ; nges par byung ba zhes bya ba'i tshig bzhi po dag gis shes rab kyi rang bzhin bstan pa yin te /
translated: indicate the nature of wisdom.

original: myur zhing ches myur bar rab tu shes par byed pa'i phyir shes rab myur ba ste /
analyzed: myur zhing ches myur bar rab tu shes par byed pa'i phyir shes rab myur ba ste /
translated: Wisdom is swift because it is very quick to understand.

original: shes bya'i dngos po thag nye ba na yod pa 'gor pa med par shes par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: shes bya'i dngos po thag nye ba na yod pa 'gor pa med par shes par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: It is swift to understand things that are to be known, that is, it understands them without delay.

original: / yul las yul gzhan du myur bar 'pho bar byed pa'i phyir shes rab mgyogs pa'o //
analyzed: / yul las yul gzhan du myur bar 'pho bar byed pa'i phyir shes rab mgyogs pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is fast because it quickly moves from one object to another.

original: dmigs par bya ba ma lus par yongs su dag par byed pa'i phyir shes rab rno ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba ma lus par yongs su dag par byed pa'i phyir shes rab rno ba'o //
translated: Wisdom is sharp because it completely purifies all objects of observation.

original: dmigs par bya ba'i mthar thug par 'gro bar byed pa'i phyir shes rab kyis nges par byung ba'o //üîΩnges par 'byed pa'i shes rab can /üîΩshes rab che ba /üîΩshes rab yangs pa /
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba'i mthar thug par 'gro bar byed pa'i phyir shes rab kyis nges par byung ba'o // nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab can / shes rab che ba / shes rab yangs pa /
translated: Wisdom is definitive because it goes to the end of the objects of observation.üîΩThe six phrases beginning with ‚Äúwisdom of differentiation‚Äù indicate the classification of wisdom by object.üîΩWisdom is great because it is vast.

original: shes rab zab pa //
analyzed: shes rab zab pa //
translated: Wisdom is profound because it is deep.

original: shes rab mtshungs pa med pa /
analyzed: shes rab mtshungs pa med pa /
translated: Wisdom is unequaled because it is without equal.

original: shes rab rin po che dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tshig drug po dag gis yul gyis byas pa'i shes rab kyi dbye ba bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: shes rab rin po che dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tshig drug po dag gis yul gyis byas pa'i shes rab kyi dbye ba bstan pa yin te /
translated: Wisdom is endowed with the jewel of wisdom because it is the best of all wisdoms.
